verses.latin: CONFIRMATUS est igitur Salomon filius David in regno suo, et Dominus Deus ejus erat cum eo, et magnificavit eum in excelsum.
verses.english: So Solomon, David's son, was firmly established in his kingdom. The Lord his God was with him, and He elevated him to a position of supreme greatness.

verses.latin: ET præcepit Salomon universo Israël, tribunis et centurionibus, et ducibus, et judicibus omnis Israël, principibus familiarum.
verses.english: Then Solomon gave orders to all Israel, to the tribunes, centurions, leaders, and all the judges of Israel, and to the chiefs of the family clans.

verses.latin: IVITQUE cum universo multitudine in excelsum Gabaon, ubi erat tabernaculum fœderis Dei, quod fecit Moyses famulus Domini in solitudine.
verses.english: And he went with the entire assembly to the high place of Gibeon, where the Tabernacle of the Covenant of God was located, which Moses, the servant of the Lord, had made in the wilderness.

verses.latin: Arcam vero Dei adduxerat David de Cariathiarim in locum quem præparaverat ei, et ubi fixerant illi tabernaculum, hoc est in Jerusalem.
verses.english: But David had already brought the Ark of God from Kiriath-jearim to the place he had prepared for it, and where they had pitched a tent for it—that is, in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Altare quoque æneum, quod fabricatus fuerat Beseleel filius Uri filii Hur, ibi erat coram tabernaculo Domini: et consuluit illud Salomon et omnis ecclesia.
verses.english: Also, the bronze altar which Bezalel, son of Uri, son of Hur, had made, was there before the Tabernacle of the Lord. And Solomon and the entire assembly sought guidance from the Lord there.

verses.latin: ASCENDITQUE Salomon ad altare æneum coram tabernaculo fœderis Domini, et obtulit in eo holocaustorum mille.
verses.english: And Solomon went up to the bronze altar, which was before the Tabernacle of the Covenant of the Lord, and offered a thousand burnt offerings on it.

verses.latin: Ecce autem in illa nocte apparuit ei Deus, dicens: Postula quod vis, ut dem tibi.
verses.english: Then, during that very night, God appeared to him, saying: "Ask for whatever you wish, and I will give it to you."

verses.latin: Dixitque Salomon: Tu fecisti cum David patre meo misericordiam magnam, et dedisti mihi regem pro eo.
verses.english: And Solomon said: "You have shown great mercy to David my father, and You have made me king in his place."

verses.latin: Nunc ergo Domine Deus, impleatur sermo tuus quem locutus es David patri meo: siquidem tu me fecisti regem super populum tuum magnum, qui tam innumerabilis est quam pulvis terræ.
verses.english: Now therefore, O Lord God, let Your promise which You spoke to David my father be fulfilled. For You have made me king over Your great people, who are as innumerable as the dust of the earth.

verses.latin: Da mihi sapientiam et intelligentiam, ut ingrediar et egrediar coram populo tuo: tu enim judex es hujus populi tui multi.
verses.english: Grant me wisdom and understanding, so that I may properly lead and govern Your people. For You are the Judge of this vast multitude of Your people.

verses.latin: Dixit itaque Deus ad Salomonem: Quia obtulit cor tuum sermonem istum, et non postulasti divitias, et substantiam, et gloriam, neque animas eorum qui te oderant, sed nec dies vitæ plurimos: obtulisti autem sapientiam et scientiam ad judicandum populum meum, super quem constitui te regem:
verses.english: So God said to Solomon: "Because this desire was in your heart, and you did not ask for riches, possessions, or glory, nor the lives of those who hate you, nor even for many years of life; but instead you asked for wisdom and knowledge to judge My people, over whom I have made you king:

verses.latin: sapientia et scientia data sunt tibi: divitias autem et substantiam et gloriam dabo tibi, ita ut nullus in regibus nec ante te, nec post te fuerit similis tui.
verses.english: wisdom and knowledge are now given to you. Moreover, I will also give you riches, possessions, and glory, such that no king before you or after you will ever be your equal."

verses.latin: Venit ergo Salomon ab excelso Gabaon in Jerusalem coram tabernaculo testimonii, et regnavit super Israël.
verses.english: So Solomon returned from the high place of Gibeon to Jerusalem, and appeared before the Tabernacle of Testimony, and he reigned over Israel.

verses.latin: Congregavitque sibi currus et equites, et facti sunt ei mille quadringenti currus, et duodecim millia equitum: et fecit eos in urbibus quadrigarum, et cum rege in Jerusalem.
verses.english: He then gathered chariots and horsemen for himself, so that he had one thousand four hundred chariots and twelve thousand horsemen. He stationed them in the chariot cities and with the king in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecitque rex argentum et aurum in Jerusalem quasi lapides, et cedros quasi sycomoros quæ nascuntur in campestribus multitudine magna.
verses.english: The king made silver and gold as common as stones in Jerusalem, and cedars as abundant as the sycamore trees that grow in the plains.

verses.latin: Adducebantur autem ei equi de Ægypto, et de Coa, negotiatores regis emebant de Coa, et statuto pretio.
verses.english: Horses were also brought for him from Egypt and from Coa. The king's traders bought them from Coa at a set price.

verses.latin: Et ascenderunt atque evexerunt de Ægypto quadrigam sexcentis argenti siclis, et equum centum quinquaginta. Similiter universis regibus Hethæorum et Syriæ per manus eorum afferebantur.
verses.english: They would import a chariot from Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse for one hundred fifty. Likewise, through their hands, they were supplied to all the kings of the Hittites and the kings of Syria.

verses.latin: Decrevit igitur Salomon ædificare domum nomini Domini, et palatium sibi.
verses.english: King Solomon resolved to build a Temple for the Lord God, and also a palace for himself.

verses.latin: Et numeravit Salomon septuaginta millia virorum portantium onera, et octoginta millia cædentium lapides in montibus, præpositosque eorum tria millia sexcentos.
verses.english: So Solomon counted out 70,000 men to be burden-bearers, and 80,000 men to quarry stones in the mountains, along with 3,600 foremen to supervise them.

verses.latin: Misit quoque ad Hiram regem Tyri, dicens: Sicut egisti cum David patre meo, et misisti ei ligna cedrina ut ædificaret sibi domum, in qua et habitavit:
verses.english: He also sent a message to Hiram, king of Tyre, saying: "Just as you helped my father David and sent him cedar timbers to build a palace for himself, a dwelling where he lived,

verses.latin: ita fac mecun, ut ædificem domum nomini Domini Dei mei, ut consecrem eam, et adoleam coram ipso incensum aromaticum, et proponam semper panes propositionis, et holocauta mane et vespere, Sabbatis quoque et calendis, et solemnitatibus Domini Dei nostri in sempiternum. Hæc est enim lex Israel.
verses.english: do the same for me, so that I can build a Temple for the name of the Lord my God. I will consecrate it to Him, and before Him I will burn fragrant incense, and always set out the Bread of the Presence. I will offer burnt offerings morning and evening, and on Sabbaths, new moons, and the solemn feasts of the Lord our God for all time. For these are the required rituals of Israel."

verses.latin: Domus autem quam ædificare volo, magna est: magnus est enim Deus noster super omnes deos.
verses.english: "The Temple that I wish to build is magnificent, because our God is truly greater than all other gods."

verses.latin: Quis ergo poterit prævalere ut ædificet ei dignam domum? si cælum, et cælorum cæli, capere eum non possunt: quantus ego sum, ut possim ei ædificare domum? nisi ad hoc tantum, ut adoleatur incensum coram illo.
verses.english: "Who then could truly succeed in building a worthy Temple for Him? If the universe and the highest heavens cannot contain Him, how could I possibly build a house for Him? It is only to be a place for burning incense before Him."

verses.latin: Nunc ergo mitte mihi virum doctum, qui sciat operari in auro, et argento, ære, et ferro, purpura, et coccino, et hyacintho: et qui sciat sculpere cælatura, cum his artificibus quos mecum habeo in Judæa et Jerusalem, quos David pater meus præparavit.
verses.english: "Now, therefore, send me a skilled artisan who knows how to work with gold, silver, bronze, and iron, and with purple, scarlet, and blue dyes. He must also be skilled in all kinds of engraving, to work alongside the artisans I already have here in Judah and Jerusalem, whom my father David prepared."

verses.latin: Sed et de Libano mitte mihi ligna cedrina, et abiegna, et pinea: scio enim quod servi tui noverint cædere ligna in Libano: et erunt servi mei cum servis tuis,
verses.english: "Also, send me timbers of cedar, cypress, and pine from Lebanon, for I know that your servants are skilled in felling timber there. My servants will work alongside your servants,

verses.latin: ut parent mihi ligna plurima: domus enim quam ædificare volo, magna est valde et præclara.
verses.english: so that they can prepare a great quantity of timber for me. For the Temple that I plan to build will be exceedingly great and glorious."

verses.latin: Præbebo autem servis tuis cædentibus ligna, in cibaria tritici choros viginti millia, et hordei choros viginti millia, et vini viginti millia metretas, et olei viginti millia metretas.
verses.english: "Furthermore, I will provide your timber-cutting servants with provisions: 20,000 measures of wheat, 20,000 measures of barley, 20,000 measures of wine, and 20,000 measures of oil."

verses.latin: Respondit autem Hiram rex Tyri per litteras, quas misit ad Salomonem: Quia dilexit Dominus populum suum, idcirco te regnare fecit super eum.
verses.english: Then Hiram, king of Tyre, sent a letter in reply to Solomon, which said: "Because the Lord loves His people, He has made you king over them."

verses.latin: Et addidit, dicens: Benedictus Dominus Deus Israel, qui fecit cælum et terram, qui dedit David regi filium sapientem et eruditum, et plenum prudentia et intelligentia, ad ædificandam domum Domino, et palatium sibi.
verses.english: He added: "Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, who created the universe and the earth! He has given King David a wise and skilled son, full of discernment and understanding, to build a Temple for the Lord and a palace for himself."

verses.latin: Misi ergo tibi virum artificem et scientissimum, Hiram patrem meum,
verses.english: "Therefore I have sent you a highly skilled and knowledgeable artisan, Hiram—my master craftsman."

verses.latin: filium mulieris de filiabus Dan, cujus pater fuit Tyrius, qui novit operari in auro, et argento, ære, et ferro, et lapidibus, et lignis, et purpura, et hyacintho, et bysso, et coccino: et qui scit sculpere omne scalptile, et adinvenire prudenter quodcumque in opere necessarium est cum artificibus tuis, et cum artificibus domini mei David patris tui.
verses.english: "He is the son of a woman from the tribe of Dan, and his father was a Tyrian. He is skilled in working with gold, silver, bronze, iron, stone, and wood, and with purple, blue, fine linen, and scarlet fabrics. He also knows how to execute every kind of engraving and to skillfully devise whatever is needed for any work, alongside your artisans and the artisans of my lord David, your father."

verses.latin: Nunc ergo triticum, et hordeum, et oleum, et vinum, quæ pollicitus es, domine mi, mitte servis tuis.
verses.english: "Now then, my lord, send to your servants the wheat, barley, oil, and wine that you promised."

verses.latin: Nos autem cædemus ligna de Libano, quantum opus fuerit, et advehemus ea rati bus per mare in Joppe: tuum erit transferre ea in Jerusalem.
verses.english: "For our part, we will cut timber from Lebanon as much as is needed, and we will bring it in rafts by sea to Joppa. It will then be your responsibility to transport it from there to Jerusalem."

verses.latin: Numeravit igitur Salomon omnes viros advenas qui fuerant in terra Israel, post numerum quem numeravit David pater ejus: et inventi sunt centum quinquaginta tria millia sexcenti.
verses.english: So Solomon then took a census of all the foreign residents who were in the land of Israel, following the count that his father David had previously made, and he found there were 153,600 such men.

verses.latin: Et fecit ex eis septuaginta millia qui onera portarent, et octoginta millia qui cæderent lapides in montibus, tria vero millia et sexcentos præpositos operum populi.
verses.english: And from these men, he appointed 70,000 to be burden-bearers, 80,000 to quarry stones in the mountains, and 3,600 to serve as overseers for the work of the people.

verses.latin: Coepit ergo Salomon aedificare domum Domini in Jerusalem in monte Moria, qui demonstratus fuerat David patri ejus, in loco quem paraverat David in area Ornan Jebusaei.
verses.english: So King Solomon began to build the Temple of the Lord in Jerusalem, on Mount Moriah. This was the very site that had been revealed to his father David, in the exact place that David had prepared on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

verses.latin: Coepit autem aedificare mense secundo, anno quarto regni sui.
verses.english: He began to build in the second month of the fourth year of his reign.

verses.latin: Et haec sunt fundamenta quae jecit Salomon, ut aedificaret domum Dei: longitudinis cubitos in primis sexaginta, latitudinis cubitos viginti.
verses.english: These are the foundational measurements that King Solomon laid out for building the Temple of God: the length was sixty cubits, and the width was twenty cubits.

verses.latin: Porticus autem, quae erat ante, longitudinis juxta mensuram latitudinis domus cubitos viginti, et altitudinis centum viginti: et intrinsecus aurum purum operuit.
verses.english: The vestibule that was at the front of the Temple was twenty cubits long, matching the width of the main building, and its height was one hundred twenty cubits. He covered its interior with pure gold.

verses.latin: Domum quoque majorem texit tabulis ligneis de abietibus, et laminis auri purissimi decoravit, et sculpsit in ea palmas et quasi catenulas protuberantes.
verses.english: He covered the main Temple hall with fir wood planks, and he decorated it with plates of the purest gold. On these surfaces, he carved palm trees and ornamental chains in relief.

verses.latin: Jecit quoque pavimentum templi auro pretiosissimo, et superposuit tabulas per parietes.
verses.english: He also laid the floor of the Temple with the most precious gold, and he covered the walls with planks.

verses.latin: Texit quoque domum, et laquearia ejus, et postes, et ostia, auro, et scalpsit in eis cherubim.
verses.english: He covered the Temple building itself, along with its coffered ceilings, doorposts, and doors, with gold. And on these surfaces, he carved cherubim.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque domum Sancti Sanctorum: longitudinem juxta latitudinem domus cubitos viginti, et latitudinem similiter viginti cubitos: et laminis auri optimi texit, quasi talentis sexcentis.
verses.english: He also made the Most Holy Place. Its length was twenty cubits, matching the width of the main hall, and its width was likewise twenty cubits. He covered it with plates of the finest gold, using approximately six hundred talents of gold for this.

verses.latin: Clavos quoque aureos fecit, et ponderis singulorum clavorum quinquaginta siclos: et triclinia texit auro.
verses.english: He also made golden nails, each weighing fifty shekels. He covered the inner sections of the Temple with gold.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque cherubim duos de opere statuario in domo Sancti Sanctorum, et texit eos auro.
verses.english: He also made two sculpted cherubim in the Most Holy Place and covered them with gold.

verses.latin: Alarum cherubim, unius quidem viginti cubiti, ita ut una ala decem cubitos extenderet usque ad parietem domus, et altera ala decem cubitos tangeret alam cherub alterius.
verses.english: The wings of the cherubim each measured twenty cubits in total span. One wing, ten cubits long, stretched to touch the wall of the Temple, while the other wing, also ten cubits long, reached to touch the wing of the other cherub.

verses.latin: Cherub quoque alterius ala una decem cubitis pertingebat ad parietem, et altera decem cubitis alam cherub alterius tangebat.
verses.english: Similarly, one wing of the other cherub, ten cubits long, extended to the wall, and its other wing, also ten cubits long, touched the wing of the first cherub.

verses.latin: Ita ut alae amborum cherubim expansae, viginti cubitorum spatium obtinerent: ipsi vero stabant erectis pedibus, et facies eorum erant versae ad domum.
verses.english: Thus, the wings of both cherubim, when fully spread, spanned the entire twenty-cubit width of the Most Holy Place. The cherubim themselves stood upright on their feet, and their faces were turned towards the main hall of the Temple.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque velum ex hyacintho, et purpura, et cocco, et bysso, et intexuit illud varie, cherubim.
verses.english: He also made a veil of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine linen, and skillfully wove cherubim into its design.

verses.latin: Ante fores etiam templi fecit duas columnas triginta quinque cubitorum, et capitella earum quinque cubitorum.
verses.english: In front of the Temple entrance, he also made two columns, each thirty-five cubits high, with their capitals each five cubits high.

verses.latin: Catenulas quoque in oraculo fecit, et imposuit capitibus columnarum: malogranata etiam centum, quae catenulis interposuit.
verses.english: He also made chains for the embellishment of the Temple entrance and placed them on the tops of the columns. He also made one hundred pomegranates and interspersed them among the chains.

verses.latin: Has quoque columnas statuit in vestibulo templi, unam a dextris, et alteram a sinistris: et vocavit nomina earum, dextrae Jachin, et sinistrae Booz.
verses.english: He then set these columns in the Temple vestibule, one on the right side and the other on the left side. He named the column on the right 'Jachin', and the column on the left 'Boaz'.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque altare æneum viginti cubitorum longitudinis, et viginti cubitorum latitudinis, et decem cubitorum altitudinis.
verses.english: Solomon also made a bronze altar. It was twenty cubits (approximately 18 inches each) in length, twenty cubits in width, and ten cubits in height.

verses.latin: Et mare fusile decem cubitis a labio usque ad labium, rotundum per circuitum : quinque cubitis altitudinis, et funiculus triginta cubitorum circuibat gyrum ejus.
verses.english: Then he made the great Molten Sea (a large basin) for ritual washing. It was circular, ten cubits from rim to rim, and five cubits high. A measuring cord of thirty cubits could encompass its entire circumference.

verses.latin: Et similitudo boum subtus illud, et quædam sculpturæ novæ aspersæ. Deni per cubitum, loricam quasi ambientem mare.
verses.english: Beneath its rim were decorative figures resembling oxen. These new sculptures were cast as part of a continuous band encircling the Molten Sea, with ten figures per cubit of its circumference, forming a relief decoration.

verses.latin: Duodecim boves tenebant illud, quorum tres respiciebant ad Aquilonem, et tres ad Occidentem, et tres ad Meridiem, et tres ad Orientem : et mare super illos positum erat, posteriora autem eorum subitus mare.
verses.english: Twelve oxen supported the Molten Sea. Three of these oxen faced north, three faced west, three faced south, and three faced east. The Molten Sea rested upon their backs, with their hindquarters hidden beneath it.

verses.latin: Grossitudo autem ipsius quatuor digitorum erat : et labium ejus quasi labium calicis, et folium lilii, capiebatque tria millia metretarum.
verses.english: The walls of the Molten Sea were four fingers thick. Its rim was shaped like the rim of a cup, flaring out like a lily blossom. It was designed to hold three thousand liquid measures.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque conchas decem : et posuit quinque a dextris, et quinque a sinistris, ut lavarent in eis : et omnia quæ in holocaustum pertinent, illic purificarentur : mare autem erat sacerdotum, et levitarum.
verses.english: He also made ten lavers (smaller basins). He placed five of these lavers on the right side of the temple and five on the left. These were for washing the animals designated for burnt offerings, so that all parts pertaining to the sacrifice would be purified there. The large Molten Sea, however, was reserved for the ritual ablutions of the priests and Levites.

verses.latin: Fecit autem et candelabra aurea decem secundum formam quæ jusserat : et posuit ea in templo, quinque a dextris, et quinque a sinistris.
verses.english: Solomon also had ten golden candlesticks made, crafted according to the precise form God had commanded. He placed them within the temple, five on the right side and five on the left.

verses.latin: Sed et mensas decem fecit : et posuit in templo, quinque a dextris, et quinque a sinistris : phialas quoque aureas centum.
verses.english: He also made ten tables and placed them in the temple: five on the right and five on the left. In addition, he made one hundred golden bowls (or basins).

verses.latin: Fecit quoque atrium sacerdotum, et atrium magnum : et ostia in atrio, quæ texit ære.
verses.english: He also constructed the inner court for the priests, and the great outer court. The doors for these courts were covered with bronze.

verses.latin: Porro mare posuit a latere dextro in parte Orientis contra Austrum.
verses.english: Furthermore, he placed the Molten Sea on the right side of the temple, in the eastern part, facing south.

verses.latin: Fecit ergo Hiram lebetes, et scrofes, et phialas : et complevit omne opus regis in domo Dei.
verses.english: So Hiram, the master craftsman, made all the necessary pots, shovels, and basins. He completed all the work the king had entrusted him with for the House of God.

verses.latin: Columnas duas, et coronas, et capitella super capitella columnarum : et quasi quatuor retiacula ad operiendum duas coronas, et capitella quæ erant super capita columnarum.
verses.english: Hiram crafted the two large bronze pillars, along with their decorative crowns and chapiters, which were placed above the pillar tops. He also made four latticework networks, designed to cover both the two crowns and the chapiters that adorned the tops of the pillars.

verses.latin: Et malogranata quadringenta duobus retiaculis : ita ut bini ordines malogranatorum singulos in circuitu comprehenderent coronas, et capitella columnarum.
verses.english: Additionally, he made four hundred pomegranates for the two networks. These were arranged in two rows of pomegranates that encircled each of the crowns and the chapiters of the pillars.

verses.latin: Sed et bases fecit, et conchas, quas superposuit basibus.
verses.english: Moreover, Hiram made the movable stands for the lavers, and the lavers themselves, which were placed upon these stands.

verses.latin: Mare unum, et boves duodecim subter mare.
verses.english: He made the one large Molten Sea, along with the twelve oxen positioned beneath it.

verses.latin: Et lebetes, et scrofes, et fuscinulas : et vasa universa, quæ fecerat Hiram patri regis Salomonis in domo Domini, ex ære mundissimo.
verses.english: He also crafted the pots, shovels, and fleshhooks. All these vessels, which Hiram made for King Solomon for the House of the Lord, were fashioned from the purest bronze.

verses.latin: In omni regione Jordanis fudit ea rex in argillosa terra inter Socoth et Saredatha.
verses.english: The king cast these bronze items in the clay ground throughout the region of the Jordan, specifically between Succoth and Zeredah.

verses.latin: Fecitque Salomon omnia vasa hæc multa nimis : non enim poterat sciri æris pondus.
verses.english: Solomon had all these vessels made in exceedingly great quantity. Indeed, the total weight of the bronze could not be calculated.

verses.latin: Fecit ergo Salomon omnia vasa domus Dei, et altare aureum, et mensas, et super illas panes propositionis.
verses.english: So Solomon commissioned and had made all the furnishings for the House of God: the golden altar of incense, and the tables upon which the showbread (or bread of the Presence) was placed.

verses.latin: Et candelabra cum lucernis suis ut lucerent ante ostium oraculi juxta morem, ex auro purissimo.
verses.english: He also had the candlesticks made with their lamps, so that they might shine before the entrance of the inner sanctuary, according to the prescribed custom. These were made from the purest gold.

verses.latin: Et florentia quæque, et lucernas, et forcipes aureos, de auro purissimo.
verses.english: And he had all the decorative golden flowers (blossoms), and the lamps themselves, and the golden tongs made from the purest gold.

verses.latin: Et scyphos, et thuribula, et mortariola, et aurea ostia templi interioris ad sancta sanctorum, et ostia domus templi exterioris aurea : omnia quæ fecit Hiram in domo Domini.
verses.english: He also made the golden bowls, censers, and sprinkling basins. Additionally, he made the golden doors for the inner temple leading to the Holy of Holies, and the golden doors for the main entrance of the outer temple. All these things Hiram contributed to the making of for the House of the Lord.

verses.latin: Igitur perfectum est omne opus quod fecit Salomon in domo Domini: et intulit Salomon omnia quæ voverat David pater suus, argentum, et aurum, et universa vasa posuit in thesauros domus Dei.
verses.english: Thus, all the work that Solomon did for the house of the Lord was completed. And Solomon brought in all the things that his father David had dedicated—the silver, the gold, and all the various vessels—and placed them in the treasuries of the house of God.

verses.latin: Post hæc congregavit Salomon majores natu de Israël, et cunctos principes tribuum, et capita familiarum de filiis Israël in Jerusalem, ut afferrent arcam fœderis Domini de civitate David, quæ est Sion.
verses.english: After this, Solomon assembled the elders of Israel, all the chiefs of the tribes, and the heads of the families of the sons of Israel, in Jerusalem. He gathered them to bring up the ark of the covenant of the Lord from the City of David, which is Zion.

verses.latin: Venerunt itaque ad regem omnes viri Israël in die solemni mensis septimi.
verses.english: So all the men of Israel came together to the king on the solemn feast day of the seventh month.

verses.latin: Cumque venissent cuncti seniores Israël, portaverunt Levitæ arcam,
verses.english: When all the elders of Israel had arrived, the Levites carried the ark.

verses.latin: et intulerunt arcam, et tabernaculum testimonii, et omnia vasa sanctuarii quæ erant in tabernaculo: hæc portaverunt sacerdotes, et Levitæ.
verses.english: And they brought up the ark, and the tabernacle of the testimony, and all the sacred vessels that were in the tabernacle. The priests and the Levites carried these items.

verses.latin: Rex autem Salomon, et universus cœtus Israël, qui paratus fuerat ad eum coram arca, immolabant oves et boves absque ullo numero: tanta enim erat multitudo victimarum.
verses.english: But King Solomon, and the entire assembly of Israel who had gathered before him, in front of the ark, sacrificed sheep and oxen beyond all counting. For the multitude of the sacrificial offerings was so great.

verses.latin: Et intulerunt sacerdotes arcam fœderis Domini in locum suum, id est, ad oraculum domus, in Sanctum sanctorum subter alas cherubim.
verses.english: Then the priests brought the ark of the covenant of the Lord into its designated place—that is, into the inner sanctuary of the Temple, into the Holy of Holies, beneath the wings of the cherubim.

verses.latin: Sicut enim cherubim expandebant alas suas super locum arcæ, et protegebant arcam, et vectes ejus.
verses.english: For the cherubim spread out their wings over the place of the ark, thereby protecting both the ark itself and its carrying poles.

verses.latin: Vectium autem quibus portabatur arca, quia paululum longiores erant, apparebant capita eorum extra oraculum, quod est ante sanctuarium: et non eminere, alterius vero nullus apparebat. Fuit igitur arca ibi usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: Now, as for the poles by which the ark was carried, because they were somewhat long, their ends were visible from outside the inner sanctuary, from the place before the Holy Place, but they did not protrude further into view. The ends of the other poles were not visible at all. Therefore, the ark remained there until the present day.

verses.latin: Nihilque erat in arca, absque duabus tabulis quas posuerat Moyses in Horeb, quando legem dedit Dominus filiis Israël egredientibus ex Ægypto.
verses.english: There was nothing in the ark except the two tablets which Moses had placed there at Horeb. This was when the Lord gave the Law to the children of Israel as they were coming out of Egypt.

verses.latin: Egressi sunt autem sacerdotes de sanctuario: (omnes enim sacerdotes qui ibi esse potuerant, sanctificati fuerant, necum in eo tempore vices familiarum et ministeriorum observabantur)
verses.english: Now the priests departed from the sanctuary. All the priests who were present had sanctified themselves for service, for at that time, the division of families and their assigned ministries was not yet strictly observed.

verses.latin: tam Levitæ quam cantores, id est, qui sub Asaph, et Heman, et Idithun, et filiis, et fratribus eorum, vestiti byssinis, cymbalis, et psalteriis, et citharis concrepabant, stabant ad orientalem plagam altaris, et cum eis sacerdotes centum viginti, tubis clangentes.
verses.english: The Levites, who also served as singers—namely, those under Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun, along with their sons and their relatives—were dressed in fine linen. They stood with cymbals, psalteries, and harps, making music, positioned on the east side of the altar. With them were one hundred and twenty priests, blowing trumpets.

verses.latin: Itaque cunctis pariter, et tubis, et voce, et cymbalis, et organis, et diversi generis musicorum concinentibus, et vocem in sublime tollentibus, juxta ad melodias carminum, confitentibus Domino, quoniam bonus, quoniam in sæculum misericordia ejus: repleta est domus Domini nube majestatis Domini.
verses.english: So, when all of them were sounding in unison—with trumpets, and voices, and cymbals, and other instruments, and all sorts of musicians playing together—they raised their voices high according to the melodies of the songs. They were giving thanks to the Lord, saying 'For He is good, for His mercy endures forever.' Then the house of the Lord was filled with a cloud of the Lord's majesty—a visible manifestation of God’s glory.

verses.latin: Nec poterant sacerdotes stare et ministrare propter caliginem: complerat enim gloria Domini domum Dei.
verses.english: And the priests were not able to stand and minister there because of the dense cloud and darkness. For the glory of the Lord had completely filled the house of God.

verses.latin: Tunc ait Salomon: Dominus dixit ut habitaret in caligine.
verses.english: Then Solomon spoke, saying: “The Lord has indeed declared that He would dwell within thick, mysterious darkness.”

verses.latin: Ego autem aedificavi domum nomini tuo, ut habitares ibi in sempiternum.
verses.english: But I have built a sacred house to honor Your Name, so that Your presence may dwell there always and eternally.

verses.latin: Et convertit rex faciem suam, et benedixit omni multitudini Israël: omnisque multitudo Israël stabat.
verses.english: And the king turned his attention and faced the entire assembly of Israel, and he blessed them. All of the people of Israel were standing at this time.

verses.latin: Et ait: Benedictus Dominus Deus Israël, qui locutus est ore suo ad David patrem meum, et opere perfecit, dicens:
verses.english: And Solomon said: 'Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, who spoke with His own mouth to my father David, and has now fulfilled His promise through His actions, saying:'

verses.latin: A die qua eduxi populum meum de terra Ægypti, non elegi civitatem de cunctis tribubus Israël, ut ædificaretur in ea domus nomini meo: neque elegi virum, qui esset dux in populo meo Israël:
verses.english: 'From the day I led My people out of the land of Egypt, I did not choose any city from all the tribes of Israel for a house to be built in it for My Name. Nor did I choose any man to be a leader over My people, Israel.'

verses.latin: sed Jerusalem elegi, ut sit nomen meum ibi: et elegi David, ut præesset populo meo Israël.
verses.english: 'But I chose Jerusalem for My Name to be there always, and I chose David to rule over My people, Israel.'

verses.latin: Voluit quoque David pater meus ædificare domum nomini Domini Dei Israël:
verses.english: And my father David desired to build a house to honor the Name of the Lord, the God of Israel.

verses.latin: et dixit Dominus ad eum: Quia voluisti ædificare domum nomini meo, bene quidem fecisti hoc, eo quod tale quid in animo habuisti:
verses.english: However, the Lord said to him: 'Because you desired to build a house for My Name, you did well in having this intention in your heart.'

verses.latin: verumtamen tu non ædificabis domum, sed filius tuus, qui egredietur de lumbis tuis, ipse ædificabit domum nomini meo.
verses.english: 'Nevertheless, you yourself shall not build the house. Instead, your son, who will come forth from your body, he shall build the house for My Name.'

verses.latin: CompLevit itaque Dominus sermonem suum quem locutus fuerat: et ego surrexi pro David patre meo, et sedi super thronum Israël, sicut locutus est Dominus: et ædificavi domum nomini Domini Dei Israël.
verses.english: So the Lord has fulfilled His word which He had spoken. And I have risen up in place of my father David, and I sit upon the throne of Israel, just as the Lord had promised. And I have built this house for the Name of the Lord, the God of Israel.

verses.latin: Et posui in ea arcam, in qua est pactum Domini quod pepigit cum filiis Israël.
verses.english: And within this house, I have placed the Ark of the Covenant, in which is the covenant of the Lord that He made with the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Stetit ergo coram altari Domini contra universam multitudinem Israël, et extendit manus suas.
verses.english: Then Solomon stood before the altar of the Lord, facing the entire assembly of Israel, and he stretched out his hands.

verses.latin: Etenim fecerat Salomon basim æneam, et posuerat illam in medio atrii, habentem quinque cubitos longitudinis, et quinque cubitos latitudinis, et tres cubitos altitudinis: et stetit super eam, et flexis genibus contra universam multitudinem Israël, et manibus in cælum elevatis,
verses.english: For Solomon had previously built a bronze platform and placed it in the middle of the outer courtyard. This platform was five cubits long, five cubits wide, and three cubits high. Solomon then stood upon it, and before the entire assembly of Israel, he knelt down upon his knees and lifted his hands towards the sky.

verses.latin: et ait: Domine Deus Israël, non est similis tui Deus in cælo et in terra: qui custodis pactum et misericordiam cum servis tuis, qui ambulant coram te in toto corde suo:
verses.english: And he said: 'O Lord, God of Israel, there is no God like You, neither in the sky nor on the earth! You faithfully keep Your covenant and show mercy to Your servants who walk before You with all their heart.

verses.latin: qui præstitisti servo tuo David patri meo quæ locutus fueras ei, et opere perfecisti sicut et hodie probatur.
verses.english: You have fulfilled for Your servant David, my father, what You spoke to him, and You have brought it to pass through Your actions, just as it is proven this very day.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo Domine Deus Israël, custodi servo tuo David patri meo quæ locutus fueras, dicens: Non auferetur tibi vir de conspectu meo, qui sedeat super thronum Israël: ita tamen si custodierint filii tui vias meas, et ambulaverint in lege mea, sicut et tu ambulasti coram me.
verses.english: Now therefore, O Lord, God of Israel, keep for Your servant David, my father, what You spoke to him, saying: “There shall never fail to be a man from you before My sight, who sits upon the throne of Israel, provided that your sons guard My ways and walk in My law, just as you have walked before Me.”'

verses.latin: Et nunc Domine Deus Israël, firmetur sermo tuus quem locutus es servo tuo David.
verses.english: 'And now, O Lord, God of Israel, let Your word be confirmed, which You spoke to Your servant David.'

verses.latin: Ergone putandum est quod vere habitet Deus cum hominibus super terram? Si enim cælum et cæli cælorum non te capiunt: quanto magis domus hæc, quam ædificavi?
verses.english: 'But is it truly to be believed that God would actually dwell with human beings upon the earth? For if the sky and the highest heavens cannot contain You, how much less can this house that I have built?'

verses.latin: Sed ad hoc tantum facta est, ut respicias ad orationem servi tui, et obsecrationem ejus Domine Deus meus, et audias hymnum et orationem, quam servus tuus orat coram te:
verses.english: 'However, this house has been built only for this purpose: that You would look upon the prayer of Your servant and his supplication, O Lord, my God, and that You would hear the praise and the prayer that Your servant prays before You.'

verses.latin: ut sint oculi tui aperti super domum hanc die ac nocte, super locum in quo pollicitus es ut invocaretur nomen tuum,
verses.english: 'May Your eyes be open upon this house day and night, upon this place where You promised that Your Name would be invoked.'

verses.latin: ut exaudias preces quas servus tuus, et populus tuus Israël orat in loco isto: et exaudi de habitaculo tuo sublimi, de cælo, et cum exaudieris, propitius esto.
verses.english: 'May You hear the prayers that Your servant and Your people Israel pray in this place. And hear us from Your exalted dwelling place, from the very sky, and when You hear us, be merciful.'

verses.latin: Si peccaverit vir in proximum suum, et adjuratione constrictus, juraverit super eum, et venerit unusquisque ad altare tuum in domum hanc, et ibi se execratus fuerit:
verses.english: 'If a man sins against his neighbor, and an oath is imposed upon him, compelling him to swear against himself, and each one comes to Your altar in this house, and there curses himself to attest to his innocence;'

verses.latin: tu audies de cælo, et facies judicium, et judicabis servos tuos, reddens iniquo viam suam, et justum justificans, et retribuens ei secundum justitiam suam.
verses.english: 'then You shall hear from the sky, and You shall execute judgment. You will judge Your servants, returning to the wicked man his own way, and justifying the righteous man, repaying him according to his own justice.'

verses.latin: Si irruerit hostis super populum tuum Israël, et hi conversi ad te, deprecati te fuerint in domo hac, confessi nomini tuo:
verses.english: 'If an enemy attacks Your people Israel, and they turn to You and supplicate You in this house, confessing Your Name;'

verses.latin: tu exaudies de cælo, et propitius esto peccatis populi tui Israël, et redux eos in terram quam dedisti patribus eorum.
verses.english: 'then You shall hear from the sky, and be merciful to the sins of Your people Israel, and bring them back into the land that You gave to their fathers.'

verses.latin: Si clauso cælo pluvia non fluxerit propter peccata eorum, et deprecati te fuerint in loco isto, et confessi nomini tuo, et conversi a peccatis suis, cum eos afflixeris:
verses.english: 'If the sky is closed, and rain does not fall because of their sins, and they supplicate You in this place, and confess Your Name, and turn from their sins, when You have afflicted them;'

verses.latin: tu exaudies de cælo, Domine, et propitius esto peccatis servis tuis et Israël populi tui, et doce eos viam bonam per quam ambulare debeant: et da pluviis terram tuam, quam dedisti populo tuo ad possidendum.
verses.english: 'then You shall hear from the sky, O Lord, and be merciful to the sins of Your servants and of Your people Israel, and teach them the good way in which they ought to walk. And give rain to Your land, which You gave to Your people as a possession.'

verses.latin: Fames si oborta fuerit in terra, et pestilentia, ærugo, et aurugo, et locustæ, et bruchus, et hostes vastatis regionibus terminis eorum obsederint civitates: omnem plagam, et infirmitatem.
verses.english: 'If there is famine in the land, or pestilence, blight, mildew, locusts, or caterpillars; or if enemies lay waste to their regions and besiege their cities at their borders: whatever plague, whatever infirmity they suffer.'

verses.latin: Si oraverit quispiam, et fuerit deprecatio ab omni homine, et universo populo tuo Israël, cognoscens unusquisque plagam suam et infirmitatem suam: et expanderit manus suas in domo hac:
verses.english: 'If anyone prays, and there is a supplication from any man, or from all of Your people Israel, each person knowing his own plague and his own infirmity, and extends his hands towards this house;'

verses.latin: tu exaudies de cælo, de excelso scilicet habitaculo tuo, et propitius eris, et reddes unicuique secundum vias suas, quas nosti in corde ejus: quia tu solus nosti corda filiorum hominum:
verses.english: 'then You shall hear from the sky, indeed, from Your exalted dwelling place, and You will be merciful. You will repay each person according to his own ways, which You know in his heart, because You alone know the hearts of the children of men.'

verses.latin: ut timeant te, et ambulent in viis tuis cunctis diebus quibus vivunt super faciem terræ, quam dedisti patribus nostris.
verses.english: 'This is so they may fear You and walk in Your ways all the days that they live upon the face of the earth, which You gave to our fathers.'

verses.latin: Siquidem et alienigena, qui non est de populo tuo Israël, si venerit de terra longinqua propter nomen tuum grande, et propter manum tuam robustam, et brachium tuum extentum, et adoraverit in loco isto:
verses.english: 'Furthermore, if a foreigner, who is not of Your people Israel, comes from a distant land because of Your great Name, and because of Your strong hand, and Your outstretched arm, and worships in this place;'

verses.latin: tu exaudies de cælo firmissimo habitaculo tuo, et facies omnia quæ rogat te ille alienigena: ut sciant omnes populi terræ nomen tuum, et timeant te sicut populus tuus Israël, et cognoscant quia nomen tuum invocatum est super domum hanc, quam ædificavi.
verses.english: 'then You shall hear from the most secure sky, Your dwelling place, and You shall do everything that foreigner asks of You. This is so that all the peoples of the earth may know Your Name and fear You, just as Your people Israel do, and acknowledge that Your Name is invoked over this house which I have built.'

verses.latin: Si egressus fuerit populus tuus ad bellum contra adversarios suos per viam in qua mittes eos, et oraverint te contra viam hanc, in qua civitas hæc est, quam elegisti, et domus quam ædificavi nomini tuo:
verses.english: 'If Your people go out to war against their adversaries by the way in which You send them, and they pray to You facing this way, towards this city which You have chosen, and the house which I have built for Your Name;'

verses.latin: tu exaudies de cælo orationem eorum et preces, et facies judicium.
verses.english: 'then You shall hear their prayer and supplications from the sky, and You shall execute judgment.'

verses.latin: Si peccaverint tibi (neque enim est homo qui non peccet) et iratus fueris eis, et tradideris illos hostibus, et captivi ducantur in terram longinquam, vel juxta:
verses.english: 'If they sin against You (for there is no human being who does not sin), and You become angry with them and deliver them to their enemies, and they are led captive into a distant land or a nearby one;'

verses.latin: et conversi in corde suo in terra ad quam captivi ducti fuerant, egerint pœnitentiam, et deprecati te fuerint in terra captivitatis suæ, dicentes: Peccavimus, inique fecimus, injuste egimus:
verses.english: 'and if they turn in their heart in the land to which they were led captive, and do penance, and supplicate You in the land of their captivity, saying: “We have sinned, we have acted wickedly, we have done unjustly”;'

verses.latin: et reversi fuerint ad te in toto corde suo, et tota anima sua, in terra captivitatis suæ ad quam ducti sunt, et adoraverint te contra viam terræ suæ, quam dedisti patribus eorum, et civitatis quam elegisti, et domus quam ædificavi nomini tuo:
verses.english: 'and if they return to You with all their heart and all their soul, in the land of their captivity to which they were led, and they worship You facing the way of their land which You gave to their fathers, and the city which You have chosen, and the house which I have built for Your Name;'

verses.latin: tu exaudies de cælo, de firmissimo scilicet habitaculo tuo, orationem eorum, et preces, et facies judicium, et propitius eris populo tuo, quamvis peccatori.
verses.english: 'then You shall hear their prayer and supplications from the sky, indeed, from Your most secure dwelling place, and You shall execute judgment, and You will be merciful to Your people, even though they are sinners.'

verses.latin: Nunc Domine Deus meus, apertos sint, quæso, oculi tui, et aures tuæ intentæ ad orationem quæ fit in loco isto.
verses.english: 'Now, O Lord, my God, I beseech You, let Your eyes be open, and Your ears attentive to the prayer that is made in this place.'

verses.latin: Cum complesset ergo Salomon fundens preces, ignis de caelo descendit, et consumpsit holocausta et victimas: et majestas Domini implevit domum.
verses.english: When Solomon had finished offering his prayers, a great fire came down from the sky. This fire consumed the burnt offerings and all the other sacrifices, and the Lord's glory filled the Temple.

verses.latin: Nec poterant sacerdotes ingredi templum Domini, eo quod implevisset majestas Domini templum.
verses.english: The priests were unable to enter the Lord's Temple, because the magnificent glory of the Lord had completely filled the entire Temple.

verses.latin: Sed et omnes filii Israel videbant descendentem ignem, et gloriam Domini super domum: et curvati in faciem suam super humum, adoraverunt et laudaverunt Dominum: Quoniam bonus, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: All the children of Israel also saw the fire come down and the Lord's glory resting upon the Temple. They bowed low, with their faces to the ground, and adored and praised the Lord, exclaiming: 'He is good, and His mercy endures for all eternity!'

verses.latin: Rex autem et omnis populus immolabant victimas coram Domino.
verses.english: Then King Solomon and all the people began to offer sacrifices before the Lord.

verses.latin: Immolavit igitur rex Salomon hostias boum viginti duo millia, ovium centum viginti millia: et dedicavit domum Dei rex et universus populus.
verses.english: So King Solomon offered as sacrifices twenty-two thousand oxen and one hundred twenty thousand sheep. In this way, the king and all the people dedicated the Temple of God.

verses.latin: Sacerdotes autem stabant in officiis suis: et Levitae in organis Domini, quae fecit rex David ad laudandum Dominum, Quoniam in aeternum misericordia ejus: hymnos David per manus suas canentes: porro sacerdotes clangentibus tubis ante eos, et omnis Israel stabat.
verses.english: The priests stood in their appointed places, and the Levites were there with the musical instruments of the Lord that King David had made to praise the Lord with the hymn 'For His mercy endures forever.' The Levites were singing David's hymns with their instruments, while the priests blew trumpets before them. All of Israel stood reverently during this.

verses.latin: Sanctificavit quoque Salomon medium atrii, quod erat ante templum Domini: obtulerat enim ibi holocausta, et adipes pacificorum: quia non poterat altare aeneum, quod fecerat Salomon, sustinere holocausta et sacrificia et adipes.
verses.english: Solomon also consecrated the middle section of the courtyard, the part directly in front of the Lord's Temple. This was because he had offered burnt offerings there, along with the fat from the peace offerings, as the bronze altar Solomon had made was not large enough to hold all the burnt offerings, sacrifices, and fat.

verses.latin: Fecit ergo Salomon solemnitatem in tempore illo septem diebus, et omnis Israel cum eo, turba magna nimis a Naim introitus Emath usque ad flumen Ægypti.
verses.english: So Solomon celebrated a great feast for seven days at that time, and all Israel was with him—a vast multitude gathered from the far northern entrance of Hamath down to the River of Egypt in the south.

verses.latin: Fecitque die octavo collectam, eo quod dedicationem altaris peregissent septem diebus, et solemnitatem diebus aliis septem.
verses.english: On the eighth day, they held a solemn assembly. This was after they had spent seven days completing the dedication of the altar, and then another seven days celebrating the feast.

verses.latin: Igitur in die vigesimo tertio mensis septimi dimisit populos in tabernacula sua, laetantes et hilaros super bono quod fecerat Dominus Davidi, et Salomoni, et Israeli populo suo.
verses.english: So, on the twenty-third day of the seventh month, Solomon sent the people away to their homes. They were full of joy and cheer, grateful for all the good the Lord had done for David, for Solomon, and for His people, Israel.

verses.latin: Complevitque Salomon domum Domini, et domum regis: et omne quod disposuerat in corde suo ut faceret in domo Domini, et in domo sua, prospera cuncta perfecit.
verses.english: Solomon thus completed the Lord's Temple and his own royal palace. Everything he had planned in his heart to build for the Lord's Temple and for his own house, he successfully brought to a prosperous completion.

verses.latin: Apparuit autem ei Dominus nocte, et ait: Audivi orationem tuam, et elegi locum istum mihi in domum sacrificii.
verses.english: The Lord appeared to Solomon during the night and said: 'I have heard your prayer, and I have chosen this very place for Myself to be a house of sacrifice.'

verses.latin: Si clausero caelum, et pluvia non fluxerit, et mandavero et praecepero locustae ut devoret terram, et misero pestilentiam in populum meum:
verses.english: If I were to close up the sky so that no rain falls, or if I were to command the locusts to devour the earth, or if I were to send a plague among My people, these would be the consequences of their actions.

verses.latin: convertus fuerit populus meus, super quos invocatum est nomen meum, deprecatus me, et quaesierit faciem meam, et egerit poenitentiam a viis suis pessismis: et ego exaudiam de caelo, et propitius ero peccatis eorum, et sanabo terram eorum.
verses.english: If My people, who are called by My name, turn away from their wicked ways, and pray to Me, and seek My face, and repent, then I will hear them from My dwelling place above. I will forgive their sins, and I will heal their land.

verses.latin: Oculi quoque mei erunt aperti, et aures meae erectae ad orationem ejus qui in loco isto oraverit.
verses.english: My eyes will also be open, and My ears attentive to the prayer of anyone who prays in this very place, the Temple.

verses.latin: Elegi enim, et sanctificavi locum istum, ut sit nomen meum ibi in sempiternum, et oculi mei et cor meum perseverent ibi cunctis diebus.
verses.english: For I have chosen and sanctified this place, so that My name may be there forever. My eyes and My heart will remain there perpetually.

verses.latin: Tu quoque si ambulaveris coram me, sicut ambulavit David pater tuus, et feceris omnia quae praecepi tibi, et justificaveris judicia mea et praecepta mea:
verses.english: As for you, if you walk before Me just as David your father walked, and you do everything I have commanded you, and you uphold My judgments and My commandments, then I will bless your reign.

verses.latin: suscitabo tibi solium regni tui, sicut pollicitus sum David patri tuo, dicens: Non auferetur de stirpe tua vir de Israel.
verses.english: I will establish your royal throne, just as I promised David your father, saying: 'There shall never fail a man of your lineage to rule over Israel.'

verses.latin: Si autem aversi fueritis, et dereliqueritis mandata mea, et caeremonias meas, quas proposui vobis, et abeuntes servieritis diis alienis, et adoraveritis eos:
verses.english: But if you turn away and forsake My commandments and My sacred ceremonies, which I have given you, and instead go and serve foreign gods and worship them, then dire consequences will follow.

verses.latin: evellam vos de terra mea, quam dedi vobis: et domum hanc, quam sanctificavi nomini meo, projiciam a facie mea, et ponam illam in proverbium, et in fabulam cunctis populis.
verses.english: I will uproot you from My land, which I have given to you. And this Temple, which I have sanctified for My name, I will cast away from My sight. I will make it a proverb and a byword among all nations.

verses.latin: Et domus haec erit in proverbium cunctis transeuntibus, et dicent: Quare fecit Dominus sic terrae huic, et domui huic?
verses.english: And this Temple will become a proverb to all who pass by. They will say: 'Why has the Lord done this to this land and to this Temple?'

verses.latin: Et respondebunt: Quia dereliquerunt Dominum Deum patrum suorum, qui eduxit illos de terra Aegypti, et apprehenderunt deos alienos, et adoraverunt illos, et coluerunt: idcirco venerunt super eos universa mala haec.
verses.english: And the answer will be: 'Because they abandoned the Lord God of their fathers, who led them out of the land of Egypt. They embraced foreign gods, worshipped them, and served them. That is why all these terrible evils have come upon them.'

verses.latin: Post viginti autem annos, ex quibus ædificavit Salomon domum Domini et domum suam,
verses.english: After twenty years, during which King Solomon built the Lord's Temple and his own royal palace,

verses.latin: civitates quas dederat Hiram Salomoni ædificavit, et habitare ibi fecit filios Israël.
verses.english: King Solomon then rebuilt the cities that King Hiram had given to him, and he settled the people of Israel there.

verses.latin: Abiit quoque in Emath Suba, et obtinuit eam.
verses.english: King Solomon also went to Hamath-Zobah and took possession of it.

verses.latin: Ædificavitque Thadmor in deserto, et universas civitates repertorum, quas extruxerat in Emath.
verses.english: He built up Tadmor in the desert, as well as all the store cities that he had established in Hamath.

verses.latin: Ædificavitque Bethoron superiorem, et Bethoron inferiorem, munita oppida, habentia muros et portas et vectes,
verses.english: He also rebuilt Upper Beth-Horon and Lower Beth-Horon, fortifying them as cities with walls, gates, and strong bars for security.

verses.latin: Balaath etiam, et omnes urbes firmissimas quæ fuerunt Salomonis, cunctasque urbes curruum, et urbes equitum, et universa quæ placuerunt Salomoni ut ædificaret in Jerusalem, et in Libano, et in omni terra potestatis suæ.
verses.english: He likewise rebuilt Baalath and all the other fortified cities that belonged to King Solomon. He built all the cities for his chariots, the cities for his cavalry, and everything else that King Solomon desired to build in Jerusalem, in Lebanon, and throughout all the lands under his control.

verses.latin: Omnem populum qui residuus fuerat de Hethæis, et Amorrhæis, et Pherezæis, et Hevæis, et Jebusæis, qui non erant de stirpe Israël,
verses.english: All the people who remained from the Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites—those who were not from the lineage of Israel—

verses.latin: quorum filii erant qui derelicti fuerant in terra, quosque non interfecerunt filii Israël, fecit Salomon tributarios usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: whose descendants were left in the land, and whom the people of Israel had not destroyed completely—King Solomon made them perform forced labor, and they continue to pay tribute to this very day.

verses.latin: De filiis autem Israël non posuit ut servirent operibus regiis: ipsi enim erant viri bellatores, et principes ducum, et præfecti curruum, et equitum ejus.
verses.english: However, King Solomon did not make any of the people of Israel perform such forced royal labor. For they were his soldiers, his chief officers, his commanders of chariots, and his cavalry.

verses.latin: Omnes vero principes exercitus regis Salomonis, fuerunt ducenti quinquaginta, qui erudiebant populum.
verses.english: All the chief officers of King Solomon's army numbered two hundred fifty men, and these were the ones who instructed the people.

verses.latin: Filiam vero Pharaonis adduxit de civitate David in domum quam ædificaverat ei: dixit enim Rex: Non habitabit uxor mea in domo David regis Israël: eo quod sanctificata sit, quia ingressa est in eam arca Domini.
verses.english: King Solomon brought Pharaoh's daughter from the City of David into the royal palace he had built for her. For the king said: "My wife must not live in the house of King David of Israel, because that place is made holy, for the Ark of the Lord has entered it."

verses.latin: Tunc obtulit Salomon holocausta Domino super altare Domini, quod extruxerat ante porticum:
verses.english: Then King Solomon offered burnt offerings to the Lord upon the Lord's altar, which he had built in front of the Temple portico.

verses.latin: ut singula dierum præcepta complerentur juxta ritum et sabbata, et neomenias, et dies solemnes, ter per annum, id est, in solemnitate azymorum, et in solemnitate hebdomadarum, et in solemnitate tabernaculorum.
verses.english: He did this so that the daily prescribed offerings would be fulfilled according to the ritual requirements for the Sabbaths, the New Moons, and the three annual solemn feasts: namely, the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Tabernacles.

verses.latin: Et constituit juxta dispositionem David patris sui sacerdotes in officiis suis, et levitas in ordinibus suis, ut laudarent et ministrarent coram sacerdotibus juxta ritum uniuscujusque diei: et janitores in divisionibus suis per portam et portam: sic enim præceperat David homo Dei.
verses.english: He appointed the priests to their designated duties according to the arrangement of his father, King David, and the Levites to their various orders, to offer praise and to minister before the priests according to the ritual of each day. He also appointed the gatekeepers to their divisions for each gate, for so had David, the man of God, commanded.

verses.latin: Nec prætergressi sunt de mandatis regis super sacerdotes et levitas, cuncta quæ præceperat, tam in arcis, quam in singulis diebus.
verses.english: The priests and Levites did not deviate from any of the king's commands concerning all that he had ordered, whether for the treasuries or for the daily service.

verses.latin: Itaque omne opus Salomonis perfectum est ex die, qua fundata est domus Domini, usque in diem, quo consummata est.
verses.english: Thus, all of King Solomon's work was completed, from the day the Lord's Temple was founded until the day it was finished.

verses.latin: Tunc abiit Salomon in Asiongaber, et in Ælath, ad oram maris Rubri, quæ est in terra Idumæa.
verses.english: At that time, King Solomon went to Ezion-geber and to Elath, which are on the shore of the Red Sea in the land of Edom.

verses.latin: Misitque ei Hiram naves per manus servorum suorum, et nautas gnaros maris: qui cum servis Salomonis perrexerunt in Ophir, et sumptis inde talentis auri quadringentis quinquaginta, attulerunt ad regem Salomonem.
verses.english: King Hiram then sent ships to King Solomon by the hand of his servants, along with sailors who were skilled in seafaring. These sailors, with King Solomon's servants, went to Ophir and brought back from there four hundred fifty talents of gold, which they delivered to King Solomon.

verses.latin: Regina autem Saba, audita fama Salomonis, venit ut tentaret eum in ænigmatibus in Jerusalem, cum magnis opibus, et camelis, qui portabant aromata, et auri plurimum, et gemmas pretiosas. Cumque venisset ad Salomonem, locuta est ei quæcumque habebat in corde suo.
verses.english: The Queen of Sheba, having heard of King Solomon’s great fame and wisdom, came to Jerusalem to test him with many difficult questions. She arrived with a magnificent procession, including camels carrying a vast amount of spices, very much gold, and many precious jewels. When she was brought before Solomon, she spoke to him about everything she had pondered in her heart.

verses.latin: Exposuit autem illi Salomon omnia, quæ proposuerat: nec fuit aliquid, quod in sermone illi respondisset non clare.
verses.english: But King Solomon explained to her every question she had presented. There was nothing he did not answer clearly, showing his great wisdom.

verses.latin: Vidit ergo regina Saba sapientiam Salomonis, et domum, quam ædificaverat,
verses.english: Therefore, the Queen of Sheba personally observed the profound wisdom of King Solomon. She also saw the magnificent royal palace that he had built for himself.

verses.latin: et cibos mensæ ejus, et habitacula servorum ejus, et officia ministrorum illius, et vestimenta eorum, et pincernas, et vestimenta eorum, et holocaustas, quas immolabat in domo Domini: et obstupuit, et ultra non habebat spiritum.
verses.english: She observed the lavish food served at his royal table, the orderly living quarters of his servants, the meticulous service and splendid clothing of his ministers, and the excellent service and attire of his cupbearers. She also witnessed the magnificent burnt offerings that King Solomon regularly presented in the Temple of the Lord. All these sights were so overwhelming that she was left utterly astonished and completely breathless.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad regem: Verus est sermo, quem audieram in terra mea de virtutibus tuis atque sapientia.
verses.english: She then said to the king: “The report I heard in my own land concerning your accomplishments and your wisdom is truly accurate.

verses.latin: Non credebam narrantibus, donec ipsa veni, et vidi oculis meis, et probavi quod media pars sapientiæ tuæ mihi non fuerat nuntiata: vicisti famam rebus tuis.
verses.english: I did not believe those who told me, until I came myself and saw with my own eyes. Now I see that not even half of your wisdom had been reported to me; your actual achievements far exceed your reputation.”

verses.latin: Beati viri tui, et beatæ servæ tuæ, qui stant coram te omni tempore, et audiunt sapientiam tuam.
verses.english: Blessed are your men who serve you, and blessed are your female servants who always stand before you and listen to your wisdom. They are truly fortunate.

verses.latin: Sit Dominus Deus tuus benedictus, qui voluit te ordinare super thronum suum, regem Domini Dei tui: ut facias judicium et justitiam.
verses.english: May the Lord your God be blessed, for He was pleased to place you upon His throne, making you king for the Lord your God. He has done this so you may execute judgment and administer justice for His people.

verses.latin: Dedit ergo regi centum viginti talenta auri, et aromata multa nimis, et gemmas pretiosissimas: non fuerunt tanta aromata, quanta dedit regina Saba Salomoni.
verses.english: Then she gave the king one hundred and twenty talents of gold, an extremely large quantity of spices, and many very precious gems. Never before had there been such a great quantity of spices as the Queen of Sheba gave to Solomon.

verses.latin: Sed et servi Hiram, cum servis Salomonis, attulerunt aurum de Ophir, et ligna thyina, et gemmas pretiosissimas:
verses.english: Moreover, Hiram’s servants, along with Solomon’s own servants, brought gold from Ophir. They also brought sandalwood — a very fine timber — and highly valuable gems.

verses.latin: de quibus fecit rex gradus in domo Domini, et in regia, et citharas, et psalteria cantoribus: numquam visa sunt in terra Juda talia.
verses.english: From this precious timber, the king made steps for the Temple of the Lord and for the royal palace. He also made lyres and harps for the musicians. Nothing like these had ever been seen before in the land of Judah.

verses.latin: Rex autem Salomon dedit reginæ Saba omnia quæ voluit, et quæ petivit a se: absque his, quæ attulerat ad eum. Quæ reversa est, et abiit in terram suam cum servis suis.
verses.english: King Solomon also gave the Queen of Sheba everything she desired and requested from him, in addition to what she had brought to him as gifts. After receiving these, she returned and departed to her own land with her servants.

verses.latin: Erat autem pondus auri, quod afferebatur Salomoni per annos singulos, sexcenta sexaginta sex talenta auri:
verses.english: Now, the weight of the gold that was brought to Solomon each year amounted to six hundred and sixty-six talents of gold.

verses.latin: extra id, quod laici, et negotiatores afferebant, et omnes reges Arabiæ, et satrapæ terrarum, qui comportabant aurum et argentum Salomoni.
verses.english: This was in addition to what laypeople and merchants brought, and what all the kings of Arabia and the governors of various lands contributed by bringing gold and silver to Solomon.

verses.latin: Fecit igitur Salomon ducentas hastas aureas, sexcentorum aureorum unam hastam:
verses.english: So King Solomon made two hundred large shields — or spears — of beaten gold. Each one contained six hundred shekels of gold.

verses.latin: et trecenta scuta aurea trecentorum aureorum singula: et posuit ea rex in armario, quod vocabatur Libani silva.
verses.english: He also made three hundred smaller shields of beaten gold; each of these contained three hundred shekels of gold. The king placed these in the armory that was known as the House of the Forest of Lebanon.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque rex solium eburneum grande, et vestivit illud auro mundissimo.
verses.english: The king also made a large ivory throne, which he overlaid with the purest gold.

verses.latin: Sex quoque gradus erant in solio, et scabellum aureum, et brachia utraque parte, et duæ statuæ leonum stabant juxta brachia:
verses.english: There were six steps leading up to the throne. There was also a golden footstool permanently attached to the throne. It had armrests on both sides, and two statues of lions stood beside these armrests.

verses.latin: et duodecim leunculi stantes super sex gradus ex utraque parte: non fuit tale opus in universis regnis.
verses.english: Additionally, twelve lion cubs stood on the six steps, one on each side of each step. There was no throne like it in any of the kingdoms of the world.

verses.latin: Omnia quoque vasa convivii regis Salomonis, ex auro erant: et universa supellex domus silvæ Libani, ex auro purissimo: argentum enim in diebus illis pro nihilo putabatur.
verses.english: All the drinking vessels used for King Solomon’s banquets were made of gold. And all the utensils and furnishings in the House of the Forest of Lebanon were made of pure gold. In those days, silver was considered to be of no value.

verses.latin: Siquidem naves regis ibant in Tharsis cum servis Hiram semel in annis tribus: deferentes inde aurum, et argentum, et ebur, et simias, et pavos.
verses.english: This was because the king’s ships sailed to Tarshish with Hiram’s servants once every three years. From there, they brought back gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.

verses.latin: Magnificatus est igitur rex Salomon super omnes reges terræ divitiis et sapientia.
verses.english: So King Solomon became greater than all the kings of the earth in both his immense wealth and his profound wisdom.

verses.latin: Omnesque reges terrarum desiderabant faciem Salomonis, ut audirent sapientiam, quam dederat Deus in corde ejus.
verses.english: All the kings of the earth sought to meet Solomon personally, so they could hear the wisdom that God had placed in his heart.

verses.latin: Et singuli deferebant ei munera, vasa argentea et aurea, et vestes, et arma, et aromata, et equos, et mulos per singulos annos.
verses.english: Each one of them brought him gifts: articles of silver and gold, splendid garments, weapons, spices, horses, and mules, year after year.

verses.latin: Habuit quoque Salomon quadraginta millia equorum in stabulis, et curruum totidem, et duodecim millia equestrium, qui erant in urbibus quadrigarum, et cum rege in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Solomon also had forty thousand stalls for his horses and chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen. These were stationed in the chariot cities and also with the king in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et imperabat cunctis regibus a fluvio Eufrate usque ad terram Philisthinorum, et usque ad fines Ægypti.
verses.english: He ruled over all the kings from the Euphrates River, extending as far as the land of the Philistines, and all the way to the borders of Egypt.

verses.latin: Fecitque ut in Jerusalem esset argentum quasi lapides: et cedri instar sycomororum, quæ nascuntur in campestribus multitudine magna.
verses.english: The king made silver as common in Jerusalem as ordinary stones. And he made cedar wood as abundant as the sycamore trees that grow in great numbers in the lowlands.

verses.latin: Afferebantur autem ei equi de Ægypto, et de cunctis regionibus.
verses.english: Horses were brought to him from Egypt and from all other regions.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem gestorum Salomonis priorum et novissimorum scripta sunt in verbis Nathan prophetæ, et in libris Ahiæ Silonitis, et in visione Addo videntis, super Jeroboam filium Nabat.
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Solomon, both his early and his later deeds, are recorded in the words of Nathan the prophet, and in the books of Ahijah the Shilonite, and in the visions of Iddo the seer concerning Jeroboam, the son of Nebat.

verses.latin: Regnavit autem Salomon in Jerusalem super omnem Israël annos quadraginta.
verses.english: Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel for forty years.

verses.latin: Dormivitque cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum in civitate David: regnavitque Roboam filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Then Solomon rested with his ancestors in death, and they buried him in the City of David. His son Rehoboam then became king in his place.

verses.latin: Abiit autem Roboam in Sichem: illuc enim cunctus Israël convenerat, ut regem eum constitueret.
verses.english: Rehoboam went to Shechem. This was because all of Israel had come there to make him king.

verses.latin: Quod cum audisset Jeroboam filius Nabat (qui fuerat in Ægypto, quo fugerat a facie Salomonis), reversus statim de Ægypto.
verses.english: Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, heard about this. He had been in Egypt, having fled there from King Solomon. He immediately returned from Egypt.

verses.latin: Miserunt igitur, et vocaverunt eum. Venitque Jeroboam, et universus Israël, et locuti sunt ad Roboam, dicentes:
verses.english: So they sent for him and called him. Jeroboam came, and all of Israel came with him. They spoke to Rehoboam, saying:

verses.latin: Pater tuus aggravavit jugum nostrum: tu itaque imminue paululum de durissima servitute patris tui, et de gravissimo jugo, quo nos pressit, ut serviamus tibi.
verses.english: 'Your father made our forced labor very hard. Now, lighten a little of this very harsh service and the heavy burden he put on us, and we will serve you.'

verses.latin: Qui respondit eis: Post tres dies revertimini ad me. Cumque abisset populus,
verses.english: He answered them, saying, 'Return to me after three days.' So the people went away.

verses.latin: iniit consilium rex Roboam cum senioribus, qui astiterant patri ejus Salomoni, cum adhuc viveret, dicens: Quale datis consilium, ut respondeam populo?
verses.english: King Rehoboam consulted with the elders who had advised his father, King Solomon, during his lifetime. He asked them, 'What advice do you give me so I can respond to these people?'

verses.latin: Qui dixerunt ei: Si placueris populo huic, et lenieris, eosque mitibus affeceris sermonibus, servient tibi cunctis diebus.
verses.english: They said to him, 'If you will be good to this people, and will please them by speaking gentle words to them, they will be your servants always.'

verses.latin: At ille dereliquit consilium seniorum, et locutus est cum juvenibus, qui cum eo nutriti fuerant, et assidue morabantur secum.
verses.english: But Rehoboam rejected the advice of the elders. Instead, he spoke with the young men who had grown up with him and were always around him.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad illos: Quod vobis videtur, vel quo respondere debeo populo huic, qui locutus est mihi, dicens: Leva jugum, quod pater tuus imposuit nobis?
verses.english: He asked them, 'What advice do you give? How should I answer these people who have asked me to lighten the heavy burden that my father placed on us?'

verses.latin: At illi responderunt juxta juvenum sententiam, dicentes: Sic loqueris populo, qui locutus est ad te, inquiens: Pater tuus aggravavit jugum nostrum, tu leva, et hoc illis dices: Minimus digitus meus grossior est dorso patris mei.
verses.english: The young men answered him, giving their advice: 'Tell the people who spoke to you, saying, "Your father made our forced labor heavy, but you lighten it," say this to them: "My little finger is thicker than my father's loins."'

verses.latin: Et nunc, pater meus posuit super vos jugum grave, ego majus pondus apponam: pater meus cecidit vos flagellis, ego cædam scorpionibus.
verses.english: 'And now, my father placed a heavy burden on you, but I will make it even heavier. My father punished you with regular whips, but I will punish you with whips that have sharp points.'

verses.latin: Venit ergo Jeroboam, et cunctus populus ad Roboam die tertio, sicut præceperat rex, dicens: Revertimini ad me die tertio.
verses.english: So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam on the third day, just as the king had commanded when he said, 'Return to me on the third day.'

verses.latin: Responditque rex dura, relicto consilio seniorum.
verses.english: The king answered them harshly, having rejected the good counsel given by the elders.

verses.latin: Atque locutus est juxta juvenum voluntatem, dicens: Pater meus grave vobis imposuit jugum, ego vero adjiciam super illud: pater meus cecidit vos flagellis, ego cædam scorpionibus.
verses.english: And he spoke according to the wishes of the young men, saying, 'My father placed a heavy burden on you, but I will add even more to it. My father punished you with regular whips, but I will punish you with whips that have sharp points.'

verses.latin: Et non acquievit sermonibus populi, quoniam Dei nutu hoc flectebatur, ut impleretur sermo Domini, quem locutus fuerat per manum Ahiæ Silonitis ad Jeroboam filium Nabat.
verses.english: But King Rehoboam did not listen to the people's plea. This turn of events was from God, so that the word of the Lord, which He had spoken through Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam, son of Nebat, might be fulfilled.

verses.latin: Videns autem universus Israël, quod nollet eos audire, respondit populus ei, dicens: Non est nobis pars in David, neque hæreditas in filio Isai. Revertere in tabernacula tua, Israël: tu autem pasce domum tuam, David. Et abiit universus Israël in tabernacula sua.
verses.english: When all of Israel saw that King Rehoboam refused to listen to them, the people answered him, saying, 'We have no share in David! We have no inheritance with the son of Jesse—that is, King David! Go to your own homes, Israel! You, David, see to your own house now.' And all the people of Israel went to their homes.

verses.latin: Super filios autem Israël, qui habitabant in urbibus Juda, regnavit Roboam.
verses.english: But Rehoboam still reigned over the Israelites who lived in the cities of Judah.

verses.latin: Misitque rex Roboam Aduram, qui præerat tributis: et lapidaverunt eum filii Israël, et mortuus est. Rex autem Roboam festinavit ascendere currum, et fugere in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Then King Rehoboam sent Hadoram, who was in charge of the forced labor. But the people of Israel stoned him to death. So King Rehoboam quickly got into his chariot and fled to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Recessitque Israël a domo David usque ad hanc diem.
verses.english: And Israel has been separated from the house of David from that day until the present.

verses.latin: Venit autem Roboam in Jerusalem, convocavitque omnem domum Juda et Benjamin, centum octoginta millia electorum virorum bellatorum, ut pugnarent contra Israel, et converterent ad se regnum suum.
verses.english: After this, Rehoboam went to Jerusalem. He called together all the fighting men from the Tribe of Judah and the Tribe of Benjamin—one hundred and eighty thousand chosen warriors—so that he could fight against the northern kingdom of Israel and bring it back under his rule.

verses.latin: Factusque est sermo Domini ad Semeiam hominem Dei, dicens:
verses.english: Then the word of the Lord came to Shemaiah, a prophet of God, saying:

verses.latin: Loquere Roboam filio Salomonis regi Juda, et omni Israeli qui est in Juda et Benjamin:
verses.english: 'Speak to Rehoboam, the son of Solomon and king of Judah, and to all the Israelites who are living in the territories of Judah and Benjamin:

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Non ascendetis, neque pugnabitis contra fratres vestros: revertatur unusquisque in domum suam, quia mea voluntate factum est istud. Qui audientes sermonem Domini, reversi sunt de itinere, non perrexerunt contra Jeroboam.
verses.english: 'The Lord says this: Do not march up to fight against your own brothers, the northern Israelites. Everyone should return to his own home, because this division happened by My will.' So, when they heard the Lord's message, they turned back from their campaign and did not go to war against Jeroboam.

verses.latin: Habitavit autem Roboam in Jerusalem, et aedificavit civitates muratas in Juda.
verses.english: Rehoboam then stayed in Jerusalem and built fortified cities throughout Judah.

verses.latin: Aedificavitque Bethlehem, et Etam, et Thecue,
verses.english: He built up Bethlehem, Etham, and Tekoa,

verses.latin: Bethsur quoque, et Socho, et Odollam,
verses.english: as well as Beth-zur, Soco, and Adullam,

verses.latin: Neque non Geth, et Maresa, et Ziph,
verses.english: and also Gath, Mareshah, and Ziph,

verses.latin: Adoraim etiam, et Lachis, et Azecha,
verses.english: along with Adoraim, Lachish, and Azekah,

verses.latin: Saraa quoque, et Ajalon, et Hebron, quae erant in Juda et Benjamin civitates munitae.
verses.english: and Zorah, Aijalon, and Hebron. These were strong, fortified cities in the territories of Judah and Benjamin.

verses.latin: Cumque murasset urbes, posuit in eis principes, et horrea ciborum, hoc est, olei, et vini.
verses.english: After fortifying these cities, he put commanders in charge of them and stored supplies of food, including olive oil and wine.

verses.latin: Sed et per singulas civitates scuta et hastas posuit, fecitque eas cum summa diligentia munitas, et regnavit super Juda et Benjamin.
