verses.english: In each of these cities, he also placed shields and spears, making them extremely well-fortified. So, he established his reign over Judah and Benjamin.

verses.latin: Sacerdotes quoque et Levitae, qui erant in universo Israel, de cunctis finibus suis venerunt ad eum,
verses.english: Also, the priests and the Levites who lived throughout all the regions of the northern kingdom of Israel came to him [in Judah].

verses.latin: relinquentes suburbana sua, et possessiones, et transeuntes ad Judam, et Jerusalem: eo quod nollet eos Jeroboam et filii ejus fungi sacerdotio Domini.
verses.english: They left their pasture lands and their possessions, crossing over into Judah and Jerusalem because Jeroboam and his sons refused to let them serve as priests of the Lord.

verses.latin: Qui constituit sibi sacerdotes excelsorum, et dæmonum, et vitulorum quos fecerat.
verses.english: Instead, Jeroboam had appointed his own priests for the pagan high places, for idol worship, and for the calf idols which he had made.

verses.latin: Sed et de cunctis tribubus Israel, quicumque dederant cor suum ut quaererent Dominum Deum Israel, venerunt in Jerusalem ad immolandum victimas Domino Deo patrum suorum.
verses.english: Moreover, from all the tribes of the northern kingdom of Israel, anyone who earnestly sought to worship the Lord, the God of Israel, came to Jerusalem to offer sacrifices to the Lord, the God of their ancestors.

verses.latin: Et confortati sunt regnum Juda, et roboratum est Roboam filius Salomonis per annos tres: quia ambulaverunt in viis David et Salomonis per annos tres.
verses.english: Thus, the kingdom of Judah was strengthened, and Rehoboam, Solomon's son, was established in power for three years, because for those three years, they followed in the ways of David and Solomon.

verses.latin: Accepit autem Roboam uxorem Maalath, filiam Jerimoth filii David: et Abihail filiam Eliab filii Isai.
verses.english: Rehoboam then married Mahalath, who was the daughter of Jerimoth, David's son. He also married Abihail, who was the daughter of Eliab, Jesse's son.

verses.latin: Quae peperit ei filios, Jehus, et Samariam, et Zaha.
verses.english: She bore him sons: Jeush, Shemariah, and Zaham.

verses.latin: Post hanc quoque accepit Maacha filiam Absalom, quae peperit ei Abia, et Etthai, et Ziza, et Salomith.
verses.english: After this, he also married Maacah, the daughter of Absalom, and she bore him Abijah, Attai, Ziza, and Shelomith.

verses.latin: Dilexit autem Roboam Maacha filiam Absalom super omnes uxores suas, et concubinas: uxores quippe decem et octo habuit, et concubinas sexaginta: genuitque viginti octo filios, et filias sexaginta.
verses.english: Rehoboam loved Maacah, Absalom's daughter, more than all his other wives and concubines. Indeed, he had eighteen wives and sixty concubines, and through them, he became the father of twenty-eight sons and sixty daughters.

verses.latin: Constituit vero in capite Abiam filium Maacha ducem super omnes fratres suos: eo quod voluerit eum constituere regem.
verses.english: He appointed Abijah, Maacah's son, as the chief leader among all his brothers, intending to make him king.

verses.latin: Igitur prudenter ordinavit, et distribuit omnes filios suos per universas regiones Juda et Benjamin, in munitionibus civitatum: et dedit eis cibaria multa, et multas quoque uxores.
verses.english: Therefore, Rehoboam wisely made arrangements and distributed all his sons throughout all the regions of Judah and Benjamin, placing them in fortified cities. He gave them generous provisions and also many wives.

verses.latin: Cumque roboratum fuisset regnum Roboam, atque confortatum, dereliquit Dominum, et omnis Israel cum eo.
verses.english: Once Rehoboam’s kingdom had become strong and established, he abandoned the Lord, and all of Israel followed him in this sin.

verses.latin: Contra quem ascendit Sesac rex Ægypti, in Jerusalem, anno quinto regni Roboam, quia dereliquerant Dominum, in ducentis quadraginta curribus, et sexaginta millibus equitum: nec erat numerus vulgi, quod venerat cum eo ex Ægypto, Lybim et Troglodytarum, et Æthiopum.
verses.english: In the fifth year of Rehoboam's reign, Shishak, the king of Egypt, attacked Jerusalem because Rehoboam and Israel had abandoned the Lord. Shishak came with two hundred forty chariots and sixty thousand horsemen. The number of foot soldiers who came with him from Egypt was countless; this army included Libyans, Troglodytes, and Ethiopians.

verses.latin: Et cepit civitates munitas in Juda, et venit usque in Jerusalem.
verses.english: He captured the fortified cities in Judah and advanced all the way to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Porro Semeias propheta ingressus est ad Roboam, et principes Juda, qui congregati fuerant in Jerusalem, fugientes Sesac, et dixit eis: Haec dicit Dominus: Vos dereliquistis me, et idcirco et ego dereliqui vos in manu Sesac.
verses.english: Then Shemaiah the prophet came to Rehoboam and the princes of Judah, who had gathered in Jerusalem, having fled from Shishak. He told them, 'Thus says the Lord: You have abandoned me, and for that reason, I have now abandoned you into the power of Shishak.'

verses.latin: Et humiliatus est Roboam, et principes Israel, et dixerunt: Justus est Dominus.
verses.english: Then Rehoboam and the princes of Israel humbled themselves and declared, 'The Lord is just in this judgment.'

verses.latin: Cumque vidisset Dominus quod humiliati essent, factus est sermo Domini ad Semeiam, dicens: Quia humiliati sunt, non disperdam eos, sed dabo eis pauxillum auxilii, et non effundetur ira mea super Jerusalem per manum Sesac.
verses.english: When the Lord saw that they had humbled themselves, the word of the Lord came to Shemaiah, saying: 'Because they have humbled themselves, I will not destroy them. Instead, I will grant them a little help, and my wrath will not be poured out upon Jerusalem by the hand of Shishak.'

verses.latin: Verumtamen servi ejus erunt, ut sciant distantiam servitutis meae et servitutis regni terrarum.
verses.english: Nevertheless, they will become Shishak’s servants, so that they may understand the difference between serving me and serving the kingdoms of this world.

verses.latin: Venit ergo Sesac rex Ægypti in Jerusalem, et abstulit thesauros domus Domini, et thesauros regios, et omnia secum tulit: scuta quoque aurea, quae fecerat Salomon.
verses.english: So Shishak, the king of Egypt, entered Jerusalem and took away the treasures from the house of the Lord and the royal palace treasures. He carried everything away with him, including the golden shields that Solomon had made.

verses.latin: Pro quibus fecit rex Roboam clypeos aereos, et tradidit principibus scutariorum, et qui portas palatii custodiebant.
verses.english: In place of these, King Rehoboam made bronze shields and entrusted them to the commanders of the guards and those who guarded the palace gates.

verses.latin: Cumque ingrederetur rex domum Domini, portabant ea scutarii, et rursum referebant ad armarium suum.
verses.english: Whenever the king entered the house of the Lord, the guards would carry these shields, and afterwards, they would return them to their armory.

verses.latin: Verumtamen quia humiliatus est, aversa est ab eo ira Domini, nec penitus deleta sunt opera ejus: siquidem et in Juda bona opera fuerunt.
verses.english: Nevertheless, because Rehoboam had humbled himself, the wrath of the Lord turned away from him; his realm was not utterly destroyed. Indeed, there were still some good deeds found among the people of Judah.

verses.latin: Igitur confortatus est rex Roboam in Jerusalem, atque regnavit: quadraginta unius anni erat Roboam cum regnare cœpisset, et decem et septem annis regnavit in Jerusalem urbe, quam elegit Dominus, ut nomen suum invocaretur ibi, ex omnibus tribubus Israel.
verses.english: So King Rehoboam strengthened his position in Jerusalem and reigned. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city that the Lord had chosen from all the tribes of Israel to have His name invoked there.

verses.latin: Nomen autem matris ejus Naama Ammanitis.
verses.english: His mother's name was Naamah, an Ammonitess.

verses.latin: Fecit autem malum, et non præparavit cor suum ut quæreret Dominum.
verses.english: However, Rehoboam did evil, and he did not prepare his heart to seek the Lord.

verses.latin: Opera vero Roboam prima et novissima scripta sunt in libris Semeiæ prophetæ, et Addo videntis, et diligentius omnium et genealogia. Pugnæ quoque Roboam et Jeroboam cunctis diebus.
verses.english: Now, the first and last deeds of Rehoboam are written in the books of Shemaiah the prophet and of Iddo the seer. These accounts were written with diligent detail, including genealogies. There was also continuous warfare between Rehoboam and Jeroboam throughout all their days.

verses.latin: Dormivit itaque Roboam cum patribus suis, et sepultus est in civitate David: et regnavit Abiam filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Rehoboam rested with his fathers and was buried in the City of David. His son Abijah then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno decimo octavo regni Jeroboam, regnavit Abiam super Judam.
verses.english: In the eighteenth year of Jeroboam’s reign, Abijah began to reign over Judah.

verses.latin: Tribus annis regnavit in Jerusalem: Nomen matris ejus Michaia filia Uriel de Gabaa. Et inter Abiam et Jeroboam initum est bellum.
verses.english: He reigned for three years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Micaiah, daughter of Uriel, from Gibeah. There was war between Abijah and Jeroboam.

verses.latin: Cumque consertum esset certamen, abiit Abiam cum quadringentis millibus virorum fortissimorum et pugnatorum: Jeroboam quoque instruxit contra eum octingenta millia virorum, robustorum et fortium.
verses.english: When the battle lines were drawn, Abijah went forth with four hundred thousand very strong and skilled warriors. Jeroboam also arrayed against him an army of eight hundred thousand strong and mighty men.

verses.latin: Stetit autem Abiam super montem Semeron, qui est in Ephraim, et ait: Audi Jeroboam, et omnis Israel:
verses.english: Abijah then stood upon Mount Zemaraim, which is in Ephraim, and said, 'Hear me, Jeroboam, and all of Israel!'

verses.latin: Nonne scitis quoniam Dominus Deus Israel dedit regnum David super Israel in sempiternum, ipsi et filiis ejus, pactum salis?
verses.english: Do you not know that the Lord, the God of Israel, gave the kingdom over Israel to David forever, and to his sons, by a covenant of salt? (A covenant of salt is a perpetual and unbreakable agreement).

verses.latin: Et surrexit Jeroboam filius Nabat, servus Salomonis filii David, et rebellavit contra dominum suum.
verses.english: Yet Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, a servant of Solomon, the son of David, rose up and rebelled against his own master.

verses.latin: Congregatique sunt ad eum viri pestilentes filii Belial, et prævaluerunt contra Roboam filium Salomonis: Porro Roboam erat junior, et corde timidior, nec potuit sustinere eos.
verses.english: Worthless men, sons of Belial, gathered to him and prevailed against Rehoboam, the son of Solomon. For Rehoboam was young and faint-hearted and could not stand against them.

verses.latin: Et nunc vultis resistere regno Domini, quod possidet per filios David, cum sit vobis multitudo virorum innumerabilis, et aurei vituli, quos fecit vobis Jeroboam in deos?
verses.english: And now you intend to resist the kingdom of the Lord, which He possesses through the sons of David? You have a countless multitude of men, and also the golden calves that Jeroboam made for you as gods.

verses.latin: Nonne ejecistis sacerdotes Domini, filios Aaron, et Levitas, et fecistis vobis sacerdotes juxta mores omnium gentium? Quicumque consecrat manum suam in tauro de bobus, et in arietibus septem, fit sacerdos eorum, qui non sunt dii.
verses.english: Have you not cast out the priests of the Lord, the sons of Aaron, and the Levites? Instead, you have made priests for yourselves according to the customs of all the other nations. Whoever comes to consecrate himself with a young bull and seven rams becomes a priest for those who are not truly gods.

verses.latin: Noster autem Dominus Deus, nec dereliquimus eum: sacerdotesque ministrant Domino ex filiis Aaron, et Levitæ in ministeriis suis.
verses.english: But for us, the Lord is our God, and we have not abandoned Him. The priests ministering to the Lord are from the sons of Aaron, and the Levites serve in their proper duties.

verses.latin: Et adolemus Domino per singulos dies holocaustum mane et vespere, et incensum aromatum, et proponimus panes super mensam purissimam, et candelabrum aureum cum lucernis suis, ut accendantur vespere: nos quippe custodimus præcepta Domini Dei nostri, quos vos dereliquistis.
verses.english: And we burn to the Lord every single day the morning and evening burnt offering, and aromatic incense. We set out the bread upon the pure table and have the golden lampstand with its lamps, so that they may be lit in the evening. For we keep the precepts of the Lord our God, but you have abandoned them.

verses.latin: Ergo in exercitu nostro dux est Deus, et principes nostri, ut clangant tubis, et vociferentur contra vos: filii Israel, nolite pugnare contra Dominum Deum patrum vestrorum, quia non vobis expedit.
verses.english: Therefore, God is our leader in our army, and our priests are with us, to sound the trumpets and shout against you. Sons of Israel, do not fight against the Lord, the God of your fathers, for it will not go well for you.

verses.latin: Itaque Jeroboam, versis post tergum insidiis, circumvenit Judam: cumque esset ejus exercitus ante faciem, aliæ post tergum erant insidiæ.
verses.english: Nevertheless, Jeroboam, by setting ambushes behind Judah's army, surrounded them. While his main army was in front, other ambushes were behind them.

verses.latin: Conversus itaque Judas, vidit bellum ex adverso et post tergum: et clamavit ad Dominum: ac sacerdotes tubis canere cœperunt.
verses.english: So when Judah turned and saw the battle coming from both in front and behind, they cried out to the Lord, and the priests began to sound their trumpets.

verses.latin: Omnis quoque homo Juda vociferatus est: Et ecce dum concreparent sacerdotes tubis, et omnes pariter cum clamore ingenti vociferarentur, non latuit adversarios Deus.
verses.english: Every man of Judah also shouted. And behold, while the priests blasted their trumpets and all together shouted with a mighty cry, God did not conceal Himself from their adversaries.

verses.latin: Percussit ergo Deus Jeroboam et omnis Israel, in conspectu Abiam et Juda.
verses.english: Therefore, God struck down Jeroboam and all of Israel in the presence of Abijah and Judah.

verses.latin: Et fugerunt filii Israel a conspectu Juda: tradiditque eos Deus in manu eorum.
verses.english: The sons of Israel fled before Judah, and God delivered them into their hand.

verses.latin: Percussit ergo Abiam, et populus ejus, plagam magnam: et corruerunt vulnerati ex Israel, quingenta millia virorum fortium.
verses.english: So Abijah and his people inflicted a great slaughter, and five hundred thousand strong men of Israel fell, mortally wounded.

verses.latin: Humiliatique sunt filii Israel in tempore illo, et confortati sunt filii Juda, eo quod innixi essent super Dominum Deum patrum suorum.
verses.english: The sons of Israel were humbled at that time, but the sons of Judah were strengthened, because they had relied upon the Lord, the God of their fathers.

verses.latin: Persecutus est autem Abiam fugientem Jeroboam, et cepit civitates ejus, Bethel et filias ejus, et Jesana cum filiabus suis, Ephron quoque et filias ejus.
verses.english: Abijah pursued Jeroboam as he fled and captured his cities: Bethel and its surrounding towns, Jeshanah with its surrounding towns, and Ephron with its surrounding towns.

verses.latin: Itaque non prævaluit Jeroboam ultra, in diebus Abiam: et percussit eum Dominus, et mortuus est.
verses.english: So Jeroboam could no longer regain his strength in the days of Abijah. The Lord struck him, and he died.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Abiam, viarumque ejus, et operum, scripta sunt diligentissime in libro Addo prophetæ.
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Abijah, his ways, and his deeds, are written very diligently in the book of Iddo the prophet.

verses.latin: Dormivit vero Abiam cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum in civitate David: et regnavit Asa filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Abijah rested with his fathers and was buried in the City of David. His son Asa then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: In diebus ejus quievit terra decem annis.
verses.english: In his days, the land was at peace for ten years.

verses.latin: Anno decimo octavo Jeroboam regnavit Abias super Judam.
verses.english: In the eighteenth year of Jeroboam's reign, Abijah began his reign over Judah.

verses.latin: Tribus annis regnavit in Jerusalem, nomenque matris ejus Michaia, filia Uriel de Gabaa. Et inter Abiam et Jeroboam fuit bellum.
verses.english: He reigned for three years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Micaiah, the daughter of Uriel from Gibeah. And there was a major war between Abijah and Jeroboam.

verses.latin: Et paravit Abias ad praelium ducentos millia virorum fortissimorum et pugnatorum: Jeroboam quoque econtra instruxit aciem octingenta millia virorum robustorum et fortium.
verses.english: Abijah prepared for battle with two hundred thousand mighty and experienced warriors. Jeroboam, on the other hand, drew up his battle line with eight hundred thousand strong and valiant men.

verses.latin: Stetit autem Abias super montem Semeron, qui erat in Ephraim, et ait: Audi, Jeroboam, et omnis Israel.
verses.english: Then Abijah took his stand on Mount Zemaraim, which was in Ephraim, and he declared: "Hear me, Jeroboam, and all of Israel!"

verses.latin: Nonne scitis quia Dominus Deus Israel dedit regnum David super Israel in sempiternum, ipsi et filiis ejus pactum salis?
verses.english: Do you not know that the Lord, the God of Israel, gave the kingdom over Israel to David forever—to him and his sons—by a perpetual covenant of salt?

verses.latin: Et surrexit Jeroboam filius Nabat, servus Salomonis filii David, et rebellavit contra dominum suum.
verses.english: Yet Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, a servant of Solomon, David's son, rose up and rebelled against his own master.

verses.latin: Congregatique sunt ad eum viri Belial, filii impietatis, et praevaluerunt contra Roboam filium Salomonis: Porro Roboam erat junior et timidus, et non potuit eis resistere.
verses.english: And worthless men, sons of utter wickedness, gathered to him and gained power against Rehoboam, Solomon's son. Rehoboam was then young and timid, and he could not resist them.

verses.latin: Et nunc vos dicitis ut resistatis regno Domini quod possidet per filios David, et estis plurima multitudo, et habetis vobiscum vitulos aureos quos fecit vobis Jeroboam in deos.
verses.english: And now you say that you can resist the kingdom of the Lord, which He rules through the sons of David. You are indeed a very great multitude, but you have with you golden calves, which Jeroboam made for you as gods.

verses.latin: Nonne ejecistis sacerdotes Domini, filios Aaron, et Levitas: et fecistis vobis sacerdotes juxta mores omnium gentium terrae? Quicumque venit et implevit manum suam in tauro et in arietibus, factus est sacerdos eorum qui non sunt dii.
verses.english: Have you not cast out the priests of the Lord, the sons of Aaron, and the Levites? And have you not made priests for yourselves according to the pagan customs of all the nations of the earth? Whoever came and consecrated himself with a young bull and seven rams became a priest for those who are not truly gods.

verses.latin: Noster autem Dominus Deus, et nos non reliquimus eum: sacerdotesque ministrant Domino ex filiis Aaron, et Levitae sunt in ministeriis suis.
verses.english: But the Lord is our God, and we have not forsaken Him. Priests from the sons of Aaron minister to the Lord, and the Levites are in their assigned service.

verses.latin: Et offerunt Domino holocausta per singulos dies mane et vespere, et incensum aromatum, et proponunt panes in mensa purissima, et candelabrum aureum cum lucernis suis ut accendantur vespere: nos quippe custodimus praecepta Domini Dei nostri, quem vos reliquistis.
verses.english: They offer burnt offerings to the Lord every single day, morning and evening, along with fragrant incense. They also set out the showbread on the purest table, and they light the golden lampstand with its lamps every evening. Indeed, we keep the commands of the Lord our God, Whom you have forsaken.

verses.latin: Itaque in exercitu nostro dux est Deus, et sacerdotes ejus qui clangunt tubis et excitant contra vos praelium. Filii Israel, nolite pugnare contra Dominum Deum patrum vestrorum: quia non vobis expedit.
verses.english: Therefore, God Himself is the Leader in our army, and His priests sound the trumpets to stir up battle against you. Sons of Israel, do not fight against the Lord, the God of your fathers, because it will not go well for you.

verses.latin: At Jeroboam retro per insidias circumduxit exercitum ut a tergo Judam adgrederetur: cumque essent ante castra, pars exercitus alia post tergum erat.
verses.english: But Jeroboam had secretly led an ambush around to attack Judah from the rear. So while one part of his army was positioned in front of Judah's camp, another part was now behind them.

verses.latin: Respexit itaque Judas, et ecce acies utrimque: et clamaverunt ad Dominum, et sacerdotes tubis cecinerunt.
verses.english: Then Judah looked around, and behold, the battle lines were arrayed against them from both sides! So they cried out to the Lord, and the priests sounded the trumpets.

verses.latin: Omnisque Juda vociferatus est: et ecce illis clamantibus, Deus perterruit Jeroboam et omnem Israel qui contra Abiam et Judam steterant.
verses.english: And all of Judah shouted with a great war cry. And behold, as they were shouting, God Himself struck terror into Jeroboam and all of Israel who had stood against Abijah and Judah.

verses.latin: Et fugerunt filii Israel a facie Juda, et tradidit eos Deus in manu eorum.
verses.english: And the sons of Israel fled before Judah, for God had delivered them into Judah's hand.

verses.latin: Percussit ergo Abias et populus ejus plaga magna Jeroboam, et ceciderunt vulnerati ex Israel quingenta millia virorum fortium.
verses.english: So Abijah and his people inflicted a great slaughter upon Jeroboam, and there fell slain from Israel five hundred thousand valiant men.

verses.latin: Et humiliati sunt filii Israel in tempore illo, et confortati sunt filii Juda, quia innixi sunt super Dominum Deum patrum suorum.
verses.english: And the sons of Israel were humiliated at that time, but the sons of Judah were made strong, because they had relied upon the Lord, the God of their fathers.

verses.latin: Persecutus est autem Abias Jeroboam, et cepit civitates ejus, Bethel et filias ejus, et Jesana cum filiabus suis, Ephron quoque et filias ejus.
verses.english: Abijah then pursued Jeroboam and captured his cities: Bethel with its dependent towns, Jeshanah with its dependent towns, and Ephron with its dependent towns.

verses.latin: Et non obtinuit ultra Jeroboam convalescere in diebus Abiae: percussitque eum Dominus, et mortuus est.
verses.english: Jeroboam never regained his strength again during the days of Abijah. Indeed, the Lord struck him down, and he died.

verses.latin: Confortatusque est Abias: et accepit sibi uxores quatuordecim: genuitque viginti duos filios, et sedecim filias.
verses.english: Abijah grew mighty and took fourteen wives for himself. He begot twenty-two sons and sixteen daughters.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Abiae, et viarum ejus atque gestorum, scripta sunt diligentissime in libro prophetico Addo prophetae.
verses.english: Now the rest of Abijah's words, and his ways, and his deeds, are written most diligently in the prophetic book of Iddo the prophet.

verses.latin: Dormivit autem Abiam cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum in civitate David: regnavitque Asa filius ejus pro eo. In diebus illius quievit terra decem annis.
verses.english: King Abijah then died, joining his ancestors, and they buried him in the city of David. His son Asa became king after him. During Asa's early reign, the land was at peace for ten years.

verses.latin: Fecit autem Asa quod bonum et rectum erat coram Domino Deo suo.
verses.english: King Asa then did what was good and morally upright in the sight of the Lord his God.

verses.latin: Et subvertit altaria peregrini cultus, et excelsa: confregitque statuas, et succidit lucos.
verses.english: He removed the altars dedicated to foreign worship and tore down the high places. He shattered the pagan idols and cut down the Asherah poles.

verses.latin: Praecepitque Judae ut quaereret Dominum Deum patrum suorum, et faceret legem, et universa mandata.
verses.english: He commanded the people of Judah to seek the Lord, the God of their ancestors, and to obey His law and all His commandments.

verses.latin: Abstulit quoque de cunctis civitatibus Juda, aras, et fana: et regnavit in pace.
verses.english: He also removed the pagan altars and temples from all the cities of Judah. Consequently, his reign was peaceful.

verses.latin: Aedificavit quoque urbes muratas in Juda, quia silens erat, nullaque certaminum tempora perpetiebatur, consurgente adversus eum nullo: siquidem Dominus dederat ei requiem.
verses.english: He built fortified cities throughout Judah because the land was quiet, and he endured no times of conflict with anyone rising up against him. This was because the Lord had granted him a period of rest and peace.

verses.latin: Dixitque Juda: Aedificemus civitates istas, et muro circumdemus, et turribus, et portis, et seris: donec quiescant a certaminibus. Obsecravimus Dominum, et dedit nobis pacem per circuitum. Aedificaverunt ergo, et perfecerunt.
verses.english: Asa then said to the people of Judah: 'Let us build these cities, fortifying them with walls, towers, gates, and bars, so that we may remain at peace from any conflicts. We sought the Lord, and He has granted us peace all around.' So they built them and successfully completed the work.

verses.latin: Habuit autem Asa in exercitu suo, levatis de Juda clypeis, et hastis trecenta millia: de Benjamin vero clypeatorum, et sagittariorum ducenta octoginta millia: omnes isti fortissimi viri.
verses.english: Asa had an army composed of three hundred thousand men from Judah, equipped with large shields and spears. From Benjamin, he had two hundred eighty thousand men who carried shields and were archers. All these were very mighty warriors.

verses.latin: Egressus est autem contra eos Zara Aethiops, cum exercitu suo, ducentorum nonaginta millium, et curribus trecentis: et venit usque Maresa.
verses.english: Then Zerah the Ethiopian came out against them with his army of two hundred ninety thousand men and three hundred chariots. He advanced as far as Mareshah.

verses.latin: Obviamque ei perrexit Asa, et instruxit aciem in Valle Sephata, quae est juxta Maresa.
verses.english: Asa went out to meet him and arrayed his battle lines in the Valley of Zephathah, which is near Mareshah.

verses.latin: Et invocavit Asa Dominum Deum suum, et ait: Domine, non est apud te differentia, utrum in paucis auxilieris, an in pluribus: adjuva nos, Domine Deus noster, quia in te sperantes, et tuo freti auxilio, venimus contra hanc multitudinem. Domine, tu es Deus noster, non praevaleat contra te homo.
verses.english: Asa then called out to the Lord his God, saying: 'O Lord, it makes no difference to You whether You help the few or the many. Help us, O Lord our God, for it is in You that we place our hope, and relying solely on Your help, we have come against this vast multitude. O Lord, You are our God; let no mere human prevail against Your power!'

verses.latin: Percussit ergo Dominus Aethiopes coram Asa et Juda: fugeruntque Aethiopes.
verses.english: So the Lord struck down the Ethiopians before Asa and Judah, and the Ethiopians fled.

verses.latin: Persecutus est autem Asa, et exercitus qui cum eo erat, usque Gerara: et ruerunt Aethiopes usque ad internecionem, quia Domino, et exercitui illius, perterriti fuerant: tuleruntque Asa et exercitus ejus praedam plurimam.
verses.english: Asa and the army that was with him pursued them as far as Gerar. The Ethiopians were completely devastated, for they had been utterly terrified by the Lord and His army. Asa and his army then carried away a very great amount of plunder.

verses.latin: Vastantes igitur omnes civitates per circuitum Gerarae, et universa castella pastorum, percusserunt, et ceperunt praedam multam: sed et ovium, et camelorum ingentem numerum.
verses.english: They then destroyed all the cities surrounding Gerar, striking down every shepherd's encampment, and took much plunder. They also captured an immense number of sheep and camels.

verses.latin: Reversique sunt Jerusalem, onusti praeda, et terrore pariter, quia Dominus percusserat universas civitates in circuitu eorum.
verses.english: They returned to Jerusalem laden with plunder and also with a sense of awe and reverence, because the Lord had struck terror into all the cities around them.

verses.latin: Spiritus autem Domini factus est super Azariam filium Oded.
verses.english: But the Spirit of the Lord came powerfully upon Azariah, the son of Oded.

verses.latin: Qui egressus in occursum Asa, dixit ei: Audi me, Asa, et omnis Juda, et Benjamin: Dominus vobiscum, quia fuistis cum eo. Si quaesieritis eum, invenietis: si autem dereliqueritis eum, derelinquet vos.
verses.english: Azariah went out to meet King Asa and said to him, 'Listen to me, Asa, and all of Judah and Benjamin! The Lord is with you because you were with Him. If you seek Him, you will surely find Him. But if you abandon Him, then He will abandon you.'

verses.latin: Multi autem dies transierunt in Israel absque Deo vero, et absque sacerdote doctore, et absque lege.
verses.english: For many years in Israel, the people had lived without the true God, without a teaching priest to guide them, and without the Law.

verses.latin: Et cum reversi fuissent in angustia sua ad Dominum Deum Israel, et quaesissent eum, invenerunt.
verses.english: But in their distress, when they turned back to the Lord, the God of Israel, and truly sought Him, they found Him.

verses.latin: In tempore illo non erat pax ingredienti et egredienti: sed terrores magni super omnes habitatores terrarum: et civitas contra civitatem, et regnum adversus regnum concussum est.
verses.english: During that time, there was no peace for those who traveled, nor for those who stayed; instead, great terrors afflicted all the inhabitants of the lands. City was shattered against city, and kingdom against kingdom.

verses.latin: Conturbabat enim eos Dominus in omni angustia.
verses.english: For the Lord afflicted them with every kind of distress.

verses.latin: Vos ergo confortamini, et non dissolvantur manus vestrae: erit enim merces operi vestro.
verses.english: Therefore, strengthen yourselves, and do not let your hands grow weak, for there will be a reward for your work.

verses.latin: Auditis autem sermonibus, et prophetia Azariae filii Oded prophetae, confortatus est Asa rex, et abstulit idola de omni terra Juda, et Benjamin, et de urbibus quas ceperat de monte Ephraim: et dedicavit altare Domini, quod erat ante porticum Domini.
verses.english: When King Asa heard these words and the prophecy from Azariah, the son of Oded the prophet, he took courage. He removed all the idols from the entire land of Judah and Benjamin, and from the cities he had captured in the hill country of Ephraim. He then rededicated the Lord's altar that stood before the portico of the Lord's Temple.

verses.latin: Congregavitque universum Judam et Benjamin, et advenas de Ephraim, et Manasse, et Simeon, commorantes secum: de Israele enim plurimi ad eum confugerant, videntes quod Dominus Deus illius esset cum eo.
verses.english: Then King Asa gathered all of Judah and Benjamin, along with the foreigners from Ephraim, Manasseh, and Simeon who were living among them. Many people from Israel had fled to him because they saw that the Lord his God was with him.

verses.latin: Cumque convenissent Jerusalem mense tertio, anno quintodecimo regni Asa,
verses.english: So they all assembled in Jerusalem in the third month of the fifteenth year of Asa's reign.

verses.latin: immolaverunt Domino in die illa de praeda quam attulerant, boves septingentos, et oves septem millia.
verses.english: On that day, from the plunder they had brought back, they sacrificed to the Lord seven hundred oxen and seven thousand sheep.

verses.latin: Et inierunt pactum ut quaererent Dominum Deum patrum suorum in toto corde, et in tota anima eorum.
verses.english: They entered into a covenant to seek the Lord, the God of their fathers, with all their heart and all their soul.

verses.latin: Si quis autem non quaesierit Dominum Deum Israel, moriatur a minimo usque ad maximum, tam vir quam mulier.
verses.english: Anyone who would not seek the Lord, the God of Israel, was to be put to death, whether small or great, man or woman.

verses.latin: Juraveruntque Domino voce magna in jubilo, et in clangore tubae, et in sonitu buccinarum.
verses.english: They swore an oath to the Lord with a loud voice, with shouting, with trumpets, and with ram's horns.

verses.latin: Omnes qui erant in Juda, juramento gavisi sunt: eo quod in omni corde suo jurassent, et in tota voluntate quaesissent eum, et invenissent: praestititque eis Dominus requiem per circuitum.
verses.english: All of Judah rejoiced over the oath, for they had sworn it with all their heart. They had sought Him with their whole desire, and He had been found by them. The Lord then gave them rest on every side.

verses.latin: Sed et Maacha mater Asa regis, deposita est ab imperio, eo quod simulacrum sacrorum in luco ejus consecrasset: detrivitque Asa simulacrum, et in frusta comminutum concidit, et combussit in torrente Cedron.
verses.english: King Asa also removed his mother, Maacah, from her position as queen mother because she had made an abominable idol for a pagan Asherah pole. Asa cut down her idol, smashed it into pieces, and burned it in the Kidron Valley.

verses.latin: Excelsa autem non sunt demolita in Israel: verumtamen cor Asa perfectum fuit omnibus diebus ejus.
verses.english: However, the high places where pagan worship occurred were not removed from Israel. Nevertheless, Asa's heart remained fully committed to the Lord throughout his entire life.

verses.latin: Et ea quae voverat pater suus, et ipse, intulit in domum Domini, argentum, et aurum, et vasa.
verses.english: He brought into the house of the Lord the holy gifts that his father had consecrated, along with his own gifts of silver, gold, and various vessels.

verses.latin: Bellum vero non fuit usque ad trigesimum quintum annum regni Asa.
verses.english: There was no more war until the thirty-fifth year of Asa's reign.

verses.latin: Anno trigesimo sexto regni Asa, ascendit Baasa rex Israel super Judam, et aedificavit Rama, ut non posset quisquam egredi vel ingredi de regno Asa.
verses.english: In the thirty-sixth year of Asa's reign, Baasa, the king of Israel, marched up against Judah and fortified Ramah to prevent anyone from entering or leaving Asa's territory.

verses.latin: Tulit ergo Asa argentum et aurum de thesauris domus Domini et de thesauris regis, et misit ad Benadad regem Syriae, qui habitabat in Damasco, dicens:
verses.english: So Asa took silver and gold from the treasuries of the Lord's Temple and from his own royal treasuries, and sent it to Ben-Hadad, the king of Syria, who was living in Damascus, saying:

verses.latin: Foedus est inter me et te, et patrem meum et patrem tuum: quam ob rem misi tibi argentum et aurum, ut diruas foedus quod habes cum Baasa rege Israel, et discedat a me.
verses.english: “Let there be an alliance between me and you, just as there was between my father and your father. Because of this, I have sent you silver and gold so that you will break your alliance with Baasa, the king of Israel, and he will withdraw his troops from my land.”

verses.latin: Adsentiente quo, misit Benadad principes exercitus sui ad civitates Israel: qui percusserunt Ahion, et Dan, et Abelmaim, et universas urbes navium Nephthali.
verses.english: Ben-Hadad agreed to this, and he sent the commanders of his army against the cities of Israel. They attacked Ijon, Dan, Abel-Maim, and all the storage cities of Naphtali.

verses.latin: Quod cum audisset Baasa, destitit aedificare Rama, et intermisit opus suum.
verses.english: When Baasa heard about this attack, he stopped fortifying Ramah and abandoned his work there.

verses.latin: Porro Asa rex assumpsit universum Judam, et tulerunt lapides Rama, et ligna, quibus aedificaverat Baasa, et aedificavit ex eis Geba et Maspha.
verses.english: Then King Asa gathered all of Judah, and they carried away the stones and timber that Baasa had used to fortify Ramah. With these materials, Asa fortified Geba and Mizpah instead.

verses.latin: In tempore illo venit Hanani propheta ad Asa regem Juda, et dixit ei: Quia habuisti fiduciam in rege Syriae, et non in Domino Deo tuo, idcirco evasit de manu tua exercitus regis Syriae.
verses.english: At that time, Hanani the prophet came to Asa, the king of Judah, and said to him: “Because you relied on the king of Syria and not on the Lord, your God, that is why the army of the king of Syria has escaped from your grasp, and you did not achieve a decisive victory.”

verses.latin: Nonne Aethiopum et Libyum magna erat multitudo curruum, et equitum, et plurimae multitudinis: quos cum habuisses fiduciam in Domino, tradidit in manu tua?
verses.english: Were not the Ethiopians and the Libyans a great multitude with many chariots and horsemen? Yet, when you placed your trust in the Lord, He delivered them into your hand.

verses.latin: Oculi enim Domini contemplantur universam terram, et praebent robur his qui perfecto corde sunt. Stulte igitur egisti, et ob hanc causam ex praesenti tempore bella consurgent tibi.
verses.english: For the eyes of the Lord constantly survey the entire earth, and He provides strength to those whose hearts are completely devoted to Him. You have acted foolishly in this matter, and because of this, from now on, you will face wars.

verses.latin: Iratusque Asa adversus videntem, jussit eum mitti in carcerem: valde quippe iratus erat super hoc. Et interfecit de populo in ipso tempore.
verses.english: Asa became enraged at the prophet and ordered him to be put in prison; indeed, the king was very angry about this prophecy. At the same time, Asa also cruelly oppressed some of the people.

verses.latin: Opera vero Asa prima et novissima scripta sunt in libro regum Juda et Israel.
verses.english: As for the rest of the acts of Asa, from first to last, they are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.

verses.latin: Adhuc et in aegritudine sua, id est, vicesimo nono anno regni sui, depravatus est pedibus, nec tamen in infirmitate sua quæsivit Dominum, sed magis in medicorum arte confisus est.
verses.english: Furthermore, even in his illness, which began in the thirty-ninth year of his reign, when his feet became diseased, he did not seek the Lord in his sickness, but rather put his trust in the skill of physicians.

verses.latin: Dormivitque Asa cum patribus suis, et mortuus est anno quadragesimo primo regni sui:
verses.english: So Asa rested with his ancestors and died in the forty-first year of his reign.

verses.latin: et sepelierunt eum in sepulchro suo, quod foderat sibi in civitate David: et posuerunt eum super lectulum plenum aromatibus et variis odoribus, qui conficiuntur arte pigmentaria, et combusserunt super eum rogum valde grandem.
verses.english: They buried him in his own tomb, which he had carved out for himself in the City of David. They laid him on a bed filled with spices and various fragrant perfumes, prepared by the perfumer's art, and they burned a very large funeral pyre in his honor.

verses.latin: Et regnavit Josaphat filius ejus pro eo, et confortatus est contra Israel.
verses.english: And Jehoshaphat, his son, began to reign in his place. He strengthened himself against the Northern Kingdom of Israel.

verses.latin: Praesidiumque posuit in universis civitatibus Judae muratis, et praefectos in terra Judae, et in civitatibus Ephraim, quas ceperat Asa pater ejus.
verses.english: He placed military garrisons in all the fortified cities of Judah. He also stationed commanders throughout the land of Judah and in the cities of the territory of Ephraim that Asa, his father, had captured.

verses.latin: Et fuit Dominus cum Josaphat, quia ambulavit in viis David patris sui primis, et non permansit in Baalim:
verses.english: The Lord was with Jehoshaphat because he walked in the earlier, faithful ways of David, his ancestor, and he did not persist in worshipping the idols of Baal.

verses.latin: sed in Deo patris sui, et in praeceptis illius; et non juxta opera Israel.
verses.english: Instead, he sought the God of his father, and diligently followed His commandments, unlike the wicked practices of the Northern Kingdom of Israel.

verses.latin: Confortavitque Dominus regnum in manu illius, et dedit omnis Juda munera Josaphat: et factae sunt illi divitiae multae, et gloria.
verses.english: The Lord strengthened the kingdom in his grasp, and all Judah brought gifts to Jehoshaphat. He acquired great wealth and renown.

verses.latin: Cumque sublevasset cor suum in viis Domini, insuper et excelsa, et lucos abstulit de Juda.
verses.english: Moreover, because his heart was devoted to the ways of the Lord, he also removed the high places of idolatry and the sacred groves dedicated to false gods from Judah.

verses.latin: Tertio autem anno regni sui misit de principibus suis, Benhail, et Abdiam, et Zachariam, et Nathanael, et Michaeam, ut docerent in civitatibus Judae:
verses.english: In the third year of his reign, he sent some of his officials: Ben-Hail, Obadiah, Zechariah, Nethanel, and Micaiah to teach in the cities of Judah.

verses.latin: et cum eis Levitas, Semeiam, et Nathaniam, et Zabadiam, et Asahel, et Semiramoth, et Jonathan, et Adoniam, et Tobiam, et Tobadoniam Levitas, et cum eis sacerdotibus Elisama, et Joram.
verses.english: With these officials, he sent the Levites: Shemaiah, Nethaniah, Zebadiah, Asahel, Shemiramoth, Jehonathan, Adonijah, Tobijah, and Tob-Adonijah. And with them, the priests Elishama and Jehoram.

verses.latin: Docebantque in Juda habentes librum legis Domini, et circuibant cunctas civitates Judae, atque erudiebant populum.
verses.english: They taught the law of the Lord throughout Judah, carrying the book of the law with them. They traveled through all the cities of Judah, instructing the people.

verses.latin: Igitur factus est pavor Domini super omnia regna terrarum, quae erant in circuitu Judae, nec audebant bellare contra Josaphat.
verses.english: Consequently, the fear of the Lord fell upon all the kingdoms of the surrounding lands near Judah, so they dared not wage war against Jehoshaphat.

verses.latin: Sed et Philisthii dabant Josaphat munera, et vectigal argenti: Arabes quoque afferebant pecora, arietum septem millia septingenta, et hircorum totidem.
verses.english: Even the Philistines brought gifts and silver tribute to Jehoshaphat. And the Arabs also brought him livestock: seven thousand seven hundred rams and the same number of goats.

verses.latin: Crevit ergo Josaphat, et magnificatus est usque ad summum: aedificavitque in Juda arces, et urbes muratas.
verses.english: So Jehoshaphat grew more powerful and was greatly exalted. He built fortresses and fortified cities throughout Judah.

verses.latin: Et opera multa paravit in civitatibus Judae: et viri bellatores potentissimi in Jerusalem.
verses.english: He carried out many construction projects in the cities of Judah, and he had mighty warriors stationed in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Horumque est numerus per familias eorum: de Juda, principes exercitus, Ednas dux, et cum eo robustissimorum trecenta millia.
verses.english: This is their enrollment according to their ancestral families: From Judah, the commanders of the army were Adnah the chief, and with him three hundred thousand mighty warriors.

verses.latin: Post hunc, Johanan princeps, et cum eo ducenta octoginta millia.
verses.english: After him, Johanan was the commander, and with him two hundred eighty thousand.

verses.latin: Post istum, Amasias filius Zechri consecratus Domino, et cum eo ducenta millia robustorum.
verses.english: After him, Amasiah, the son of Zichri, who had consecrated himself to the Lord, and with him two hundred thousand mighty warriors.

verses.latin: De Benjamin vero, fortis viri, Eliada princeps, et cum eo ducenta millia instructa sagitta et clypeo.
verses.english: From Benjamin, the mighty warriors were Eliada the commander, and with him two hundred thousand armed with bows and shields.

verses.latin: Post hunc, Jozabad, et cum eo centum octoginta millia expedita ad bellum.
verses.english: After him, Jehozabad, and with him one hundred eighty thousand prepared for war.

verses.latin: Hi omnes viri pugnatores, qui ministrabant regi: absque his, quos posuerat in urbibus muratis, in universa Juda.
verses.english: All these were warriors who served the king. This number does not include those whom he had placed in the fortified cities throughout all of Judah.

verses.latin: N.B.: No verses 20-40 are present in this chapter of 2 Chronicles in the Clementine Vulgate, as Chapter 17 only contains 19 verses. The numbering then proceeds to Chapter 18.
verses.english: Note: The Clementine Vulgate for 2 Chronicles Chapter 17 concludes at verse 19. Therefore, there are no verses 20-40 to translate for this chapter. The narrative continues in Chapter 18.

verses.latin: Habebat ergo Josaphat divitias, et gloriam multam: et affinitate junctus est Achab.
verses.english: Jehoshaphat had accumulated much wealth and great honor during his reign, and he formed a family alliance with Ahab, the King of Israel.

verses.latin: Post annos autem aliquot, descendit ad eum in Samariam: et occidit Achab oves ei, et boves plurimos, et populum multum qui cum eo venerat, cepit illaqueare.
verses.english: Some years later, Jehoshaphat visited Ahab in Samaria. Ahab showed him great hospitality, slaughtering a vast number of sheep and cattle in his honor, and began to entice and ensnare Jehoshaphat and the many people who had come with him into a military alliance.

verses.latin: Dixitque Achab rex Israël ad Josaphat regem Juda: Mecum veni in Ramoth Galaad ad pugnandum. Cui ille respondit: Sicut ego, et tu; sicut populus tuus, et populus meus tecumque sumus in bello.
verses.english: Ahab, the King of Israel, said to Jehoshaphat, the King of Judah, "Will you come with me to Ramoth-Gilead to fight?" Jehoshaphat replied, "I am with you, and my people are with your people. We will be with you in this war."

verses.latin: Dixitque Josaphat ad regem Israël: Consule obsecro, impraesentiarum sermonem Domini.
verses.english: Then Jehoshaphat said to the King of Israel, "Please, let us first inquire of the Lord to hear what He says about this mission."

verses.latin: Congregavit ergo rex Israël prophetarum quadringentos viros, et dixit eis: Ire debemus in Ramoth Galaad ad pugnandum, an quiescere? At illi: Ascende, inquiunt, et dabo eos Deus in manu regis.
verses.english: So the King of Israel gathered four hundred men who claimed to be prophets and asked them, "Should we go to Ramoth-Gilead to fight, or should we refrain?" They all answered, "Go up, and God will give them into the hand of the king."

verses.latin: Dixitque Josaphat: Numquid non est hic propheta Domini, ut interrogemus per eum?
verses.english: Jehoshaphat then asked, "Is there not a true prophet of the Lord here, from whom we can inquire directly?"

verses.latin: Et ait rex Israël ad Josaphat: Est vir unus, per quem possumus interrogare Dominum: sed ego odi eum, quia non prophetat mihi bonum, sed malum omni tempore: est autem Michæas filius Jemla. Dixitque Josaphat: Ne loquaris, rex, verbum hoc.
verses.english: The King of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, "There is one man by whom we can inquire of the Lord, but I hate him, because he never prophesies good concerning me, but always evil. His name is Micaiah, the son of Imlah." Jehoshaphat responded, "The king should not speak such a word against God's prophet."

verses.latin: Vocavit ergo rex Israël unum de eunuchis, et dixit ei: Cito adduc Michæam filium Jemla.
verses.english: So the King of Israel called one of his officials and commanded, "Bring Micaiah, the son of Imlah, quickly."

verses.latin: Rex autem Israël, et Josaphat rex Juda, sedebant uterque in solio suo, vestiti cultu regio, in area juxta portam Samariæ: et omnes prophetæ vaticinabantur coram eis.
verses.english: The King of Israel and Jehoshaphat, the King of Judah, were both seated on their respective thrones, dressed in their royal robes, in the threshing floor near the gate of Samaria. All the false prophets were prophesying before them.

verses.latin: Sedecias vero filius Chanaana, fecit sibi cornua ferrea, et ait: Hæc dicit Dominus: His ventilabis Syriam, donec deleas eam.
verses.english: Then Zedekiah, the son of Chenaanah, made himself horns of iron and declared, "Thus says the Lord: 'With these horns you will gore the Syrians until you utterly destroy them.'"

verses.latin: Et omnes prophetæ similiter prophetabant, dicentes: Ascende in Ramoth Galaad, et prosperaberis, et dabo eos in manu regis.
verses.english: All the other prophets also prophesied similarly, saying, "Go up to Ramoth-Gilead and you will prosper; the Lord will give them into the hand of the king."

verses.latin: Nuntius autem qui ierat ad vocandum Michæam, locutus est ad eum, dicens: Ecce verba omnium prophetarum uno ore bona regi annuntiant: quapropter te obsecro ut sermo tuus concordet eorum sermonibus, et loquaris bona.
verses.english: The messenger who went to summon Micaiah spoke to him, saying, "Behold, the words of all the prophets are unanimously proclaiming good things to the king. Therefore, I beg you, let your word agree with their words, and speak what is good."

verses.latin: Cui Michæas respondit: Vivit Dominus, quia quæcumque dixerit Deus meus, hæc loquar.
verses.english: Micaiah replied, "As the Lord lives, whatever my God says, that is what I will speak."

verses.latin: Venit ergo ad regem: quem cum vidisset rex, ait: Michæa, ire debemus in Ramoth Galaad ad pugnandum, an quiescere? Qui ait: Ascendite, et prosperamini, et tradentur vobis.
verses.english: So when Micaiah came to the king, the king asked him, "Micaiah, should we go to Ramoth-Gilead to fight, or should we refrain?" Micaiah replied with sarcasm, "Go up and prosper, for they will be delivered into your hand!"

verses.latin: Dixitque rex: Iterum atque iterum te adjuro, ut non mihi loquaris nisi quod verum est in nomine Domini.
verses.english: The king said, "I solemnly command you again and again, in the name of the Lord, that you speak nothing to me but the truth."

verses.latin: At ille ait: Vidi cunctum Israël dispersum in montibus, sicut oves absque pastore: et dixit Dominus: Non habent hi dominum: revertatur unusquisque ad domum suam in pace.
verses.english: Then Micaiah said, "I saw all of Israel scattered on the mountains like sheep without a shepherd. And the Lord said, 'These have no master; let each one return to his own house in peace.'" This was a prophecy of Ahab's death and the scattering of his army.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo rex Israël ad Josaphat: Nonne dixi tibi, quia non prophetat mihi bonum, sed malum?
verses.english: So the King of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, "Did I not tell you that he would not prophesy good concerning me, but only evil?"

verses.latin: At ille, addens, ait: Propter hoc audite sermonem Domini. Vidi Dominum sedentem in solio suo, et omnem exercitum cæli assistentem a dextris et a sinistris illius.
verses.english: Micaiah then added, "Therefore, hear the word of the Lord. I saw the Lord seated on His throne, with all the host of heaven standing by Him on His right and on His left."

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus: Quis decipiet Achab regem Israël, ut ascendat, et corruat in Ramoth Galaad? Cumque illi dicerent verba varia, et unus hoc modo, alius autem illo,
verses.english: And the Lord asked, 'Who will deceive Ahab, the King of Israel, so that he will go up and fall at Ramoth-Gilead?' And while some spoke in one manner, and others in another,

verses.latin: processit spiritus, et stetit coram Domino, et ait: Ego eum decipiam. Cui Dominus: In quo, inquit, decipies?
verses.english: a spirit came forward and stood before the Lord and said, 'I will deceive him.' The Lord asked him, 'In what way will you deceive him?'

verses.latin: At ille respondit: Ibo, et ero spiritus mendax in ore omnium prophetarum ejus. Dixitque Dominus: Decipies, et prævalebis: egredere, et fac ita.
verses.english: He replied, 'I will go out and be a lying spirit in the mouths of all his false prophets.' The Lord said, 'You will deceive him, and you will prevail. Go out and do as you have said.'"

verses.latin: Nunc igitur ecce dedit Dominus spiritum mendacii in ore omnium prophetarum tuorum, et Dominus locutus est super te mala.
verses.english: Micaiah concluded, "Now therefore, behold, the Lord has put a lying spirit in the mouths of all these prophets of yours, and the Lord has decreed evil concerning you."

verses.latin: Accessit autem Sedecias filius Chanaana, et percussit Michæam in maxillam, et dixit: Qua via ingressus est spiritus Domini a me, ut loqueretur tibi?
verses.english: Then Zedekiah, the son of Chenaanah, approached Micaiah and struck him on the cheek, saying, "Which way did the Spirit of the Lord pass from me to speak to you?"

verses.latin: Et ait Michæas: Tu ipse videbis in die illo, quando ingredieris cubiculum de cubiculo ut abscondaris.
verses.english: Micaiah replied, "You yourself will see on that day, when you go into a hidden inner chamber to hide yourself."

verses.latin: Præcepit autem rex Israël, dicens: Tollite Michæam, et ducite ad Amon principem civitatis, et ad Joas filium Amelech,
verses.english: Then the King of Israel commanded, "Take Micaiah and lead him away to Amon, the governor of the city, and to Joash, the king's son,

verses.latin: et dicetis: Hæc dicit rex: Mittite hunc in carcerem, et date ei panis et aquæ modicum, donec revertar in pace.
verses.english: and tell them: 'Thus says the king: Put this man in prison, and feed him with meager rations of bread and water until I return in peace.'"

verses.latin: Et ait Michæas: Si reversus fueris in pace, non est locutus Dominus in me. Et addidit: Audite populi omnes.
verses.english: Micaiah declared, "If you return in peace, then the Lord has not spoken through me." And he added, "Hear, all you peoples!"

verses.latin: Ivit igitur rex Israël et Josaphat rex Juda in Ramoth Galaad.
verses.english: So the King of Israel and Jehoshaphat, the King of Judah, went up to Ramoth-Gilead.

verses.latin: Dixitque rex Israël ad Josaphat: Mutabo habitum meum, et sic veniam ad prælium: tu autem induere vestibus tuis. Mutato ergo rex Israël habitu, ivit ad bellum.
verses.english: The King of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, "I will disguise myself and go into battle, but you wear your royal robes." So the King of Israel disguised himself and went into the battle.

verses.latin: Rex autem Syriæ præceperat ducibus equitatus sui, dicens: Ne pugnetis contra minorem, aut majorem quempiam, nisi contra regem Israël solum.
verses.english: Now the King of Syria had commanded the commanders of his chariots, saying, "Do not fight against anyone, great or small, except against the King of Israel alone."

verses.latin: Itaque cum vidissent principes equitatus Josaphat, dixerunt: Rex Israël iste est. Et circumdederunt eum, ut pugnarent contra eum. At ille clamavit ad Dominum, et auxiliatus est ei, et avertit eos Deus ab illo.
verses.english: When the commanders of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, they said, "This must be the King of Israel." So they surrounded him to fight against him. But Jehoshaphat cried out to the Lord, and the Lord helped him; God turned them away from him.

verses.latin: Nam cum vidissent duces equitatus, quod non esset rex Israël, reliquerunt eum.
verses.english: For when the commanders of the chariots realized that he was not the King of Israel, they left him.

verses.latin: Quidam vero vir vulneravit regem Israël, forte jaculo, et percussit eum inter pulmonem et stomachum. At ille dixit aurigæ suo: Converte manum tuam, et educ me de acie, quia graviter vulneratus sum.
verses.english: However, a certain man drew his bow with careful aim and struck the King of Israel between the joints of his armor, between the lung and the stomach. So Ahab said to his charioteer, "Turn your hand and take me out of the battle, for I am severely wounded."

verses.latin: Et instabat prælium in die illo: stetit autem rex Israël in curru suo contra Syros usque ad vesperam, et mortuus est solis occasu.
verses.english: The battle raged fiercely throughout that day. The King of Israel remained standing in his chariot facing the Syrians until evening. At the setting of the sun, he died.

verses.latin: Reversus est autem Josaphat rex Juda in domum suam Jerusalem in pace.
verses.english: King Jehoshaphat of Judah returned safely to his royal residence in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Egressus est autem obviam ei Jehu filius Hanani propheta, et ait ad illum: Impio praebes auxilium, et his qui oderunt Dominum amicitia jungeris: et idcirco iram quidem Domini merebaris.
verses.english: But Jehu, the prophet, son of Hanani, went out to meet him and said to him: 'You offer help to the wicked, and you ally yourself with those who hate the Lord. Therefore, you have truly deserved the Lord's wrath.'

verses.latin: Sed bona opera inventa sunt in te, eo quod abstuleris lucos de terra Juda, et praeparaveris cor tuum ut requireres Dominum Deum patrum tuorum.
verses.english: However, good deeds have been found in you, because you have removed the Asherah poles (idolatrous altars) from the land of Judah, and you have prepared your heart to seek the Lord, the God of your ancestors.

verses.latin: Mansit ergo Josaphat in Jerusalem: rursumque perrexit ad populum de Bersabee usque ad montem Ephraim, et reduxit eos ad Dominum Deum patrum suorum.
verses.english: So Jehoshaphat remained in Jerusalem. Then he again went out among the people, from Beersheba all the way to the hill country of Ephraim, and he brought them back to the Lord, the God of their ancestors.

verses.latin: Constituitque judices in cunctis civitatibus Juda munitis, per singulas civitates.
verses.english: And he appointed judges in all the fortified cities of Judah, within each individual city.

verses.latin: Et praecipiens judicibus ait: Videte quid faciatis: non enim hominis exercetis judicium, sed Domini: et quodcumque judicaveritis, in vos redundabit.
verses.english: And he commanded the judges, saying: 'Consider carefully what you do, for you are not exercising judgment for men, but for the Lord; and whatever you judge will redound upon yourselves, meaning you will be held accountable.'

verses.latin: Sit terror Domini vobiscum, et caute agite: non est enim apud Dominum Deum nostrum iniquitas, nec personarum acceptio, nec avaritiae cupiditas.
verses.english: Let the fear of the Lord be with you, and act with caution. For with the Lord our God there is no injustice, nor any partiality for persons, nor a desire for bribes.

verses.latin: In Jerusalem quoque Josaphat constituit Levitas, et sacerdotes, et principes familiarum Israel, ut judicium et causam Domini judicarent habitatoribus ejus.
verses.english: Also in Jerusalem, Jehoshaphat appointed Levites, priests, and heads of Israelite families to administer the Lord's justice and judgment for its inhabitants.

verses.latin: Praecepitque eis, dicens: Sic agetis in timore Domini, fideliter, et corde perfecto.
verses.english: And he commanded them, saying: 'Thus you shall act in the fear of the Lord, faithfully and with wholehearted dedication.'

verses.latin: Omnem causam quae venerit ad vos fratrum vestrorum, qui habitant in urbibus suis, inter cognationem et cognationem, ubicumque quaestio est de lege, de mandato, de caeremoniis, de justificationibus, ostendite eis ut non peccent in Dominum, et non veniat ira super vos et super fratres vestros: sic ergo agite, et non peccabitis.
verses.english: Every case that comes to you from your brethren who dwell in their cities—whether it is between relatives, or wherever there is a question concerning the divine law, the commandment, the ceremonial practices, or the statutes—you must instruct them so that they do not sin against the Lord. In doing so, wrath will not come upon you and upon your brethren. Therefore, act in this way, and you will not sin.

verses.latin: Amarias autem sacerdos et pontifex vester, praesidebit in his quae ad Dominum pertinent: porro Zabadias filius Ismahelis dux in domo Juda, super ea opera quae ad regis officium pertinent: habetisque Levitas coram vobis, ut ministrent: confortamini et agite diligenter, et erit Dominus cum bonis.
verses.english: Moreover, Amariah, your chief priest (or high priest), will preside over all matters pertaining to the Lord's law. Furthermore, Zebadiah, the son of Ishmael, the leader of the house of Judah, will oversee those matters pertaining to the king's duty. You also have the Levites before you to assist. Be strong and act diligently, and the Lord will be with the good (those who do what is right).

verses.latin: Post haec, venerunt filii Moab, et filii Ammon, et cum eis de Madian adversum Josaphat.
verses.english: After these events, the sons of Moab and the sons of Ammon came, and with them people from Midian, to make war against King Jehoshaphat.

verses.latin: Veneruntque nuntii, et nuntiaverunt Josaphat, dicentes: Venit contra te multitudo magna de his locis trans mare, et de Syria, de qua surgens pergit in Engaddi.
verses.english: Then messengers came and reported to Jehoshaphat, saying: “A great multitude of enemies is coming against you from the lands across the Dead Sea, from Syria, and they are now advancing and are already at Engedi.”

verses.latin: Josaphat autem timore perterritus, totum se contulit ad orandum Dominum, et prædicavit jejunium universo Judææ.
verses.english: But Jehoshaphat was struck with terror by this news, and he gave his whole attention to praying to the Lord; he also proclaimed a fast throughout all of Judah.

verses.latin: Congregataque est Juda ad precandum Dominum: sed et de cunctis urbibus Judæ venerunt ad obsecrandum eum.
verses.english: So the people of Judah gathered together to pray to the Lord, and people from all the cities of Judah came to ask for His help.

verses.latin: Cumque stetisset rex in medio coetus Juda et Jerusalem, in domo Domini ante atrium novum,
verses.english: Then King Jehoshaphat stood in the middle of the assembly of Judah and Jerusalem, in the House of the Lord, before the new court,

verses.latin: ait: Domine Deus patrum nostrorum, tu es Deus in cælo, et dominaris cunctis regnis gentium: in manu tua est fortitudo et potentia, nec quisquam tibi potest resistere.
verses.english: and he said: “O Lord, God of our fathers, You are God in the heavens, and You rule over all the kingdoms of the nations. In Your hand are strength and power, and no one can resist You.

verses.latin: Nonne tu, Deus noster, interfecisti omnes habitatores terræ hujus coram populo tuo Israël, et dedisti eam semini Abrahæ amici tui in sempiternum?
verses.english: Did You not, O our God, drive out all the inhabitants of this land before Your people Israel, and give it forever to the descendants of Abraham, Your friend?

verses.latin: Et habitaverunt in ea, et ædificaverunt sanctuarium nomini tuo in illa, dicentes:
verses.english: And they lived in it and built a sanctuary there for Your Name, saying:

verses.latin: Si irruerint super nos mala, gladius, judicium, pestilentia, et fames, stabimus coram te in domo hac, in qua nomen tuum invocatum est: et clamabimus ad te in tribulationibus nostris, et exaudies, salvosque facies.
verses.english: ‘If evil assails us, whether sword, judgment, pestilence, or famine, we will stand before You in this House, where Your Name has been invoked. We will cry out to You in our tribulations, and You will hear us and save us.’

verses.latin: Nunc ergo ecce filii Ammon, et Moab, et mons Seir, per quos non dignatus es Israël transire quando egrediebatur de Ægypto, sed declinavit ab eis, et non interfecit,
verses.english: Now behold, the sons of Ammon, and Moab, and Mount Seir—those through whom You did not allow Israel to pass when they came out of Egypt (but they turned away from them and did not destroy them)—

verses.latin: ecce contrarium agunt, et nituntur ejicere nos de possessione tua, quam tradidisti nobis.
verses.english: Behold, they are now acting against us and are striving to drive us out of Your possession, which You have given to us.

verses.latin: Deus noster, non judicabis eos? In nobis quidem non est tanta fortitudo, ut possimus huic multitudini resistere, quæ irruit super nos. Sed cum ignoramus quid agere debeamus, hoc tantum habemus residui, ut oculos nostros dirigamus ad te.
verses.english: O our God, will You not judge them? Truly, in us there is not enough strength to resist this great multitude that is rushing upon us. And since we do not know what we should do, this alone remains for us: to direct our eyes to You for help.”

verses.latin: Omnis vero Juda stabat coram Domino cum parvulis, et uxoribus, et liberis suis.
verses.english: Indeed, all of Judah stood before the Lord with their little ones, their wives, and their children.

verses.latin: Spiritus itaque Domini irruit super Jahaziel filium Zachariæ, filii Banaiæ, filii Jehiel, filii Mathaniæ, Levitam de filiis Asaph, in medio multitudinis,
verses.english: Therefore, the Spirit of the Lord came upon Jahaziel, the son of Zechariah, the son of Benaiah, the son of Jeiel, the son of Mattaniah, a Levite from the sons of Asaph, in the midst of the multitude.

verses.latin: et ait: Attendite, omnis Juda, et qui habitatis Jerusalem, et tu rex Josaphat: Hæc dicit Dominus vobis: Nolite timere, nec paveatis hanc multitudinem: non est enim vestra pugna, sed Dei.
verses.english: And he said: “Listen, all of Judah, and you who dwell in Jerusalem, and you, King Jehoshaphat! Thus says the Lord to you: ‘Do not fear, nor be dismayed by this great multitude, for the battle is not yours, but God’s.

verses.latin: Cras descendetis contra eos: ascendunt enim per clivum nomine Sis, et invenietis illos in summitate torrentis, qui est foras solitudinem Jeruel.
verses.english: Tomorrow you will go down against them. For they are coming up by the ascent named Sis, and you will find them at the end of the valley, which is beyond the wilderness of Jeruel.

verses.latin: Non eritis vos qui pugnabitis, sed tantummodo stabitis confidenter, et videbitis auxilium Domini super vos, o Juda et Jerusalem: nolite timere, nec paveatis: cras egredimini contra eos, et Dominus erit vobiscum.
verses.english: You will not be the ones to fight. Only stand confidently and you will see the Lord’s help with you, O Judah and Jerusalem. Do not fear, nor be dismayed. Tomorrow go out against them, and the Lord will be with you.’”

verses.latin: Josaphat ergo, et omnis Juda, et habitatores Jerusalem, ceciderunt proni in terram, adoraveruntque Dominum.
verses.english: Then Jehoshaphat, and all Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem fell prostrate on the ground and worshipped the Lord.

verses.latin: Porro Levitæ de filiis Caathitarum, et de filiis Core, surrexerunt ad laudandum Dominum Deum Israël voce magna, et excelso.
verses.english: Moreover, the Levites from the sons of the Kohathites and from the sons of Korah rose up to praise the Lord, the God of Israel, with a very loud and high voice.

verses.latin: Cumque mane surrexissent, perrexerunt per desertum Thecue: profectisque eis, stetit Josaphat, et dixit: Audite me, Juda, et omnes habitatores Jerusalem: Credite in Domino Deo vestro, et securi eritis: credite prophetis ejus, et omnia evenient prospera.
verses.english: And when they rose early in the morning, they went forth into the wilderness of Tekoa. As they departed, Jehoshaphat stood and said: “Hear me, Judah, and all you inhabitants of Jerusalem! Believe in the Lord your God, and you will be safe. Believe His prophets, and all things will happen prosperously for you.”

verses.latin: Dedisque consilio populi, præfecit cantores Domini, ut laudarent eum in tunicis sanctis, et exirent ante exercitum, et dicerent: Confitemini Domino, quoniam in æternum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: And after he took counsel with the people, he appointed singers for the Lord to praise Him in holy vestments. They went out before the army, saying: “Give praise to the Lord, for His mercy endures forever!”

verses.latin: Cumque cœpissent laudes canere, et jubilare, Dominus iniecit insidias filiis Ammon, et Moab, et montis Seir, qui egressi fuerant ad pugnandum contra Judam, et percussi sunt.
verses.english: And as they began to sing praises and rejoice, the Lord set ambushes for the sons of Ammon, and Moab, and Mount Seir, who had come out to fight against Judah, and they were defeated.

verses.latin: Nam filii Ammon et Moab surrexerunt adversum habitatores montis Seir, ut interficerent et delerent eos: cumque hoc opere perfecissent, ad internecionem quoque mutuo se peremerunt.
verses.english: For the sons of Ammon and Moab rose up against the inhabitants of Mount Seir to kill and utterly destroy them. And when they had finished this work, they also destroyed one another in mutual slaughter.

verses.latin: Porro Juda, cum venisset ad speculam quæ respicit solitudinem, vidit procul omnem regionem jacentem cadaveribus, et nullum superesse qui fugere posset.
verses.english: When the people of Judah came to the watchtower that looks out over the wilderness, they looked from afar and saw the entire region covered with dead bodies, and no one was left alive who could flee.

verses.latin: Venit ergo Josaphat et omnis populus cum eo ad diripienda spolia mortuorum: inveneruntque inter cadavera vestes, et vasa, et supellectilem optimam, et annulos, et armillas, et diversa ornamenta, in tantam multitudinem, ut nec portare omnia possent, sed tribus diebus morati sunt ad colligenda spolia, propter magnitudinem prædæ.
verses.english: So Jehoshaphat and all the people with him came to plunder the spoils of the dead. And among the bodies they found clothing, and vessels, and excellent furnishings, and rings, and bracelets, and various ornaments, in such great quantity that they could not carry everything. They spent three days collecting the spoils because of the immense size of the plunder.

verses.latin: Die autem quarto, congregati sunt in Valle benedictionis: ibi enim benedixerunt Domino, et ob hanc causam vocata est Vallis benedictionis usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: On the fourth day, they gathered in the Valley of Beracah (which means 'blessing'), for there they blessed the Lord. And for this reason, it was called the Valley of Blessing even to this present day.

verses.latin: Reversusque est omnis vir Juda, et Jerusalem, et Josaphat ante eos, in Jerusalem cum lætitia magna, eo quod dedisset eis Dominus gaudium de inimicis suis.
verses.english: Then all the men of Judah and Jerusalem returned, with Jehoshaphat leading them, back to Jerusalem with great joy, because the Lord had given them joy over their enemies.

verses.latin: Ingressique sunt Jerusalem cum psalteriis, et citharis, et tubis, in domum Domini.
verses.english: And they entered Jerusalem, into the House of the Lord, with psalters, and harps, and trumpets.

verses.latin: Irruit ergo timor Domini super universa regna terrarum, cum audissent quod pugnasset Dominus contra inimicos Israël.
verses.english: Therefore, the fear of the Lord fell upon all the kingdoms of the lands when they heard that the Lord had fought against the enemies of Israel.

verses.latin: Requievitque regnum Josaphat, et præbuit ei Deus suus omnia in gyro pacem.
verses.english: So the kingdom of Jehoshaphat had rest, and his God gave him peace on all sides.

verses.latin: Regnavit igitur Josaphat super Judam: et erat triginta quinque annorum cum regnare cœpisset, et viginti quinque annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Azuba filia Selahi.
verses.english: Thus, Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah. He was thirty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for twenty-five years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Azubah, the daughter of Shilhi.

verses.latin: Et ambulavit in via patris sui Asa, et non declinavit ab ea, faciens quod bonum est coram Domino.
verses.english: And he walked in the way of his father Asa, and did not turn from it, doing what was good in the sight of the Lord.

verses.latin: Verumtamen excelsa non abstulit, et adhuc cor populi non erat directum ad Dominum Deum patrum suorum.
verses.english: Nevertheless, he did not remove the high places for idol worship, and the heart of the people was not yet fully devoted to the Lord, the God of their fathers.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Josaphat priorum et novissimorum scripta sunt in libris Jehu filii Hanani, qui digesta sunt in libros regum Israël.
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, from first to last, are written in the books of Jehu, the son of Hanani, which are recorded in the books of the kings of Israel.

verses.latin: Post hæc, adiit Josaphat rex Juda Ochoziam regem Israël, cujus opera fuerunt impiissima.
verses.english: After these things, Jehoshaphat, king of Judah, allied himself with Ahaziah, king of Israel, whose deeds were very impious.

verses.latin: Et pactus est cum eo ut facerent naves, quæ irent in Tharsis: feceruntque classem in Asiongaber.
verses.english: And he made an agreement with him to build ships that would go to Tarshish; so they built a fleet in Ezion-Geber.

verses.latin: Apparuit autem Eliezer filius Dodau de Maresa, prophetans super Josaphat, dicens: Quia habuisti fœdus cum Ochozia, percussit Dominus opera tua, et contrivit naves tuas: et non potuerunt ire in Tharsis.
verses.english: But Eliezer, the son of Dodavahu of Mareshah, appeared prophesying against Jehoshaphat, saying: “Because you have made an alliance with Ahaziah, the Lord has struck down your works and destroyed your ships; so they could not go to Tarshish.”

verses.latin: Mortuus est ergo Josaphat, et dormivit cum patribus suis, et sepultus est cum eis in civitate David: regnavitque Joram filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Therefore, Jehoshaphat died and slept with his fathers, and he was buried with them in the city of David. Then Jehoram, his son, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Hic autem quæ sunt reliqua sermonum Josaphat priorum et novissimorum scripta sunt in libris Jehu filii Hanani, qui digesta sunt in libros regum Israël.
verses.english: This verse is a duplicate of verse 34 and confirms the record of Jehoshaphat’s deeds, both early and late, written in the books of Jehu, son of Hanani, which are included in the books of the kings of Israel.

verses.latin: Regnavitque Josaphat super Judam: et erat triginta quinque annorum cum regnare cœpisset, et viginti quinque annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Azuba filia Selahi.
verses.english: This verse is a duplicate of verse 31 and re-emphasizes that Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah. He was thirty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for twenty-five years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Azubah, the daughter of Shilhi.

verses.latin: Dormivitque Josaphat cum patribus suis, et sepultus est cum eis in civitate David: et regnavit Joram filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Josaphat died and was buried with his ancestors in the City of David. His son Joram then reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Fuerunt autem ei fratres filii Josaphat, Azarias, et Jahiel, et Zacharias, et Azarias, et Michael, et Saphatias: omnes hi filii Josaphat regis Juda.
verses.english: Joram also had brothers, who were all sons of Josaphat. Their names were Azarias, Jahiel, Zacharias, Azarias, Michael, and Saphatias. All of them were sons of Josaphat, the king of Juda.

verses.latin: Deditque eis pater suus multa munera argenti, et auri, et pretiosum supellectilem, civitates quoque munitas in Juda: regnum autem dedit Joram, quia ipse primogenitus erat.
verses.english: Their father had given them many gifts of silver, gold, and valuable furnishings. He had also given them fortified cities throughout Juda. But he gave the kingship to Joram, because Joram was his firstborn son.

verses.latin: Surrexit ergo Joram super regnum patris sui: cumque se roborasset, occidit omnes fratres suos gladio, universos quoque principes Juda.
verses.english: Therefore, Joram took control of his father's kingdom. Once he had consolidated his power, he killed all his brothers with the sword, and all the leading men of Juda as well.

verses.latin: Triginta duorum annorum erat Joram cum regnare coepisset, et octo annis regnavit in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Joram was thirty-two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for eight years in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Ambulavitque in viis regum Israel, sicut ambulaverat domus Achab: filia quippe Achab erat uxor ejus, et fecit malum coram Domino.
verses.english: He followed the ways of the kings of Israel, just as the house of Achab had done, for his wife was the daughter of Achab. And he committed evil in the sight of the Lord.

verses.latin: Noluit autem Dominus disperdere domum David propter pactum quod inierat cum David, et quia promiserat ut daret illi lucernam, et filiis ejus cunctis diebus.
verses.english: However, the Lord was unwilling to destroy the house of David because of the covenant He had made with David, and because He had promised to provide a 'lamp'—meaning a continuous line of descendants—for David and his sons for all time.

verses.latin: In diebus illis rebellavit Edom ne esset sub Juda, et constituit sibi regem.
verses.english: In those days, Edom rebelled to break free from the dominion of Juda, and they established their own king.

verses.latin: Quam ob rem profectus est Joram cum principibus suis, et cuncto equitatu quem habebat: qui cum surrexisset nocte, percussit Edom, qui se circumdederat, et omnes duces equitatus ejus.
verses.english: Because of this, Joram set out with his commanders and all the cavalry he possessed. He and his forces rose up by night and attacked the Edomites who had surrounded them, striking down all the commanders of their cavalry.

verses.latin: Attamen liberatus est Edom, ut non subjiceretur Juda usque in præsentem diem. Eodem tempore et Lobna recessit, ne esset sub manu ejus: quia dereliquerat Dominum Deum patrum suorum.
verses.english: Nevertheless, Edom secured its freedom, and has not been subject to Juda down to the present day. At that same time, Libnah also revolted so that it would no longer be under his control, because Joram had abandoned the Lord, the God of his ancestors.
