verses.latin: Insuper et excelsa fabricavit in urbibus Juda: et lacere fecit habitatores Jerusalem, et ad idolatriae cultum compulit.
verses.english: Furthermore, he built high places for idol worship in the cities of Juda, and he led the inhabitants of Jerusalem to spiritual adultery by compelling them to worship idols.

verses.latin: Allatæ sunt autem ei litteræ ab Elia propheta, dicentes: Haec dicit Dominus Deus David patris tui: Quoniam non ambulasti in viis Josaphat patris tui, et in viis Asa regis Juda,
verses.english: Then a letter came to him from Elias the prophet, which said: 'Thus says the Lord, the God of your father David: Because you have not walked in the ways of your father Josaphat, nor in the ways of Asa, the king of Juda,'

verses.latin: sed imitatus es reges Israel, et fornicari fecisti Judam et habitatores Jerusalem, juxta fornicationem domus Achab, insuper et fratres tuos, domum patris tui, meliores te, occidisti:
verses.english: 'but instead have imitated the kings of Israel and have led Juda and the inhabitants of Jerusalem into spiritual adultery, just as the house of Achab did; and furthermore, you have murdered your own brothers, members of your father’s house, men who were better than you:'

verses.latin: ecce Dominus percutiet te plaga magna cum populo tuo, et filiis tuis, et uxoribus tuis, universaque substantia tua.
verses.english: 'behold, the Lord will strike you with a mighty plague—and your people, your sons, your wives, and all your possessions.'

verses.latin: Tu quoque aegritudine pessima vehementissime concideris ventris tui, donec egrediantur intrinsecus paulatim per singulos dies.
verses.english: 'You yourself will be struck down by a terrible and severe illness of your intestines, until, day by day, your intestines slowly come out of your body.'

verses.latin: Suscitavit ergo Dominus contra Joram spiritum Philisthinorum, et Arabum qui confini sunt Æthiopum:
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord stirred up the spirit of hostility against Joram among the Philistines and the Arabs, who dwell near the Ethiopians.

verses.latin: et ascenderunt in terram Juda, et depopulati sunt eam: sed et omnem substantiam quæ inventa fuerat in domo regis, et filios ejus, et uxores abduxerunt: nec remansit ei filius, nisi Joachaz, qui minimus natu fuerat.
verses.english: They invaded the land of Juda and plundered it. They carried away all the wealth found in the king's palace, along with his sons and his wives. No son was left to him, except Joachaz, who was his youngest.

verses.latin: Post hæc autem omnia percussit eum Dominus in visceribus ejus insanabili languore.
verses.english: After all these things, the Lord struck him with an incurable disease in his intestines.

verses.latin: Cumque diei succederet dies, et temporum spatia volverentur, duorum annorum expletus est circulus: et sic per longum tabe consumptus, emisit spiritum. Atque mortuus est in languore pessimo: et non fecit ei populus secundum morem combustionis, sicut fecerat majoribus suis.
verses.english: As days succeeded days, and the passage of time continued, the full cycle of two years was completed. And thus, consumed by a long, wasting sickness, he gave up his spirit. He died from a most terrible illness. And the people did not make a ceremonial burning for him, as was customary for his ancestors.

verses.latin: Triginta duorum annorum fuit cum regnare coepisset, et octo annis regnavit in Jerusalem: ambulavitque non recte, et sepelierunt eum in civitate David, verumtamen non in sepulchris regum.
verses.english: He was thirty-two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for eight years in Jerusalem. He did not walk in righteousness. And they buried him in the City of David, but not in the tombs of the kings.

verses.latin: Fecerunt autem sibi habitatores Jerusalem Ochoziam filium ejus minimum regem pro eo: omnem enim natu majorem interfecerant latrones, qui irruerant in castra cum Arabibus. Regnavitque Ochozias filius Joram regis Juda.
verses.english: The people of Jerusalem chose Ahaziah, Jehoram’s youngest son, to be the new king in his father’s place. This was because the bandits who had raided the camp along with the Arabians had already killed all of Jehoram's older sons. So Ahaziah, the son of King Jehoram of Judah, began his reign.

verses.latin: Quadraginta duorum annorum erat Ochozias cum regnare cœpisset, et uno anno regnavit in Jerusalem. Nomenque matris ejus Athalia filia Amri.
verses.english: Ahaziah was forty-two years old when he began his reign, and he reigned for only one year in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Athaliah, who was the daughter of Omri.

verses.latin: Sed et ipse ambulavit in viis domus Achab: mater enim ejus impulit eum ut impie ageret.
verses.english: But Ahaziah himself walked in the sinful ways of the house of Ahab, because his mother encouraged him to behave in an unholy manner.

verses.latin: Igitur fecit malum in conspectu Domini, sicut domus Achab: ipsi enim fuerunt ei consiliarii post mortem patris sui, in interitum ejus.
verses.english: So he committed evil in the presence of the Lord, just as the house of Ahab had done. Indeed, after his father’s death, Ahab’s family became his counselors, leading him to his own ruin.

verses.latin: In eorum consiliis ambulavit: et perrexit cum Joram filio Achab rege Israel in prælium contra Hazaël regem Syriæ in Ramoth Galaad: vulneraveruntque Syri Joram.
verses.english: He followed their sinful advice and went with Jehoram, the son of Ahab, who was the king of Israel, to fight against Hazael, the king of Syria, at Ramoth-Gilead. There, the Syrians wounded Jehoram.

verses.latin: Qui reversus est ut curaretur in Jezraël: habens plagas multas quas acceperat in supra dicto certamine. Ochozias autem filius Joram regis Juda descendit visitare Joram filium Achab in Jezraël, ægrotantem.
verses.english: Jehoram returned to Jezreel to recover from the many wounds he had received in that battle. Ahaziah, the son of King Jehoram of Judah, went down to Jezreel to visit Jehoram, son of Ahab, while he was ill.

verses.latin: Voluntatis quippe fuit Dei ut Ochozias veniret ad Joram: et postquam venisset, exiret cum eo ad Jehu filium Namsi, quem unxit Dominus ut extirparet domum Achab.
verses.english: It was, in fact, according to God's plan that Ahaziah came to visit Jehoram. After his visit, Ahaziah went out with Jehoram to meet Jehu, the son of Nimshi, whom the Lord had anointed to utterly destroy the house of Ahab.

verses.latin: Cum ergo Jehu extirparet domum Achab, invenit principes Juda et filios fratrum Ochoziæ, qui ministrabant ei, et interfecit illos.
verses.english: So when Jehu was annihilating the house of Ahab, he found the princes of Judah and the sons of Ahaziah’s brothers who served Ahaziah. Jehu then killed all of them.

verses.latin: Sequebatur autem Ochoziam, et comprehendit eum latitantem in Samaria: adductumque ad se occidit, et sepelierunt eum: eo quod esset filius Josaphat, qui quæsierat Dominum in toto corde suo. Et non fuit ultra spes aliqua ut de stirpe Ochoziæ, quisquam regnaret.
verses.english: Jehu pursued Ahaziah and found him hiding in Samaria. He was brought to Jehu, who then killed him. They buried Ahaziah because he was the son of Jehoshaphat, who had truly sought the Lord with all his heart. After this, there was no longer any hope that anyone from Ahaziah’s royal line would be able to reign.

verses.latin: Athalia ergo mater Ochoziæ videns quod mortuus esset filius suus, surrexit, et interfecit omnem stirpem regiam domus Juda.
verses.english: When Athaliah, Ahaziah’s mother, saw that her son was dead, she took action. She rose up and mercilessly killed everyone from the royal line of the house of Judah.

verses.latin: Porro Josabeth filia regis, assumens Joas filium Ochoziæ, furata est eum de medio filiorum regis, cum interficerentur: et posuit eum, et nutricem ejus in cubili. Josabeth autem quæ erat filia regis Joram, uxor Jojadæ pontificis, soror Ochoziæ, abscondit eum a facie Athaliæ, ne interficeretur.
verses.english: Nevertheless, Jehoshabeath, a daughter of the king, took Joash, Ahaziah’s son, and secretly removed him from among the other royal sons who were being killed. She then placed Joash and his nurse in a bedroom to hide them. Jehoshabeath, who was King Jehoram’s daughter, the wife of Jehoiada the priest, and Ahaziah’s own sister, concealed Joash from Athaliah so that he would not be killed.

verses.latin: Fuitque cum ea in domo Domini sex annis, abscondita: regnavit autem Athalia super terram.
verses.english: Joash remained hidden with Jehoshabeath in the Lord’s house for six years. During this time, Athaliah continued to reign over the land.

verses.latin: Post haec anno septimo confortatus Iojada assumpsit centuriones Azariam videlicet filium Jeroham, et Ismahelem filium Johanan, et Azariam filium Obed, et Maasiam filium Adaiæ, et Elisaphat filium Zechri: et iniit cum eis foedus.
verses.english: Later on, in the seventh year, Jehoiada gathered his strength and summoned the captains: namely, Azariah the son of Jeroham, and Ishmael the son of Jehohanan, and Azariah the son of Obed, and Maaseiah the son of Adaiah, and Elishaphat the son of Zichri. And he entered into a solemn covenant with them.

verses.latin: Qui circumeuntes in Juda collegerunt Levitas de cunctis urbibus Juda, et principes familiarum Israel, veneruntque Jerusalem.
verses.english: And they went throughout Judah, gathering the Levites from all the cities of Judah, and the heads of the Israelite families, and they all came to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et inito foedere universus cœtus in domo Domini cum rege, dixit ad eos: Ecce filius regis regnabit, sicut locutus est Dominus super filios David.
verses.english: And after they had made this covenant, the entire assembly, gathered with the young King Joash in the House of the Lord, heard Jehoiada say to them: 'Behold, the king’s rightful son shall reign, just as the Lord has promised concerning the descendants of David.'

verses.latin: Hic est ergo sermo quem facietis: Tertia pars vestrum qui ingrediuntur sabbato, sacerdotum et Levitarum, et ianitorum, sit in portis:
verses.english: Therefore, this is the plan you shall carry out: A third of you, those who are priests and Levites and gatekeepers, who come in for service on the Sabbath, shall be stationed at the temple gates.

verses.latin: et tertia pars ad domum regis, et tertia pars ad portam quæ appellatur Fundamenti: omne vero residuum populi sit in atriis domus Domini.
verses.english: And another third shall be stationed at the king's palace, and the final third at the gate called the Foundation Gate. All the rest of the people, however, shall remain in the courtyards of the House of the Lord.

verses.latin: Nec quisquam ingrediatur domum Domini, nisi sacerdotes et qui ministrant de Levitis: ipsi tantum ingrediantur, quia sanctificati sunt: et omnis reliqua turba custodiat præcepta Domini.
verses.english: And no one else shall enter the House of the Lord, except the priests and those Levites who are actively ministering. Only they may enter, because they have been set apart for holy service. All the rest of the people, however, shall observe the Lord's commands by remaining in the outer courts.

verses.latin: Circumdateque regem habentes unusquisque arma sua in manibus: et si alius ingrediatur templum, interficiatur: estote cum rege et intrante et egrediente.
verses.english: And you shall surround the king, each man with his weapons in his hands. If anyone else attempts to enter the inner courts of the temple, let him be put to death. You are to remain with the king, both when he enters and when he leaves.

verses.latin: Fecerunt igitur Levitae et universus Juda juxta omnia quæ præceperat Iojada pontifex: et assumpserunt singuli viros suos qui ingrediebantur sabbato, et egrediebantur sabbato: et non dimisit Iojada turmas sacerdotum.
verses.english: So the Levites and all of Judah carried out everything that Jehoiada the high priest had commanded. Each man took his designated soldiers—those who were coming on duty for the Sabbath, and those who were going off duty from the Sabbath—for Jehoiada did not dismiss any of the regular priestly divisions.

verses.latin: Deditque Iojada centurionibus lanceas et clypeos et parmas regis David, quas consecraverat in domo Domini.
verses.english: Jehoiada then gave the captains King David’s spears, large shields, and small shields, which had been consecrated — dedicated to God’s service — and stored in the House of the Lord.

verses.latin: Constituit autem omnem populum succintum gladiis a parte dextra templi usque ad partem sinistram altaris, et templi, ad regem circa.
verses.english: Then he stationed all the people, each girded with a sword, in a line extending from the right side of the temple to the left side of the altar and the temple, encircling the king.

verses.latin: Et eduxerunt filium regis, et imposuerunt ei diadema, et testimonium, et constituerunt eum regem: unxerunt quoque Iojada et filii ejus: et concinuerunt, ac dixerunt: Vivat rex.
verses.english: Then they brought out the king's son, Joash, and placed the royal crown upon his head, along with the scroll of the Law, which served as the royal insignia. They then proclaimed him king. Jehoiada and his sons also anointed him with oil, and everyone applauded and shouted, 'Long live the king!'

verses.latin: Audivit autem Athalia vocem populi currentis et laudantis regem: et ingressa ad populum in templum Domini,
verses.english: But Athaliah heard the noise of the people running and praising the king. So she went in among the people, into the House of the Lord.

verses.latin: vidit regem stantem super gradum in introitu, et principes, et tubas circa eum: et omnem populum terræ lætantem, et clangentem tubis, et cantantem vocibus, et cæterorum modulantium organis. Scidit ergo vestimenta sua, et ait: Conjuratio, Conjuratio.
verses.english: She saw the young king standing on the platform at the entrance to the temple, with the captains and trumpets all around him. All the people of the land were rejoicing, blowing trumpets, singing praises, and playing various musical instruments. Then Athaliah tore her clothes and cried out, 'Treason! Treason!'

verses.latin: Et præcepit Iojada pontifex centurionibus exercitus, et dixit eis: Educite illam extra conseptum templi, et interficiatur foris gladio.
verses.english: Then Jehoiada the high priest commanded the captains of the army, saying to them: 'Lead her out beyond the temple enclosure, and let her be put to death there, by the sword.'

verses.latin: Præcepit enim sacerdos, ne occideretur in domo Domini. Et fecerunt ei viam: et egressa de porta equorum, regiam juxta viam, interfecerunt eam.
verses.english: For the high priest had given orders that she should not be killed within the sacred confines of the House of the Lord. So they cleared a path for her, and as she left by the Horse Gate, near the path to the king’s palace, they put her to death.

verses.latin: Inito igitur fœdere Iojada cum universo populo et rege, ut essent populus Domini.
verses.english: Jehoiada then made a new covenant with all the people and with King Joash, ensuring that they would indeed be the Lord's own people once again.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est universus populus domum Baal, et destruxerunt eam: et altaria, atque simulacra confregerunt: Mathan quoque sacerdotem Baal interfecerunt coram altaribus.
verses.english: And all the people then went to the temple of Baal and completely destroyed it. They smashed its altars and idols into pieces. They also killed Mattan, the priest of Baal, right there before his altars.

verses.latin: Constituit quoque Iojada præpositos in domo Domini sub manu sacerdotum, et Levitarum, quos distribuit David in domo Domini, ut offerrent holocausta Domino, sicut scriptum est in lege Moysi, in gaudio, et canticis juxta dispositionem David.
verses.english: Jehoiada also appointed supervisors in the House of the Lord, under the authority of the priests and Levites, whom King David had originally assigned to their duties there. Their role was to offer burnt offerings to the Lord, as it is written in the Law of Moses, with joy and songs, according to the musical arrangements established by David.

verses.latin: Constituit autem et ianitores in portis domus Domini, ne ingrederetur immundus.
verses.english: He also appointed gatekeepers at the entrances to the House of the Lord, to ensure that no one ritually unclean would be permitted to enter.

verses.latin: Assumpsit quoque centuriones, et fortissimos viros, et principes populi, et omne vulgus terræ, et deposuit regem de domo Domini, et introduxerunt eum per mediam portam superiorem in domum regis, atque conlocaverunt in solio regali.
verses.english: Jehoiada also assembled the captains, the mighty warriors, the leaders of the people, and all the common folk of the land. They then escorted the king from the House of the Lord and brought him through the Upper Gate into the royal palace, where they seated him securely upon the royal throne.

verses.latin: Lætatusque est omnis populus terræ, et civitas conquievit: Athalia vero interfecta est gladio.
verses.english: All the people of the land rejoiced, and the city settled into peace, now that Athaliah had been put to death by the sword.

verses.latin: Annorum septem erat Joas cum regnare cœpisset, et quadraginta annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Sebia de Bersabee.
verses.english: Joash was seven years old when he began his reign. He reigned for forty years in Jerusalem, the city of peace. His mother’s name was Sebia, from the city of Beersheba.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod bonum est coram Domino cunctis diebus Joadae sacerdotis.
verses.english: And he did what was pleasing and right before the Lord God for as long as Jehoiada the priest lived.

verses.latin: Accepit autem illi Joada uxores duas, de quibus procreavit filios et filias.
verses.english: Jehoiada took two wives for King Joash, and from them, Joash begot sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Post hæc cœpit Joas cogitare ut repararet domum Domini.
verses.english: After these events, Joash began to consider how to restore the Temple of the Lord God.

verses.latin: Congregavitque sacerdotes et Levitas, et dixit eis: Ite per civitates Juda, et colligite de universo Israël pecuniam ut reficiatis templum Dei vestri per singulos annos: hoc festinate explere. Porro Levitæ cuncta neglexerunt.
verses.english: So King Joash gathered the priests and Levites and told them: "Go throughout the cities of Judah and collect money from all the people of Israel. This money is to repair the Temple of your God each year. Make haste and complete this task." However, the Levites completely neglected their duty.

verses.latin: Vocavitque rex Jojadam principem, et dixit illi: Quare non es curæ tibi ut a Levitis exigas pecuniam, quæ illata est ab Juda et Jerusalem, pro tabernaculo testimonii ?
verses.english: Then the king summoned Jehoiada, the high priest, and said to him: "Why have you failed to compel the Levites to collect the money that was brought from Judah and Jerusalem for the Temple, which houses the Ark of the Covenant?"

verses.latin: Nam Athalia quæ fuerat impia, et filii ejus demoliti sunt domum Dei, et omnes consecratas ædes templi Domini in usus baalim transtulerunt.
verses.english: For Athaliah, who was a wicked woman, along with her sons, had destroyed the Temple of God. They had even taken all the sacred vessels and consecrated articles from the Lord's Temple and used them to worship the false gods, Baalim.

verses.latin: Præcepit ergo rex, et fecerunt arcam: quam posuerunt juxta portam domus Domini forinsecus.
verses.english: Therefore, the king gave a command, and they made a chest. They placed this chest outside, next to the entrance gate of the Lord's Temple.

verses.latin: Et prædicatum est in Juda et Jerusalem ut deferrent singuli pretium Domino a Moyse servo Dei impositum super omnem Israël in deserto.
verses.english: And it was proclaimed throughout Judah and Jerusalem that everyone should bring to the Lord the temple tax, which Moses, the servant of God, had levied upon all Israel in the wilderness.

verses.latin: Lætantumque sunt cuncti principes, et omnis populus, et obtulerunt, et miserunt in arcam Domini, donec impleretur.
verses.english: And all the princes and all the people rejoiced. They offered gifts and put them into the chest of the Lord until it was filled.

verses.latin: Cumque tempus esset ut afferretur arca coram rege ab officio Levitarum (videbant enim pecuniam multam), veniebat scriba regis et quem primus sacerdos constituerat: effundebantque pecuniam quæ erat in arca: et rursum refferebant ad locum suum. Sic faciebant per singulos dies, et congregata est pecunia multa.
verses.english: And whenever it was time for the Levites' officials to bring the chest before the king (for they saw that much money had been collected), the king’s scribe would come, along with the official appointed by the chief priest. They would empty the money that was in the chest, and then return the chest to its proper place. They did this regularly, day after day, and a large sum of money was gathered.

verses.latin: Quam dederunt rex et Jojada his qui præerant operibus domus Domini: at illi conducebant ex ea cæmentarios et fabros, ut instaurarent domum Domini: fabros quoque ferri et æris, ut quod lapsus est repararent.
verses.english: The king and Jehoiada then gave this money to those who were in charge of the work on the Lord's Temple. These overseers used the money to hire masons and carpenters to restore the Temple. They also hired ironworkers and bronzesmiths to repair whatever had fallen into ruin.

verses.latin: Feceruntque hi qui præerant operi, et obducta est cicatrix operi, ac statuerunt domum Domini in statum suum, et firmiter reddiderunt.
verses.english: And those who were in charge of the work did so. The damage to the structure was covered over, and they restored the Temple of the Lord to its proper state and made it strong.

verses.latin: Cumque complessent opera, retulerunt coram rege et Jojada reliquam pecuniam: de qua fecerunt vasa in usum domus Domini, et tabulas, et phialas, et mortariola, et aurea, et argentea. Offerebant autem holocausta in domo Domini jugiter cunctis diebus Jojadæ.
verses.english: When the work on the Temple was completed, they brought the remaining money before the king and Jehoiada. From this money, they made vessels for use in the Lord’s Temple: tables, bowls, small mortars, and other vessels of gold and silver. And throughout all the days that Jehoiada lived, burnt offerings were continually offered in the Lord’s Temple.

verses.latin: Incurruit ergo Joada senex et plenus dierum: et mortuus est cum centum triginta esset annorum.
verses.english: Therefore, Jehoiada grew old and lived a long life, full of days. He died when he was one hundred and thirty years old.

verses.latin: Et sepelierunt eum in civitate David cum regibus, eo quod fecisset bonum in Israël, et cum domo ejus.
verses.english: They buried him in the City of David, among the kings, because he had done much good for Israel, both for the nation and for the household of God.

verses.latin: Postquam autem mortuus est Jojada, ingressi sunt principes Juda, et adoraverunt regem: qui delinitus precibus eorum, adquievit eis.
verses.english: But after Jehoiada died, the princes of Judah approached King Joash and bowed down before him, showing him homage. The king, swayed by their entreaties, agreed to their requests.

verses.latin: Et dimiserunt templum Domini Dei patrum suorum, et servierunt lucis et sculptilibus: et facta est ira magna contra Judam et Jerusalem propter hoc peccatum.
verses.english: And so, they abandoned the Temple of the Lord, the God of their ancestors, and instead served sacred groves and carved idols. Because of this grievous sin, great wrath came upon Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Mittebatque eis prophetas ut reverterentur ad Dominum, qui protestantes nihil audire voluerunt.
verses.english: God continually sent prophets to them to bring them back to the Lord, but even with their solemn warnings, the people refused to listen to anything.

verses.latin: Spiritus itaque Domini induit Zachariam filium Jojadæ sacerdotis, et stetit in conspectu populi, et ait eis: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Quare transgredimini præceptum Domini, quod vobis non prodest, et dereliquistis Dominum, qui dereliquit vos?
verses.english: Then the Spirit of the Lord came upon Zechariah, the son of Jehoiada the priest. He stood before the people and declared to them: "Thus says the Lord God: 'Why do you transgress the commandment of the Lord? This will bring you no good. You have forsaken the Lord, and therefore He has forsaken you.'"

verses.latin: Qui cum consurgentes adversus eum consensissent, lapidibus eum obruerunt ex præcepto regis in atrio domus Domini.
verses.english: But the people conspired against him and, at the king's command, stoned him to death in the courtyard of the Lord's Temple.

verses.latin: Et non est recordatus Joas rex misericordiæ quam fecerat Jojada pater ejus secum, sed interfecit filium ejus. Qui cum moreretur, ait: Videat Dominus, et requirat.
verses.english: King Joash did not remember the great kindness that Jehoiada, his father and mentor, had shown him, but instead had Jehoiada's son killed. As Zechariah lay dying, he cried out: "May the Lord see this injustice, and may He hold you accountable!"

verses.latin: Et cum recedisset annus, ascendit contra eum exercitus Syriæ: venitque in Judam et Jerusalem, et interfecit omnes principes populi, atque universam prædam direxit ad regem Damascum.
verses.english: And when a year had passed, the army of Syria marched against King Joash. They invaded Judah and Jerusalem, killing all the leaders of the people and sending all the plunder they had taken back to the king in Damascus.

verses.latin: Et quidem cum perparvus venisset numerus Syrorum, tradidit Dominus in manibus eorum infinitam multitudinem, eo quod dereliquissent Dominum Deum patrum suorum: in Joas quoque celeberrimum judicium fecerunt.
verses.english: Indeed, even though the Syrian army came with only a small number of soldiers, the Lord delivered a vast multitude of Judah's people into their hands. This was because Judah had abandoned the Lord, the God of their ancestors. And upon King Joash himself, a very severe judgment was executed.

verses.latin: Et abeuntes dereliquerunt eum magnis languoribus: surrexerunt autem servi sui, et ulti sunt sanguinem filii Jojadæ sacerdotis, et occiderunt eum in lectulo suo, et mortuus est: sepelieruntque illum in civitate David, sed non in sepulchris regum.
verses.english: When the Syrians withdrew, they left Joash afflicted with many painful diseases. Then his own servants rose up against him to avenge the shedding of the blood of Jehoiada the priest's son. They murdered him on his own bed, and so he died. They buried him in the City of David, but they did not bury him in the royal tombs alongside the other kings.

verses.latin: Insidiatique sunt ei Zamabath filius Semmaat Ammanitidis, et Jozabad filius Semer Moabiticæ.
verses.english: Those who conspired against him were Zabad, the son of Shimeath, an Ammonitess, and Jehozabad, the son of Shimrith, a Moabitess.

verses.latin: Porro filii ejus, et summa pecuniæ, quæ adunata fuerat sub illo, et instaurationes domus Dei, scripta sunt diligentius in libro regum: regnavit autem Amasias filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Furthermore, the details of his sons, the amount of money that had been collected during his reign, and the full account of the restoration of the Temple of God are all diligently recorded in the Book of the Kings. And his son Amaziah succeeded him as king.

verses.latin: Amasias viginti quinque annorum erat cum regnare coepisset : viginti novem annis regnavit in Jerusalem : nomen matris ejus Joadan de Jerusalem.
verses.english: Amasias was twenty-five years old when he began his reign. He reigned for twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Joadan, and she was from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod bonum est in conspectu Domini : verumtamen non in corde perfecto.
verses.english: He did what was good in the sight of the Lord, but his heart was not fully committed to God; his faithfulness was flawed.

verses.latin: Cumque roboratum esset imperium ejus, occidit servos suos qui occiderant regem patrem suum.
verses.english: When his reign was firmly established, he executed the servants who had murdered King Joas, his father.

verses.latin: Filios autem eorum non interfecit : juxta quod scriptum est in libro legis Moysi, sicut præcepit Dominus, dicens : Non morientur patres pro filiis, neque filii pro patribus suis : sed unusquisque in suo peccato morietur.
verses.english: However, he did not put their children to death. This was in accordance with what is written in the Book of the Law of Moses, where the Lord had commanded, saying: "Parents shall not die for their children, nor children for their parents, but each person shall die for their own sin."

verses.latin: Congregavit quoque Amasias Judam, et constituit juxta familias suas tribunos, et centuriones in universo Juda et Benjamin : et recensuit eos a viginti annis et supra, et invenit triginta millia juvenum qui poterant procedere ad prælium, et scire manum et dexteram.
verses.english: Amasias also gathered Judah and appointed military commanders for them, according to their families, placing tribunes and centurions throughout all Judah and Benjamin. He counted all men twenty years and older and found thirty thousand young men who were able to go out to battle and were skilled with weapons.

verses.latin: Mercede quoque conduxit de Israël centum millia robustorum, argenti talentis centum.
verses.english: He also hired one hundred thousand strong warriors from Israel for one hundred talents of silver. This was a mercenary army.

verses.latin: Venit autem homo Dei ad illum, et ait : O rex, ne sit tecum exercitus Israël : non est enim Dominus cum Israël, et omnibus filiis Ephraim :
verses.english: But a man of God, a prophet, came to him and said: "O King, do not let the army of Israel go with you, for the Lord is not with Israel, nor with all the sons of Ephraim." The Lord had rejected their alliance.

verses.latin: Quod si putas per hoc expediri exercitum tuum, fortiter age et esto robustus in bello : subvertet te Dominus coram hostibus : Dei quippe est et juvare et in fugam convertere.
verses.english: "If you think that your army will be strengthened by these mercenaries, then act boldly and be strong in battle. But the Lord will still cause you to be defeated before your enemies, because it is God who can both help and cause flight."

verses.latin: Dixitque Amasias ad hominem Dei : Quid ergo fiet de centum talentis quæ dedi militibus Israël ? Ad quæ respondit homo Dei : Habes unde tibi det Dominus multo his plura.
verses.english: Amasias then said to the man of God: "What shall then become of the hundred talents of silver that I have given to the soldiers of Israel?" To which the man of God answered: "The Lord has the means to give you much more than this."

verses.latin: Separavit ergo Amasias exercitum qui venerat ad illum ex Ephraim, ut reverteretur in locum suum : at illi contra Judam vehementer irati sunt, et reversi sunt in regiones suas.
verses.english: So Amasias separated the army that had come to him from Ephraim, sending them back to their own region. But they were extremely angry at Judah and returned to their own lands, full of rage.

verses.latin: Amasias vero confortatus, eduxit populum suum, et abiit in vallem Salinarum, et percussit filios Seir decem millia :
verses.english: Amasias, strengthened by God's counsel, led his people out and went to the Valley of Salt, where he struck down ten thousand of the sons of Seir, the Idumeans.

verses.latin: et decem millia aliorum ceperunt filii Juda viventes, adduxeruntque super verticem præruptæ cujusdam petræ, et deorsum projecerunt, qui universi in frustra comminuti sunt.
verses.english: And the sons of Judah captured ten thousand others alive. They brought them to the top of a certain craggy rock and threw them down from it, so that all of them were broken into pieces. This was a brutal act of war.

verses.latin: Porro exercitus, quem remiserat Amasias ne secum iret ad prælium, diffusus est super civitates Juda, a Samaria usque Bethoron, et interfectis tribus millibus, diripuit prædam plurimam.
verses.english: Meanwhile, the mercenary army that Amasias had sent back, refusing to let them go with him to battle, spread themselves over the cities of Judah, from Samaria all the way to Bethoron. They killed three thousand people and plundered a great deal of spoil.

verses.latin: Amasias autem post cædem Idumæorum, adduxit deos filiorum Seir, et statuit illos sibi in deos : et adoravit eos, et libabat illis.
verses.english: After Amasias returned from the slaughter of the Idumeans, he brought the gods of the sons of Seir, the defeated people, and set them up as his own gods. He worshipped these false gods and offered libations to them.

verses.latin: Iratusque Dominus contra Amasiam, misit ad illum prophetam, qui diceret : Quare requisisti deos populorum, qui non liberarunt populum suum de manu tua ?
verses.english: And the Lord was angry against Amasias. He sent a prophet to him, who said: "Why have you sought the gods of these foreign peoples, who could not even deliver their own people from your hand, let alone help you?"

verses.latin: Cumque hæc loqueretur, respondit ei : Numquid consiliarius regis es ? quiesce ne interficiam te. Cessavit ergo propheta, dicens : Scio quod cogitaverit Dominus occidere te : quia fecisti hoc malum, et ultra non audisti sermonem meum.
verses.english: As the prophet spoke these words, Amasias answered him: "Are you the king's counselor? Be silent, lest I have you killed!" So the prophet stopped, but he added: "I know that the Lord has decided to destroy you, because you have done this evil by worshipping idols and have no longer listened to my word."

verses.latin: Itaque Amasias rex Juda inito consilio, misit ad Joas filium Joachaz filii Jehu regem Israël, dicens : Veni, et videamus nos mutuo.
verses.english: Therefore, Amasias, king of Judah, after taking counsel with his officials, sent messengers to Joas, son of Joachaz, son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying: "Come, let us meet face to face in battle."

verses.latin: Misit ille nuntios, dicens : Carduus Libani misit ad cedrum Libani, dicens : Da filiam tuam filio meo uxorem : et transierunt bestiæ silvarum Libani, et conculcaverunt carduum.
verses.english: Joas sent messengers in return, saying: "The thistle of Lebanon sent to the cedar of Lebanon, saying: 'Give your daughter to my son as a wife.' But then the wild beasts of Lebanon passed by and trampled down the thistle." This was a parable, mocking Amasias.

verses.latin: Dixisti : Percussi Idumæam, et propterea erigitur cor tuum in superbiam : sede in domo tua : cur provocas malum, ut cadas et tu et Juda tecum ?
verses.english: "You have said: 'I have indeed defeated Idumea,' and because of this, your heart is lifted up in pride. Stay in your own home! Why do you provoke evil, that you should fall, you and Judah with you?" This was a direct warning against Amasias's arrogance.

verses.latin: Noluit ergo Amasias audire, quia Dei consilium erat ut traderetur in manibus hostium, propter deos Idumææ.
verses.english: But Amasias would not listen, because it was God's plan and judgment that he should be handed over into the hands of his enemies, because of his worship of the gods of Idumea.

verses.latin: Ascendit itaque Joas rex Israël, et congressi sunt mutuo, ipse et Amasias rex Juda in Bethsames Juda.
verses.english: So Joas, king of Israel, went up against Judah. And they met face to face, he and Amasias, king of Judah, at Bethsames, which is in Judah.

verses.latin: Corruitque Juda coram Israël, et fugerunt singuli in tabernacula sua.
verses.english: And Judah was defeated before Israel. Every man fled to his own tent, abandoning their king.

verses.latin: Porro Amasiam regem Juda filium Joas filii Joachaz, cepit Joas rex Israël in Bethsames, et adduxit in Jerusalem : et destruxit muros Jerusalem a porta Ephraim usque ad portam Anguli, quadringentis cubitis.
verses.english: Furthermore, Joas, king of Israel, captured Amasias, king of Judah, the son of Joas, son of Joachaz, at Bethsames. He brought him to Jerusalem and then broke down the walls of Jerusalem for four hundred cubits, from the Ephraim Gate all the way to the Corner Gate.

verses.latin: Omne quoque aurum et argentum, et universa vasa quæ repererat in domo Dei, et apud Obededom, et in thesauris regis, et filios obsidum, reduxit Samariam.
verses.english: He also took all the gold and silver, and all the vessels that he found in the house of God, and with Obededom, and in the king's treasuries. He also took hostages, the sons of the nobles, and brought them back to Samaria.

verses.latin: Vixit autem Amasias filius Joas rex Juda, postquam mortuus est Joas filius Joachaz rex Israël, quindecim annis.
verses.english: Amasias, the son of Joas, king of Judah, lived for fifteen years after the death of Joas, the son of Joachaz, king of Israel.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Amasiæ, priorum et novissimorum, scripta sunt in libro regum Juda et Israël.
verses.english: The rest of the acts of Amasias, both his early deeds and his later ones, are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.

verses.latin: Postquam vero recessit Dominus, tetenderunt ei insidias in Jerusalem, et fugit Lachis. Misitque post eum, et interfecerunt illum ibi.
verses.english: However, after Amasias turned away from following the Lord, a conspiracy was formed against him in Jerusalem, and he fled to Lachis. They sent men after him to Lachis and murdered him there.

verses.latin: Reportantesque super equos, sepelierunt eum in civitate David.
verses.english: And they brought him back on horses and buried him in the city of David, Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Omnis ergo populus Juda, accepit Azariam, annorum sedecim: et constituit eum regem pro patre suo Amasia.
verses.english: Therefore, all the people of Judah took Azariah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in place of his father Amaziah.

verses.latin: Ipse ædificavit Ailath, et restituit eam Juda, postquam dormivit rex cum patribus suis.
verses.english: He built Ailath and restored it for Judah, after King Amaziah had died and been buried with his ancestors.

verses.latin: Sedecim annorum erat Azarias, cum regnare cœpisset, et quinquaginta duobus annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Jechelia de Jerusalem.
verses.english: Azariah was sixteen years old when he began his reign, and he reigned for fifty-two years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Jechelia, and she was from Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod bonum est in conspectu Domini, juxta omnia quæ fecerat Amasias pater ejus.
verses.english: He did what was pleasing in the sight of the Lord, just as his father Amaziah had done.

verses.latin: Et quæsivit Dominum in diebus Zachariæ, prophetæ, qui intellexit et timet Dominum: et in diebus quærendi eum, direxit omnia.
verses.english: He sought the Lord's guidance during the time of Zechariah the prophet, who taught him to fear the Lord. And as long as he sought the Lord, God made him prosper in all his endeavors.

verses.latin: Ipse est qui expugnavit Philisthæos, et diruit muros Geth, et Jabniæ, et Azoti: ædificavit quoque oppida in Azoto, et in terra Philisthæorum.
verses.english: It was he who waged war against the Philistines and tore down the walls of Gath, Jabneh, and Ashdod. He also built new towns in the region of Ashdod and throughout the land of the Philistines.

verses.latin: Et adjuvit eum Deus adversus Philisthæos, et adversus Arabes, qui habitabant in Gurbaal, et adversus Ammonitas.
verses.english: And God helped him against the Philistines, against the Arabs who lived in Gur-Baal, and against the Ammonites.

verses.latin: Dederuntque Ammonitæ munera Oziæ: et divulgatum est nomen ejus usque ad introitum Ægypti, propter crebras victorias.
verses.english: The Ammonites brought gifts and tribute to Uzziah. His fame spread even to the border of Egypt, because of his many victories and his growing power.

verses.latin: Ædificavit quoque Ozias turres in Jerusalem super portam Anguli, et super portam Vallis, et super Anzæ, et munivit eas.
verses.english: Uzziah also built defensive towers in Jerusalem at the Corner Gate, at the Valley Gate, and at the Angle, and fortified them strongly.

verses.latin: Exstruxit quoque turres in solitudine, et fodit cisternas plurimas, eo quod haberet multa pecora: et in campestribus, et in planitie, vineas agricolas, et vinitores in montibus, et in Carmelo: erat quippe vir agricola.
verses.english: He also built watchtowers in the wilderness and dug many cisterns for water, because he had large flocks and herds. He employed farmers in the plains and lowlands for his fields and vineyards, and vine-growers in the hill country and on Mount Carmel, for he was a great lover of agriculture.

verses.latin: Fuit quoque exercitus præliantium sub manu Oziæ: trecenta et septem millia quingenti, qui et assidue faciebant bella.
verses.english: Uzziah also maintained a strong army of trained soldiers, numbering three hundred and seven thousand five hundred men, who were always ready for battle.

verses.latin: Et universi principes virorum fortium, duo millia sexcenti: per familias suas.
verses.english: All of these were under the command of two thousand six hundred valiant officers, each leading units from their own family clans.

verses.latin: Et sub eorum manu erat exercitus pugnatorum: trecenta et septem millia quingenti: qui proderant regi adversus adversarios.
verses.english: And under the command of these officers was the main army of fighters, totaling three hundred and seven thousand five hundred soldiers, who fought for the king against his enemies.

verses.latin: Præparavit quoque Ozias omni exercitui, scuta, et hastas, et galeas, et loricas, et sagittas, et fundas ad jaciendos lapides.
verses.english: Uzziah also equipped his entire army with shields, spears, helmets, coats of mail, bows and arrows, and slings for casting stones.

verses.latin: Et fecit in Jerusalem machinas, diversi generis, quas invenit vir ingeniosus, ut essent in turribus, et in angulis murorum, ut jacerent sagittas, et lapides maximos: et egressum est nomen ejus procul, eo quod adjuvaretur mirabiliter, donec invalesceret.
verses.english: In Jerusalem, he invented and built various types of ingenious war machines to be placed on the towers and at the corners of the walls. These machines could shoot arrows and hurl large stones. His fame spread far and wide because he was miraculously helped by God until he became powerful.

verses.latin: Cumque roboratus esset, elevatum est cor ejus in interitum suum: et neglexit Dominum Deum suum: ingressusque templum Domini, ut adoleret incensum super altare thymiamatis.
verses.english: But when he had become strong, his heart became proud, leading to his ruin. He then disregarded the Lord his God and entered the Lord’s Temple to burn incense on the altar of incense, which was forbidden to him.

verses.latin: Strenueque ingressus post eum Azarias sacerdos, et cum eo sacerdotes Domini octoginta, viri fortissimi.
verses.english: Then Azariah the high priest boldly went in after him, followed by eighty courageous priests of the Lord.

verses.latin: Restiteruntque Oziæ, atque dixerunt: Non est tui officii Ozia, ut adoleas incensum Domino, sed sacerdotum, hoc est, filiorum Aaron, qui consecrati sunt ad hujuscemodi ministerium: egredere de Sanctuario, ne contemnas: quoniam non reputabitur tibi in gloriam hoc est a Domino Deo.
verses.english: They confronted Uzziah and said to him: “It is not for you, Uzziah, to burn incense to the Lord! That is the duty of the priests alone—the descendants of Aaron—who have been consecrated for this sacred ministry. Leave the sanctuary at once! Do not defy God's command! For this act will bring you no honor from the Lord God, but rather His judgment.”

verses.latin: Iratusque Ozias, tenens in manu thuribulum ut adoleret incensum, statim ut indignatus est contra sacerdotes, orta est lepra in fronte ejus coram sacerdotibus in domo Domini super altare thymiæmatis.
verses.english: Uzziah, still holding the censer in his hand, became furious with the priests, intending to burn the incense regardless. But at that very moment, leprosy broke out on his forehead right there in the presence of the priests, inside the Lord's Temple, beside the altar of incense.

verses.latin: Cumque respexisset eum Azarias pontifex, et omnes sacerdotes, viderunt lepram in fronte ejus, et festinato expulerunt eum: sed et ipse trepidans exiit, eo quod sensisset plagam a Domino.
verses.english: When Azariah the chief priest and all the other priests turned to look at him, they saw the leprosy on his forehead and immediately rushed him out of the Temple. He himself also hurried out, for he knew that the Lord had afflicted him with the disease.

verses.latin: Fuit igitur Ozias rex leprosus usque ad diem mortis suæ, et habitavit in domo seorsum plenus lepra: ob quam causam et ejectus est de domo Domini, et Joatham filius ejus regebat domum regis, et judicabat populum terræ.
verses.english: King Uzziah remained a leper until the day of his death. He lived in a separate house, isolated because of his leprosy. Because of this, he was also barred from entering the Lord's Temple. Meanwhile, his son Jotham took charge of the royal palace, governing the people of the land.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Oziæ, primi et novissimi, scripsit Isaias filius Amos propheta.
verses.english: The rest of the events of Uzziah's reign, from beginning to end, were recorded by the prophet Isaiah, son of Amoz.

verses.latin: Dormivitque Ozias cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum in agro regio, eo quod esset leprosus: et regnavit Joatham filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Uzziah died and was buried with his ancestors, but they buried him in a royal field, not in the royal tombs, because he had been a leper. And his son Jotham reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Viginti quinque annorum erat Joatham cum regnare cœpisset, et sedecim annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Jerusa filia Sadoc.
verses.english: Jotham was twenty-five years old when he began his reign as king, and he ruled for sixteen years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Jerusha, daughter of Zadok.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod rectum est coram Domino, juxta omnia quæ fecerat Ozias pater ejus, excepto eo quod templum Domini non intravit, et adhuc populus delinquebat.
verses.english: He did what was right in the sight of the Lord, just as his father Uzziah had done in all things, except that he did not enter the Temple of the Lord—a transgression his father had made—and the people still continued to sin against God.

verses.latin: Ipse ædificavit portam domus Domini superiorem, et in muro quoque Ophel multa ædificavit.
verses.english: It was Jotham who built the upper gate of the Temple of the Lord, and he also constructed much on the wall of Ophel, a fortified section of Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Urbesque in montibus Juda ædificavit, et in saltibus castella et turres.
verses.english: He built cities in the mountains of Judah, and he also constructed fortresses and towers in the forests.

verses.latin: Ipse pugnavit contra regem filiorum Ammon, et vicit eos: præbueruntque ei filii Ammon in tempore illo centum talenta argenti, et decem millia choros tritici, et totidem millia choros hordei.
verses.english: He himself fought against the king of the Ammonites and conquered them. In that time, the Ammonites paid him one hundred talents of silver, ten thousand kors of wheat, and ten thousand kors of barley as tribute.

verses.latin: Hæc eadem et secundo, et tertio anno filii Ammon Jotham regi præbuerunt.
verses.english: The Ammonites continued to pay these same amounts to King Jotham in the second year and the third year of his reign.

verses.latin: Corroboratusque est Joatham, eo quod direxisset vias suas coram Domino Deo suo.
verses.english: Jotham grew strong in his reign, because he had directed his ways steadfastly before the Lord his God.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Jotham, et omnia bella ejus, et opera, scripta sunt in libro regum Israël et Juda.
verses.english: The rest of the acts of Jotham—including all his wars and his other deeds—are written in the book of the Kings of Israel and Judah.

verses.latin: Quadraginta et unius anni erat cum regnare cœpisset, et sedecim annis regnavit in Jerusalem. Dormivitque cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum in civitate David: et regnavit Achaz filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Jotham was forty-one years old when he began his reign, and he ruled for sixteen years in Jerusalem. He slept with his fathers—that is, he died—and they buried him in the City of David. His son Ahaz then reigned as king in his place.

verses.latin: Achaz duodecim annorum erat cum regnare cœpisset, et sedecim annis regnavit in Jerusalem: non fecitque rectum in conspectu Domini Dei sui, sicut David pater ejus.
verses.english: Ahaz was twelve years old when he began to reign. He reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem, but he did not do what was right in the sight of the Lord his God, unlike David his forefather.

verses.latin: Sed abiit per vias regum Israël, insuper et statuas fudit Baalim.
verses.english: Instead, he walked in the wicked ways of the kings of Israel, even casting molten idols for the false gods known as Baalim.

verses.latin: Ipse est enim qui adolevit incensum in valle Benennom, et filios suos combussit igni juxta sacrilegia gentium, quas Dominus interfecit in adventu filiorum Israël.
verses.english: For he himself burned incense in the Valley of Ben-Hinnom. He even burned his own sons alive in fire, following the abominable practices of the pagan nations that the Lord had driven out before the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Sacrificavit quoque et incensum posuit in excelsis, et in collibus, et sub omni ligno frondoso.
verses.english: He also offered sacrifices and burned incense on the pagan high places, on the hills, and under every leafy tree—places dedicated to idolatry.

verses.latin: Et tradidit eum Dominus Deus ejus in manu regis Syriæ, qui percussit eum, et adduxit multitudinem spoliata de ejus ad Damascum: Achan quoque tradidit in manibus regis Israël, et percussit eum plaga magna.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord his God delivered him into the hand of the king of Syria, who struck him down and carried away a great number of captives from Judah to Damascus. The Lord also delivered Ahaz—the king of Judah—into the hands of the king of Israel, who inflicted a great slaughter upon Judah.

verses.latin: Occidit Azarias filius Remeli centum viginti millia de Juda in uno die, omnes viros bellatores: eo quod reliquissent Dominum Deum patrum suorum.
verses.english: Azarias, son of Remaliah—the king of Israel—killed one hundred and twenty thousand men from Judah in a single day. All of them were mighty warriors, and this happened because they had forsaken the Lord, the God of their forefathers.

verses.latin: Eo tempore occidit Zechri, potens de Ephraim, Maasiam filium regis, et Ezricam ducem domus ejus, et Elcanam secundum a rege.
verses.english: At that same time, Zichri, a powerful warrior from Ephraim, killed Maaseiah the king's son, Azrikam the chief officer of the royal palace, and Elkanah, who was second in authority to the king.

verses.latin: Captivas quoque tulerunt filiorum Israël de fratribus suis, ducenta millia mulierum, et puerorum, et puellarum, et prædam plurimam: et adduxerunt in Samariam.
verses.english: The sons of Israel also took captive from their brethren in Judah two hundred thousand women, boys, and girls. They also took a vast amount of plunder and brought it all to Samaria.

verses.latin: Erat autem ibi propheta Domini, nomine Oded: qui egressus obviam exercitui venientium in Samariam, ait eis: Ecce iratus Dominus Deus patrum vestrorum contra Juda, tradidit eos in manus vestras, et occidistis eos atrociter, ita ut ad cælum pertingeret vestra crudelitas.
verses.english: Now there was a prophet of the Lord there, whose name was Oded. He went out to meet the army returning to Samaria and said to them: 'Listen! The Lord God of your forefathers was indeed angry with Judah and delivered them into your hands. But you have killed them with such cruel savagery that your cruelty has reached up to heaven itself, provoking divine wrath!'

verses.latin: Insuper filios Juda et Jerusalem vultis subjicere vobis in servos et ancillas, quod omnino non debetis: an et vos non peccastis Domino Deo vestro?
verses.english: Furthermore, you now intend to subjugate the people of Judah and Jerusalem to yourselves as male and female slaves. This is absolutely not right for you to do! Have you yourselves not also sinned against the Lord your God?

verses.latin: Nunc ergo audite consilium meum, et reducite captivos quos adduxistis de fratribus vestris: revertetur enim ira furoris Domini super vos.
verses.english: Now, therefore, listen to my advice: return the captives whom you have taken from your brethren. Otherwise, the fierce wrath of the Lord will surely return upon you.

verses.latin: Steterunt ergo viri de principibus Ephraim, Azarias filius Johannis, Barachias filius Mosollamoth, Jehezechias filius Sellum, et Amasa filius Adali, contra eos qui veniebant de bello.
verses.english: Then, certain men from among the chiefs of Ephraim—namely Azariah son of Johanan, Berechiah son of Meshillemoth, Jehizkiah son of Shallum, and Amasa son of Hadlai—stood up to confront those who were returning from the war.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt eis: Nolite adducere huc captivos, ne peccemus Domino: Vultis superaddere super peccata nostra, et super vetera delicta? grande quippe est peccatum nostrum, et ira furoris Domini super Israël.
verses.english: And they said to them: 'Do not bring the captives here, lest we add to our sin against the Lord! Do you wish to pile even more onto our already existing sins and ancient offenses? Indeed, our sin is already great, and the fierce wrath of the Lord is already upon Israel!'

verses.latin: Et dimisit exercitus captivos, et universam prædam coram principibus et omni turba.
verses.english: So the army released the captives and all the plunder in the presence of the princes and the entire assembly of people.

verses.latin: Steteruntque viri quos supra scripsimus, et apprehendentes captivos, et omnes qui nudi erant, vestierunt de spoliis: cumque vestissent et calceassent, et refecissent cibo et potu, unxissentque, et deduxissent eos curribus ad fratres eorum in Jericho civitatem palmarum, reversi sunt Samariam.
verses.english: Then the men whom we mentioned previously stepped forward. They took the captives, and all those who were naked, and clothed them with garments from the plunder. After they had clothed, shod, refreshed them with food and drink, and anointed them with oil, they then transported them by chariots to their brethren in Jericho, the City of Palms. Afterward, these men returned to Samaria.

verses.latin: In tempore illo misit rex Achaz ad regem Assyriorum, postulans auxilium.
verses.english: At that same time, King Ahaz sent an urgent plea to the king of Assyria, requesting military assistance.

verses.latin: Venere ergo Idumæi, et percusserunt multos de Juda, et asportaverunt prædam.
verses.english: For the Edomites had also invaded Judah, struck down many people, and carried away much plunder.

verses.latin: Phælistim quoque diffusi sunt per urbes campestres, et ad meridiem Judæ: et ceperunt Bethsames, et Ajalon, et Gederoth, et Socho, et Thamnan, et Gamzo, cum villulis suis, et habitaverunt ibi.
verses.english: The Philistines also spread throughout the lowland cities and the southern region of Judah. They captured Beth-shemesh, Aijalon, Gederoth, Soco, Timnah, and Gimzo, along with their surrounding villages, and then settled there.

verses.latin: Humiliaverat enim Dominus Juda propter Achaz regem Juda, eo quod nudasset eum auxilio, et contemptibiliter recessisset a Domino.
verses.english: For the Lord had brought Judah low because of Ahaz, the king of Judah. This was because Ahaz had stripped Judah of divine help and had contemptuously rebelled against the Lord.

verses.latin: Adduxitque contra eum Theglathphalasar regem Assyriorum, qui et afflixit eum, et nullo resistente vastavit.
verses.english: Then Tiglath-pileser, the king of Assyria, came against Ahaz. He not only afflicted Ahaz but also utterly devastated the land of Judah without any resistance.

verses.latin: Denudavit quippe Achaz domum Domini, et domum regum, et principum, et dedit regi Assyriorum munera, et nihilominus non profuit ei.
verses.english: Ahaz, indeed, stripped the house of the Lord, as well as the royal palace and the houses of the princes, and gave these treasures as gifts to the king of Assyria. Yet, despite all this, it brought him no benefit.

verses.latin: Insuper et tempore angustiæ et tribulationis suæ, auxit peccata quibus ante peccaverat contra Dominum.
verses.english: Moreover, even in the very time of his distress and suffering, King Ahaz only increased the sins he had previously committed against the Lord.

verses.latin: Immolaveruntque victimas diis Damasci percussi sunt qui eum, et ait: Dii regum Syriæ auxiliantur eis, quos ego adorabo, et dabunt mihi auxilium: cum e contrario ipsi fuerint ruina et cuncto Israël.
verses.english: Then Ahaz sacrificed victims to the gods of Damascus, claiming that these were the gods who had defeated him. And he said, 'The gods of the kings of Syria help them in battle, so I will worship them, and perhaps they will give me help.' Yet, on the contrary, these very gods became the ruin of Ahaz and of all Israel.

verses.latin: Congregavit ergo Achaz omnia vasa domus Dei, et concidit ea, atque clausit portas domus Domini, et fecit sibi aras in universis angulis Jerusalem.
verses.english: So Ahaz gathered all the sacred vessels from the house of God and cut them into pieces. He then shut the doors of the house of the Lord and made altars for himself in every corner of Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Sed et in cunctis civitatibus Juda fabricatus est aras ad cremandum thus: et ad iracundiam provocavit Dominum Deum patrum suorum.
verses.english: Furthermore, in all the cities of Judah, he built high places for burning incense to pagan deities. In doing so, he provoked the Lord, the God of his forefathers, to great anger.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum ipsius, et omnium operum illius, priorum et novissimorum, scripta sunt in libro regum Juda et Israël.
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Ahaz, and all his works, from first to last, are written in the Book of the Kings of Judah and Israel.

verses.latin: Dormivitque Achaz cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum in civitate Jerusalem: non enim receperunt eum in sepulchris regum Israël. Regnavitque Ezechias filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Ahaz slept with his forefathers, and they buried him in the city of Jerusalem. However, they did not place him in the royal tombs of the kings of Israel—meaning the ancestral burial grounds of Judah's kings—because of his wickedness. And his son Hezekiah reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Ezechias regnavit viginti quinque annorum, et viginti novem annis regnavit in Jerusalem: nomen matris ejus Abia filia Zachariae.
verses.english: Hezekiah was twenty-five years old when he became king. He reigned for twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Abijah, the daughter of Zechariah.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod placitum est coram Domino, juxta omnia quæ fecerat David pater ejus.
verses.english: And he did what was pleasing in the sight of the Lord, just as David his father had done.

verses.latin: Ipse in primo anno regni sui, mense primo, aperuit valvas domus Domini, et instauravit eas.
verses.english: In the first year of his reign, in the very first month, he opened the doors of the House of the Lord and restored them.

verses.latin: Adduxitque sacerdotes et Levitas, et congregavit eos in plateam orientalem.
verses.english: And he brought in the priests and the Levites, gathering them together in the eastern square.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad eos: Audite me, Levitæ: sanctificamini, et mundate domum Domini Dei patrum vestrorum, auferte omnem immunditiam de sanctuario.
verses.english: And he said to them, 'Listen to me, Levites! Sanctify yourselves and purify the House of the Lord, the God of your fathers, and remove all defilement from the sanctuary'.

verses.latin: Peccavimus vehementer patres nostri, et fecerunt malum coram Domino Deo nostro, dimittentes eum, averterunt facies suas a tabernaculo Domini, et post tergum verterunt.
verses.english: For our fathers have sinned greatly and done evil in the sight of the Lord our God. They abandoned Him, turned their faces away from the dwelling place of the Lord, and turned their backs to it.

verses.latin: Claudebant quoque ostia atrii, et extinguebant lucernas, et incensum non adolebant, et holocausta non offerebant in sanctuario Deo Israël.
verses.english: They also shut the doors of the portico, extinguished the lamps, did not burn incense, and did not offer burnt offerings in the sanctuary to the God of Israel.

verses.latin: Ideo iratus est furor Domini super Judam et Jerusalem, et tradidit eos in commotionem, et in stuporem, et in sibilum, sicut ipsi oculis vestris cernitis.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord's wrath was kindled against Judah and Jerusalem, and He delivered them into turmoil, into astonishment, and into a curse that makes people hiss in contempt, just as you yourselves see with your own eyes.

verses.latin: En patres nostri conciderunt gladiis, et filii nostri, et filiæ nostræ, et conjuges captivæ ductæ sunt propter hoc.
verses.english: Behold, our fathers have fallen by the sword, and our sons, our daughters, and our wives have been led away captive because of this.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo stat in corde meo ut feriam fœdus cum Domino Deo Israël, et avertatur a nobis ira furoris ejus.
verses.english: Now, therefore, it is my firm intention to make a covenant with the Lord, the God of Israel, so that the fierce anger of His wrath may turn away from us.

verses.latin: Filii mei, nolite negligere: vos elegit Dominus stare coram eo, et ministrare illi, et colere eum, et cremare incensum.
verses.english: My sons, do not be negligent! The Lord has chosen you to stand before Him, to minister to Him, to serve Him, and to burn incense.

verses.latin: Consurrexerunt ergo Levitæ: Maath filius Amasai, et Joël filius Azariæ de filiis Caath: porro de filiis Merari, Cis filius Abdi, et Azarias filius Jalaleël: de filiis autem Gerson, Joah filius Zimma, et Eden filius Joah.
verses.english: So the Levites rose up: Maath, son of Amasai, and Joel, son of Azariah, from the sons of Kohath. From the sons of Merari, Kish, son of Abdi, and Azariah, son of Jehalelel. And from the sons of Gershon, Joah, son of Zimmah, and Eden, son of Joah.

verses.latin: Nechahi et Oziel de filiis Elisaphan: et Samri et Jehihel de filiis Asaph:
verses.english: From the sons of Elizaphan: Nechahi and Oziel. And from the sons of Asaph: Samri and Jeiel.

verses.latin: Zacharias et Mathanias de filiis Heman: Jahiel et Semei de filiis Idithun:
verses.english: From the sons of Heman: Zechariah and Mattaniah. From the sons of Jeduthun: Jehiel and Shimei.

verses.latin: Congregatisque fratribus suis, et sanctificatis, ingressi sunt juxta mandatum regis, et præceptum Domini, ut emundarent domum Domini.
verses.english: After gathering their brethren and sanctifying themselves, they went in, according to the king's command and the Lord's precept, to purify the House of the Lord.

verses.latin: Sacerdotes autem ingressi templum Domini ut emundarent illud, extulerunt omnem immunditiam quam ibi invenerant in vestibulum domus Domini: quam cum Levitis egressi, transtulerunt foras in torrentem Cedron.
verses.english: The priests then entered the Lord's Temple to purify it and brought out all the defilement they found there into the vestibule of the Lord's House. After that, they went out with the Levites and carried it outside to the Kidron Valley.

verses.latin: Cœperunt autem prima die mensis primi sanctificare, et in die octavo ejusdem mensis ingressi sunt porticum templi: purificaveruntque templum diebus octo, et in die sextadecima mensis ejusdem cœperunt mundare, id est, templum Domini.
verses.english: They began to sanctify the Temple on the first day of the first month. On the eighth day of that month, they entered the portico of the Temple. They purified the Temple itself for eight days, and on the sixteenth day of that same month, they completed the purification of the Lord's House.

verses.latin: Ingressi quoque sunt ad Ezechiam regem, dicentes: Sanctificavimus omne fanum Domini, et altare holocausti, et universa vasa ejus, et mensam propositionis cum omnibus vasis suis.
verses.english: They also went in to King Hezekiah, saying, 'We have purified all the sacred parts of the Lord's House, the altar of burnt offering, and all its vessels, as well as the table of the bread of the Presence with all its vessels'.

verses.latin: Sed et omnia vasa quæ sub regno Achaz polluerat, cum despiceret legem Domini, hæc omnia purificavimus atque sanctificavimus, et sunt coram altari Domini.
verses.english: And all the vessels that King Ahaz, during his reign, had polluted when he scorned the law of the Lord—all these we have purified and sanctified, and they are now before the altar of the Lord.

verses.latin: Surrexitque Ezechias rex diluculo, et convocatis omnibus principibus civitatis, ascendit in domum Domini:
verses.english: Then King Hezekiah rose early in the morning and, gathering all the leaders of the city, went up to the House of the Lord.

verses.latin: obtulitque simul tauros septem, arietes septem, agnos septem, et hircos septem pro peccato, pro regno, pro sanctuario, pro Juda: dixit quoque sacerdotibus filiis Aaron ut offerrent super altare Domini.
verses.english: And he offered seven bulls, seven rams, seven lambs, and seven male goats as a sin offering for the kingdom, for the sanctuary, and for Judah. He also commanded the priests, the sons of Aaron, to offer them on the altar of the Lord.

verses.latin: Mactaverunt igitur tauros, et susceperunt sacerdotes sanguinem, et effuderunt super altare: mactaveruntque arietes, et illum quoque fuderunt super altare: et agnos immolaverunt, et similiter fuderunt super altare.
verses.english: So they slaughtered the bulls, and the priests received the blood and poured it upon the altar. Then they slaughtered the rams and also poured that blood upon the altar. And they sacrificed the lambs and, in the same way, poured their blood upon the altar.

verses.latin: Applicuerunt hircos pro peccato coram rege et universa multitudine, et imposuerunt manus suas super illos:
verses.english: They brought the male goats for the sin offering before the king and the entire assembly, who laid their hands upon them.

verses.latin: imposueruntque sacerdotes manus suas, et asperserunt illos in altare, pro expiatione omnium Israël: præceperat enim rex ut pro universo Israël holocaustum, et peccatum fieret.
verses.english: Then the priests laid their hands upon them and sprinkled their blood on the altar for the atonement of all Israel; for the king had commanded that the burnt offering and the sin offering be made for all of Israel.

verses.latin: Constituit quoque Levitas in domo Domini cum cymbalis, et psalteriis, et citharis, juxta dispositionem David regis, et Gad videntis, et Nathan prophetæ: siquidem Domini præceptum fuit per manum prophetarum ejus.
verses.english: He also stationed the Levites in the House of the Lord with cymbals, psalteries, and lyres, according to the ordinance of King David, and of Gad the king's seer, and of Nathan the prophet—for it was the Lord's command given through His prophets.

verses.latin: Steteruntque Levitæ cum organis David, et sacerdotes cum tubis.
verses.english: So the Levites stood with the musical instruments of David, and the priests with the trumpets.

verses.latin: Præcepitque Ezechias ut offerrent holocaustum super altare: cumque cœpisset holocaustum, cœpit simul et cantus Domini, et tubæ, et varia instrumentorum quæ sub David rege fabrefacta fuerant, per manus ministrorum.
verses.english: And Hezekiah commanded them to offer the burnt offering upon the altar. When the burnt offering began, the song of the Lord began simultaneously, along with the trumpets and the various instruments that had been made under King David's direction, by the hands of the Levite ministers.

verses.latin: Omnisque turba adorabat, et cantores, et tubæ concinebant: donec compleretur holocaustum.
verses.english: And the entire assembly worshipped, with the singers and trumpets sounding in unison, until the burnt offering was completed.

verses.latin: Cumque finita esset oblatio, incurvatus est rex, et omnes qui erant cum eo, et adoraverunt.
verses.english: And when the offering was finished, the king and all who were with him bowed down and worshipped.

verses.latin: Et præcepit Ezechias rex, et principes, Levitis ut laudarent Dominum sermonibus David, et Asaph videntis: qui laudaverunt eum magna lætitia: et curvato capite adoraverunt.
verses.english: Then King Hezekiah and the princes commanded the Levites to praise the Lord with the words of David and of Asaph, the king's seer. And they praised Him with great joy, bowing their heads in worship.

verses.latin: Locutus est autem Ezechias, et dixit: Nunc complestis manus vestras Domino, accedite, et afferte victimas et laudes in domum Domini. Obtulitque universa multitudo victimas, et laudes, et holocausta mente devota.
verses.english: And Hezekiah spoke further, saying, 'Now that you have consecrated yourselves to the Lord, approach and bring sacrifices and thank offerings into the House of the Lord.' So the entire assembly brought sacrifices, thank offerings, and burnt offerings with a devout heart.

verses.latin: Numerus autem holocaustorum quæ obtulit multitudo, iste fuit: tauros septuaginta, arietes centum, agnos ducentos.
verses.english: The number of burnt offerings that the assembly brought was this: seventy bulls, one hundred rams, and two hundred lambs.

verses.latin: Consecravit quoque Domino boves sexcentos, et oves tria millia.
verses.english: They also consecrated to the Lord six hundred oxen and three thousand sheep.

verses.latin: Sacerdotes autem pauciores erant, nec poterant sufficere ut pelles holocaustorum vellere deberent: unde et Levitæ fratres eorum adjuverunt eos, donec expleretur opus, et sanctificarentur alii sacerdotes: Levitæ quippe faciliores sunt ad emundandum se, et in meliori voto, quam sacerdotes.
verses.english: However, the priests were too few in number and could not suffice to flay all the skins of the burnt offerings. Therefore, their brethren the Levites helped them until the work was completed and other priests could sanctify themselves. For the Levites were more diligent and more willing to purify themselves than the priests.

verses.latin: Holocaustorum quippe plurima, et adipes pacificorum, et libamina holocaustis: et cæremoniæ domus Domini instaurantur.
verses.english: For there were many burnt offerings, along with the fat of the peace offerings and the drink offerings for the burnt offerings. Thus, the ceremonies of the House of the Lord were restored.

verses.latin: Lætatusque est Ezechias et omnis populus, eo quod ministerium Domini esset instauratione completum: subita quippe res fuerat.
verses.english: And Hezekiah and all the people rejoiced because the service of the Lord's House had been completely restored, for the matter had been accomplished so swiftly.

verses.latin: Et surrexit Hezechias, et omnis populus qui cum eo erat, et abiit in domum Domini.
verses.english: And Hezekiah rose up, and all the people who were with him, and went to the House of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et præcepit Ezechias ut offerrent holocausta super altare, et sacrificarent victimas pacificas.
verses.english: And Hezekiah commanded them to offer burnt offerings upon the altar, and to sacrifice peace offerings.

verses.latin: Et obtulit populus sacrificia et pacificas victimas, et omnes qui voluntate offerebant holocausta Domino.
verses.english: And the people offered sacrifices and peace offerings, and all who willingly offered burnt offerings to the Lord.

verses.latin: Et in die una obtulit populus holocausta centum septuaginta milia.
verses.english: And in one day, the people offered one hundred seventy thousand burnt offerings.

verses.latin: Misit autem Ezechias ad universum Israel et Iudam, scripsit quoque epistolas ad Ephraim et Manassen, ut venirent ad domum Domini in Ierusalem, et facerent Pascha Domino Deo Israel.
verses.english: King Hezekiah sent messengers to all the tribes of Israel and Judah, and he also sent letters to the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh. The purpose was to invite everyone to come to the Temple of the Lord in Jerusalem to celebrate the Passover of the Lord, the God of Israel.

verses.latin: Inierat enim consilium rex et principes eius, et omnis coetus in Ierusalem, ut facerent Pascha in mense secundo.
verses.english: For the king and his officials, along with the entire assembly in Jerusalem, had decided and agreed to celebrate the Passover in the second month.

verses.latin: Non enim poterant facere illud in tempore suo, quia sacerdotes, qui instauraverant se, pauci erant, et populus nondum fuerat congregatus in Ierusalem.
verses.english: They could not celebrate the Passover at its usual, appointed time because only a few priests had completed the necessary purification rituals for themselves, and the people had not yet gathered in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Placuitque sermo regi et omni multitudini.
verses.english: This decision was pleasing to the king and to the whole multitude of the people.

verses.latin: Et decreverunt ut nuntiarent in universo Israel, de Bersabee usque Dan, ut venirent et facerent Pascha Domino Deo Israel in Ierusalem: multi enim non fecerant sicut scriptum est.
verses.english: So they issued a decree to proclaim throughout all Israel, from Beer-sheba in the south to Dan in the north, that everyone should come to Jerusalem to celebrate the Passover of the Lord, the God of Israel. Many people had not celebrated it according to the law as it was written.

verses.latin: Perrexeruntque cursores cum epistolis ex manu regis et principum eius in universo Israel et Iuda, iuxta id quod rex iusserat, prædicantes: Filii Israel, revertimini ad Dominum Deum Abraham, et Isaac, et Israel: et revertetur ad reliquias, quæ effugerunt manum regis Assyriorum.
verses.english: So the runners went out with letters from the king and his officials throughout all Israel and Judah, as the king had commanded. They proclaimed: "Children of Israel, return to the Lord, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel. Then He will turn back to the remnant of you who have escaped the hand of the king of Assyria."

verses.latin: Nolite esse sicut patres vestri et fratres, qui recesserunt a Domino Deo patrum suorum, qui tradidit eos in interitum, sicut ipsi cernitis.
verses.english: "Do not be like your fathers and your brothers, who turned away from the Lord, the God of their fathers. He delivered them to destruction, as you yourselves can plainly see."

verses.latin: Nolite obdurare cervices vestras, sicut patres vestri: date manum Domino, et venite ad sanctuarium eius, quod sanctificavit in æternum: et servite Domino Deo vestro, ut auferatur a vobis ira furoris eius.
verses.english: "Do not be stubborn, as your fathers were. Submit yourselves to the Lord and come to His sanctuary, which He has sanctified for all time. Serve the Lord your God, so that the fierce anger of God may be removed from you."

verses.latin: Si enim vos reversi fueritis ad Dominum, fratres vestri, et filii, habebunt misericordiam coram dominis suis, qui illos duxerunt captivos, et revertentur in terram hanc: pius enim et clemens est Dominus Deus vester, et non avertit faciem suam a vobis, si reversi fueritis ad eum.
verses.english: "For if you return to the Lord, your brothers and your children will find mercy before their captors, who led them away as prisoners, and they will return to this land. For the Lord your God is gracious and merciful. He will not turn His face away from you if you return to Him."

verses.latin: Igitur cursores pergebant de civitate in civitatem per terram Ephraim et Manasse, usque ad Zabulon: illi autem irridebant et subsannabant eos.
verses.english: So the runners traveled from city to city through the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, all the way to Zebulun. However, the people there mocked and ridiculed them.

verses.latin: Attamen quidam de Aser, et Manasse, et Zabulon, acquiescentes consilio, venerunt Ierusalem.
verses.english: Nevertheless, some people from Asher, Manasseh, and Zebulun humbling themselves and accepted the invitation, came to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: In Iuda quoque facta est manus Domini, ut daret eis cor unum, ut facerent verbum regis et principum, iuxta præceptum Domini.
verses.english: In Judah also, the hand of the Lord was at work, giving them one heart and mind to obey the command of the king and the officials, according to the word of the Lord.

verses.latin: Congregati sunt itaque in Ierusalem populi multi, ut facerent solemnitatem azymorum in mense secundo: coetusque magnus nimis.
verses.english: Consequently, many people gathered in Jerusalem to celebrate the Feast of Unleavened Bread in the second month. It was an exceedingly large assembly.

verses.latin: Et surgentes everterunt aras, quæ erant in Ierusalem: atque universa in quibus idolis incensum adolebatur, subvertentes proiecerunt in torrentem Cedron.
verses.english: Then they rose up and removed the altars that were in Jerusalem, and all the altars where incense was burned to idols. They threw everything they tore down into the Kidron Valley.

verses.latin: Mactaverunt autem Pascha quarto decimo die mensis secundi. Sacerdotes quoque atque Levitæ, confusi, sanctificati sunt, et intulerunt holocausta in domum Domini.
verses.english: They sacrificed the Passover lamb on the fourteenth day of the second month. The priests and the Levites, feeling ashamed for their prior neglect, purified themselves and brought burnt offerings into the Temple of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et steterunt in ordine suo, iuxta dispositionem et legem Moysi viri Dei: sacerdotesque suscipiebant sanguinem de manibus Levitarum,
verses.english: They stood in their assigned places according to the arrangement and the law of Moses, the man of God. The priests received the blood from the hands of the Levites.

verses.latin: eo quod multitudo non esset sanctificata: et idcirco Levitæ mactaverunt Pascha pro omnibus qui non sanctificati fuerant, ut consecrarentur Domino.
verses.english: This was because a great many of the assembled people had not purified themselves properly. Therefore, the Levites sacrificed the Passover lambs on behalf of all those who were not purified, in order to consecrate them to the Lord.
