verses.latin: Magna enim pars populi, et multi de Ephraim, et Manasse, et Issachar, et Zabulon, non fuerant sanctificati, et comederunt Pascha non iuxta id quod scriptum est: et oravit Ezechias pro eis, dicens: Dominus bonus propitietur omnibus
verses.english: Indeed, a large part of the people—many from Ephraim, Manasseh, Issachar, and Zebulun—had not been purified, yet they ate the Passover meal in a way that was not according to what was written in the law. But Hezekiah prayed for them, saying, "May the good Lord show mercy to everyone,

verses.latin: qui in toto corde requirunt Dominum Deum patrum suorum: et non imputet eis quod minus sanctificati sunt.
verses.english: who sincerely seeks the Lord, the God of their fathers, even if they have not observed the strict purification requirements. May He not hold it against them that they are less than perfectly purified."

verses.latin: Exaudivitque Dominus Ezechiam, et sanavit populum.
verses.english: And the Lord heard Hezekiah and healed the people, forgiving their impurity and allowing them to participate fully.

verses.latin: Feceruntque filii Israel, qui inventi fuerant in Ierusalem, solemnitatem azymorum septem diebus in lætitia magna: laudantes Dominum per singulos dies, Levitis et sacerdotibus, organis quæ suæ arti congruebant.
verses.english: So the children of Israel who were present in Jerusalem celebrated the Feast of Unleavened Bread for seven days with great joy. They praised the Lord every single day, with the Levites and priests playing musical instruments that were appropriate for their sacred art.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Ezechias ad cor omnium Levitarum, qui habebant intelligentiam bonam super Dominum: et comederunt septem diebus solemnitatis, immolantes victimas pacificas, et confitentes Domino Deo patrum suorum.
verses.english: Hezekiah spoke encouragingly to all the Levites, who demonstrated good understanding in matters pertaining to the Lord. And for seven days, they ate the festival meals, offering peace offerings and confessing their sins and praising the Lord, the God of their fathers.

verses.latin: Placuitque omni multitudini, ut celebrarent etiam alios dies septem: et fecerunt cum ingenti lætitia.
verses.english: Then it pleased the entire assembly to celebrate for another seven days, and they did so with immense joy.

verses.latin: Ezechias enim rex Iuda dedit multitudini mille tauros, et septem millia ovium: principes vero mille tauros, et decem millia ovium: sanctificata est ergo sacerdotum plurima multitudo.
verses.english: King Hezekiah of Judah provided the assembly with a thousand bulls and seven thousand sheep. The princes, for their part, contributed a thousand bulls and ten thousand sheep. Thus, a very large number of priests were purified and ready for service.

verses.latin: Et lætata est omnis turba Iuda, tam sacerdotum et Levitarum, quam omnis multitudinis quæ venerat ex Israel: sed et proselytorum, qui de terra Israel, et de terra alienigenarum venerant.
verses.english: And the entire assembly of Judah rejoiced—both the priests and the Levites, and all the multitude who had come from Israel. Even the foreigners, who had come from the land of Israel and from foreign lands, joined in the celebration.

verses.latin: Factaque est celebritas magna in Ierusalem: ex quo enim tempore Salomon filius David regnaverat in Ierusalem, non fuerat aliquid tale in Israel.
verses.english: There was a great celebration in Jerusalem. Indeed, since the time of Solomon, son of David, had reigned in Jerusalem, nothing like this had happened in Israel.

verses.latin: Steteruntque sacerdotes et Levitæ, benedicentes populo: et exaudita est vox eorum in cælo sancto eius: et pervenit oratio eorum ad habitaculum sanctificationis eius.
verses.english: Then the priests and the Levites stood up and blessed the people. Their voice was heard in God’s holy sky, and their prayer reached His holy dwelling place.

verses.latin: Cumque haec fuissent rite celebrata, egressus est omnis Israël, qui inventus fuerat in urbibus Juda, et confregerunt simulacra, succideruntque lucos, et excelsa demoliti sunt, ac diruta altaria in universo Juda et Benjamin: sed et in Ephraim et Manasse, quoadusque omnia penitus everterent. Reversique sunt universi filii Israël in sedes et urbes suas.
verses.english: After King Hezekiah had properly celebrated these holy festivals, all the people of Israel who were present in the cities of Judah then went out. They broke the pagan idols, cut down the Asherah poles—which were false shrines to goddesses—tore down all the high places of false worship, and destroyed all the pagan altars throughout the territories of Judah and Benjamin. They even went into the northern territories of Ephraim and Manasseh, tearing down everything until all remnants of false worship were completely destroyed. After this, all the people of Israel returned to their own towns and homes.

verses.latin: Constituit quoque Ezechias turmas sacerdotum et Levitarum per vices suas, unumquemque in officio suo, tam sacerdotum quam Levitarum, ad holocausta et pacifica, ut ministrarent, et confiterentur, et canerent in portis castrorum Domini.
verses.english: King Hezekiah then organized the priests and Levites into their appointed divisions. Each of them was assigned to their specific duty, whether priest or Levite, for offering burnt sacrifices and peace offerings, to serve and give thanks, and to sing praises at the entrances of the Lord's encampment—referring to the temple.

verses.latin: Pars autem regis de substantia sua, in holocaustis, mane scilicet et vespere, et in holocaustis sabbatorum, et calendis, et festis diebus, sicut scriptum est in lege Moysi.
verses.english: The king also provided a portion from his own wealth for the burnt sacrifices, specifically for the morning and evening offerings, and for the burnt sacrifices on Sabbaths, New Moons, and other festival days, just as it is written in the Law of Moses.

verses.latin: Præcepit quoque populo qui habitabat in Jerusalem, ut darent partes sacerdotibus et Levitis, ut possent vacare legi Domini.
verses.english: He also commanded the people living in Jerusalem to give the assigned portions to the priests and Levites, so that they could dedicate themselves fully to the Law of the Lord without distraction.

verses.latin: Cumque jussio hæc in omnium animos pervenisset, plurima obtulerunt filii Israël frumenti, vini, et olei, mellisque, et omnis generis frugum: decimas obtulerunt.
verses.english: As soon as this command reached the hearts of all the people, the Israelites brought an abundance of grain, new wine, oil, honey, and every kind of produce from their fields. They brought in a full tenth of everything as offerings.

verses.latin: Sed et filii Israël et Juda, qui habitabant in urbibus Juda, obtulerunt decimas boum et ovium, et decimas sanctorum, quæ voverant Domino Deo suo: posueruntque cumulos plurimos.
verses.english: Also, the people of Israel and Judah who lived in the cities of Judah brought a tenth of their cattle and sheep. They also brought a tenth of all the holy offerings they had consecrated to the Lord their God. They piled these offerings up in many heaps.

verses.latin: Mense tertio cœperunt jacere fundamenta cumulus, et mense septimo consummati sunt.
verses.english: They began laying the foundations of these offering piles in the third month, which is around May/June, and they finished by the seventh month, around September/October.

verses.latin: Venitque Ezechias et principes ejus: et videntes acervos, benedixerunt Domino ac populo Israël.
verses.english: When King Hezekiah and his officials came and saw these large piles of offerings, they blessed the Lord and His people, Israel.

verses.latin: Interrogavitque Ezechias sacerdotes et Levitas, cur starent cumuli hi?
verses.english: King Hezekiah then asked the priests and Levites why there were so many of these piles of offerings.

verses.latin: Respondit illi Azarias sacerdos primus de stirpe Sadoc, dicens: Ex quo cœperunt offerri hostiæ Domino in domo Dei, comedimus et saturati sumus, et plurima superaverunt: eo quod Dominus benedixerit populo suo: et de reliquis ista sunt cumuli quos cernis.
verses.english: Azariah, the chief priest from the lineage of Zadok, replied to him, saying: "Ever since the people began to bring their offerings into the Lord's Temple, we priests have eaten and been fully satisfied. There is still a great abundance left over, because the Lord has blessed His people, and these piles you see are what remains."

verses.latin: Et præcepit Ezechias ut præpararent horrea in domo Domini. Quod cum fecissent,
verses.english: Then King Hezekiah commanded them to prepare storerooms within the Lord's Temple. When they had done this,

verses.latin: intulerunt in eis fideliter primitias et decimas, et quæcumque voverant. Fuit autem præfectus eorum Conenias Levita, et Semei frater ejus secundus.
verses.english: they faithfully brought in the first fruits, the tithes, and all the consecrated offerings into these storerooms. Coneniah, a Levite, was appointed in charge of these provisions, with his brother Shimei as his assistant.

verses.latin: Post quem Jchiel, et Azazias, et Nahath, et Asahel, et Jerimoth, et Jozabad, et Eliel, et Jesmachias, et Mahath, et Banaias, præfecti sub manu Coneniæ et Semei fratris ejus, ex imperio regis Ezechiæ et Azariæ præsulis domus Domini.
verses.english: Under the authority of Coneniah and his brother Shimei, and by the command of King Hezekiah and Azariah, the chief officer of the Lord's Temple, the following men were appointed as overseers: Jehiel, Azaziah, Nahath, Asahel, Jerimoth, Jozabad, Eliel, Ismachiah, Mahath, and Benaiah.

verses.latin: Core quoque filius Jemna Levita, janitor orientalium portarum, præerat his quæ sponte offerebantur Domino, et primitias sanctorum, et quæ vovebantur, distribuebat.
verses.english: Kore, the son of Imnah, a Levite who was the doorkeeper of the eastern gate, was in charge of the freewill offerings made to the Lord. It was his duty to distribute the consecrated first fruits and all the dedicated offerings.

verses.latin: Sub manu autem ejus Eden, et Benjamin, Josue, et Semeia, Amarias, et Sechenia, in civitatibus sacerdotum: ut fideliter dividerent fratribus suis, et majoribus et minoribus, singulis quibusque partes suas:
verses.english: Under Kore's authority, Eden, Benjamin, Jeshua, Shemaiah, Amariah, and Shecaniah faithfully distributed portions to their priestly brothers in their respective cities, giving each person their due share, regardless of age.

verses.latin: exceptis masculis, ab annis trium et supra, et cunctis qui ingrediebantur templum Domini, et inter suos ministerium suum per singulos dies, et ad custodias suas in vicissitudinibus suis.
verses.english: This distribution was for every male from three years old and up, for all who came into the Lord's Temple for service, and for those among their own people who performed their daily duties, according to their assigned shifts and responsibilities.

verses.latin: Sacerdotibus vero distribuebatur juxta familias et domos suas: et Levitis a vicesimo anno et supra, per officia et turmas suas.
verses.english: The priests also received their portions according to their family lines and households, and the Levites received theirs from twenty years old and up, according to their assigned duties and divisions.

verses.latin: Et cunctis parvulis eorum, et uxoribus, et filiis, et filiabus, et universæ multitudini: quia in sancta sanctorum fideliter omnes ministrabant.
verses.english: The portions were distributed to all their children—both young and old—their wives, sons, and daughters, and the entire assembly, because all these people faithfully dedicated themselves to the sacred services of the holy Temple.

verses.latin: Sed et in singulis urbibus per omnes Judas, sacerdotes, qui erant in suburbanis et in agris, divisere partes singulis descendentibus ex masculis sacerdotali genere, et Levitis.
verses.english: Furthermore, in every city throughout all of Judah, priests residing in the surrounding fields and pasturelands divided portions to every male descendant of the priestly lineage and to the Levites.

verses.latin: Fecit ergo Ezechias universa quæ diximus, in universo Juda: fecitque bonum, et rectum, et verum, coram Domino Deo suo.
verses.english: So King Hezekiah did all these things we have described throughout Judah. He did what was good, upright, and true in the sight of the Lord his God.

verses.latin: In omni opere quod cœpit in ministerium domus Domini, et in lege, et in mandatis, ut quæreret Deum suum, in toto corde suo operatus est, et prosperatus est.
verses.english: In every work he undertook concerning the service of the Lord's Temple, and regarding the Law and the Commandments, he sought his God with his whole heart, and he prospered greatly.

verses.latin: Post haec et huiuscemodi verba veritatis, venit Sennacherib rex Assyriorum, et ingressus est Iudam: et obsedit civitates munitas, volens eas capere.
verses.english: After King Hezekiah had faithfully carried out these reforms and delivered these words of truth and encouragement to the people, Sennacherib, the king of the Assyrians, invaded the land of Judah. He laid siege to its fortified cities, intending to conquer them all.

verses.latin: Cumque vidisset Ezechias venisse Sennacherib, et totum belli impetum verti contra Ierusalem:
verses.english: When King Hezekiah saw that Sennacherib had indeed invaded and that the entire force of the Assyrian war effort was now directed against Jerusalem:

verses.latin: iniit consilium cum principibus et fortissimis viris, ut obturarent capita aquarum, quae erant extra urbem: et annuentibus cunctis, operuerunt ea.
verses.english: Hezekiah consulted with his officials and his most capable leaders. Together, they decided to block up the water sources that were outside the city walls. With everyone agreeing to the plan, they proceeded to cover them.

verses.latin: Congregatusque est populus plurimus, et obturaverunt omnes fontes, et rivum qui fluebat in medio terrae: dicentes: Ne veniant reges Assyriorum, et inveniant aquarum abundantiam.
verses.english: A large number of people gathered together, and they blocked up all the springs and the stream that flowed through the middle of the land. They said, 'The kings of Assyria must not come here and find an abundance of water for themselves.'

verses.latin: Fortior quoque factus est, et aedificavit omnem murum, qui destructus erat, et superduxit turres: murum quoque alterum extra, et firmavit Mello civitatis David: et fecit arma cuiusque generis, et clypeos.
verses.english: Hezekiah then strengthened the city's defenses. He rebuilt all the parts of the wall that had been broken down and added towers upon it. He also constructed another wall outside the existing one, and fortified the Millo, a stronghold in the City of David. Furthermore, he had weapons of every kind made, along with many shields.

verses.latin: Et constituit principes belli super populum, et convocata multitudine iurante, locutus est:
verses.english: He appointed military commanders over the people. Then, gathering all the armed men, and with everyone swearing an oath of loyalty, he spoke to them:

verses.latin: Confortamini, et agite viriliter: nolite timere, nec paveatis a rege Assyriorum, universaque multitudine quae est cum eo: multo enim plures nobiscum sunt quam cum illo.
verses.english: 'Be strong and act courageously! Do not be afraid, and do not be dismayed by the king of Assyria or by the vast army that is with him. For there are far more with us than there are with him!'

verses.latin: Cum illo brachium carneum, nobiscum Dominus Deus noster, fortis et pugnans pro nobis. Et confortatus est populus sermonibus Ezechiae regis Iuda.
verses.english: 'With the king of Assyria is only the strength of mortal men, but with us is the Lord our God, who is powerful and will fight on our behalf!' And the people were greatly encouraged by the words of Hezekiah, the king of Judah.

verses.latin: Post haec misit Sennacherib rex Assyriorum servos suos in Ierusalem (ipse enim cum universo exercitu suo oppugnabat Lachis) ad Ezechiam regem Iuda, et ad omnes qui erant in Ierusalem populum, dicens:
verses.english: After these events, Sennacherib, king of Assyria, sent his officials to Jerusalem. (Sennacherib himself, with his entire army, was then besieging the city of Lachish). He sent them to King Hezekiah of Judah and to all the people who were in Jerusalem, with this message:

verses.latin: Haec dicit Sennacherib rex Assyriorum: In quo habetis fiduciam, quia sedetis obsessi in Ierusalem?
verses.english: 'This is what Sennacherib, the king of Assyria, says: In what do you place your trust, that you remain in Jerusalem under siege?'

verses.latin: Numquid non vobis seducit Ezechias, ut tradat vos in manus famis et sitis, affirmans: Dominus Deus noster liberabit nos de manu regis Assyriorum?
verses.english: 'Does not Hezekiah mislead you, to deliver you over to the suffering of hunger and thirst, when he claims: The Lord our God will deliver us from the hand of the king of Assyria?'

verses.latin: Numquid non iste est Ezechias, qui destruxit excelsa illius et altaria, et praecepit Iudae et Ierusalem, dicens: Coram uno altari adorabitis, et in ipso comburetis incensum?
verses.english: 'Is this not the same Hezekiah who destroyed the high places of worship and the altars, commanding Judah and Jerusalem, saying: You shall worship before only one altar, and upon it alone you shall burn incense?' —Sennacherib here misunderstands Hezekiah's reforms, which were against pagan idolatry, not true worship of God.

verses.latin: An ignoratis quid ego fecerim, et patres mei, cunctis terrarum populis? numquid valuerunt dii gentium singulorum terrarum liberare terram suam de manu mea?
verses.english: 'Are you unaware of what I and my predecessors have done to all the peoples of the lands? Have the gods of the various nations been able to deliver their lands from my hand?'

verses.latin: Quis est de universis diis gentium, quas vastaverunt patres mei et ego, qui potuerit eruere populum suum de manu mea, ut possit etiam Deus vester eruere vos de hac manu?
verses.english: 'Who among all the gods of the nations, which my predecessors and I have utterly destroyed, has been able to rescue his people from my hand, that your God should be able to rescue you from this hand of mine?'

verses.latin: Proinde non vos decipiat Ezechias, nec seducat levi persuasione: neque credatis illi. Si enim nullus deus universarum gentium et regnorum, potuit liberare populum suum de manu mea, et de manu patrum meorum: multo magis nec Deus vester poterit eruere vos de manu mea.
verses.english: 'Therefore, do not let Hezekiah deceive you, nor let him mislead you with such trivial persuasion! Do not believe him! If no god of any nation or kingdom was able to deliver his people from my hand and from the hand of my predecessors, then much less will your God be able to rescue you from my hand!'

verses.latin: Sed et alia multa locuti sunt servi eius contra Dominum Deum, et contra Ezechiam servum eius.
verses.english: Furthermore, Sennacherib's officials spoke many other blasphemous words against the Lord God and against His servant Hezekiah.

verses.latin: Epistolas quoque scripsit, plenas blasphemiae, in Dominum Deum Israel: et locutus est contra eum, quasi contra deos gentium terrarum, opera manuum populi.
verses.english: He also wrote letters filled with blasphemy against the Lord God of Israel. He spoke against God as if He were merely one of the gods of the other nations of the earth—gods made by the hands of men.

verses.latin: Clamaverunt quoque voce magna Iudaice, ad populum Ierusalem, qui sedebat in muro, ut terrerent eos, et auferrent civitatem.
verses.english: Then his officials shouted loudly in the Hebrew language to the people of Jerusalem who were on the wall. They did this to frighten them and cause them to surrender the city.

verses.latin: Locuti sunt autem de Deo Ierusalem, sicut de diis populorum terrarum, opera manuum hominum.
verses.english: They spoke of the God of Jerusalem just as they had spoken of the gods of the other peoples of the earth, saying they were merely the work of human hands.

verses.latin: Ezechias autem rex, et Isaias propheta filius Amos, oraverunt adversum hanc rem, et clamaverunt in caelum.
verses.english: But King Hezekiah and the prophet Isaiah, the son of Amoz, prayed against this situation. They cried out to God in the universe.

verses.latin: Et misit Dominus angelum, qui interfecit omnes fortes virorum, et bellatores, et principes exercitus regis Assyriorum: reversusque est cum ignominia in terram suam. Et cum intrasset domum dei sui, interfecerunt eum ibi gladio, filii eius qui de eo processerant.
verses.english: So the Lord sent an angel, who eliminated all the strong, valiant warriors, and the commanders, and the officers of the army of the king of Assyria. Sennacherib then returned to his own land in utter shame. And when he entered the temple of his god, his own sons, who had come from his body, killed him there with the sword.

verses.latin: Et salvavit Dominus Ezechiam et habitantes in Ierusalem de manu Sennacherib regis Assyriorum, et de manu omnium: et praestitit eis quietem per circuitum.
verses.english: Thus, the Lord saved King Hezekiah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem from the hand of Sennacherib, the king of Assyria, and from the hand of all their other enemies. He granted them peace on every side.

verses.latin: Multi quoque deferebant munera Domino in Ierusalem, et praesentes Ezechiae regi Iudae: et magnificatus est super omnes gentes post haec.
verses.english: Many people also brought gifts to the Lord in Jerusalem, and valuable presents to King Hezekiah of Judah. After these events, Hezekiah was exalted in the eyes of all the nations.

verses.latin: In diebus illis aegrotavit Ezechias usque ad mortem: et oravit Dominum, et audivit eum, et dedit illi signum.
verses.english: In those days, Hezekiah became ill and was close to death. He prayed to the Lord, and the Lord heard him and gave him a sign.

verses.latin: Non iuxta beneficia quae acceperat, reddidit Ezechias: sed elevatum est cor eius, et facta est ira super eum, et super Iudam et Ierusalem.
verses.english: However, Hezekiah did not return thanks according to the benefits he had received from God. Instead, his heart became proud, and the Lord's wrath came upon him, and upon Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Humiliatusque est propterea Ezechias, pro superbia cordis sui, tam ipse quam habitatores Ierusalem: et idcirco non venit super eos ira Domini in diebus Ezechiae.
verses.english: Yet, Hezekiah humbled himself because of the pride of his heart, both he and the inhabitants of Jerusalem. Therefore, the Lord's wrath did not come upon them during Hezekiah's lifetime.

verses.latin: Fecit autem Ezechias pecuniae et gloriae thesauros innumerabiles: et promptuaria condendorum thesaurorum, frugum, et vini, et olei, et praesepia universorum iumentorum, et caulas ovium.
verses.english: Hezekiah also amassed countless treasures of silver and gold, and great glory. He built storehouses for his treasures, for grain, wine, and oil. He also built stalls for all types of livestock and folds for sheep.

verses.latin: Urbes quoque extruxit: et armentorum, et pecorum, et ovium, ac suorum gregum innumerabilem multitudinem.
verses.english: He also built cities and acquired an innumerable multitude of herds of cattle, flocks of sheep, and droves of pigs.

verses.latin: Et civitates aedificavit sibi: et possessiones ovium, et armentorum, absque numero: multam quippe substantiam dederat illi Deus.
verses.english: He built cities for himself and acquired countless possessions of sheep and cattle, for God had indeed given him very great wealth.

verses.latin: Iste est Ezechias, qui clausit superiorem fontem aquarum Gihon, et avertit eas subter ad occidentem civitatis David: omnia opera eius prospera fuerunt, quae fecit.
verses.english: This was the same Hezekiah who blocked up the upper outlet of the waters of Gihon and directed them underground, bringing them to the west side of the City of David. All his undertakings were successful; everything that he did prospered.

verses.latin: Attamen in legatione principum Babylonis, qui missi fuerant ad eum, ut interrogarent de portento quod acciderat super terram, dereliquit eum Deus ut tentaretur, et nota fierent omnia quae erant in corde eius.
verses.english: Nevertheless, concerning the delegation of the princes of Babylon, who had been sent to him to inquire about the astounding sign that had occurred in the land, God left him to be tested. This was so that everything that was in Hezekiah's heart might be revealed and known.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Ezechiae, et misericordiarum eius, haec scripta sunt in visione Isaiae prophetae filii Amos, et in libro regum Iuda et Israel.
verses.english: Now, the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and his deeds of mercy, are recorded in the vision of the prophet Isaiah, the son of Amoz, and in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.

verses.latin: Dormivitque Ezechias cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum super sepulcra filiorum David: et universus Iuda et habitatores Ierusalem honorabant eum in morte illius: regnavitque Manasses filius eius pro eo.
verses.english: Hezekiah rested with his ancestors, and they buried him in the highest part of the tombs of the sons of David. All of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem honored him at his death. And Manasseh, his son, reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Annorum duodecim erat Manasses cum regnare coepisset, et quinquaginta quinque annis regnavit in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for fifty-five years in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecit autem malum coram Domino, juxta abominationes gentium, quas subvertit Dominus a facie filiorum Israël.
verses.english: But he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, imitating the detestable practices of the pagan nations whom the Lord had driven out from the land before the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Conversusque est, et aedificavit excelsa quae destruxerat Ezechias pater ejus: et erexit aras Baalim, lucosque fecit, et adoravit omnem militiam caeli, et coluit ea.
verses.english: He turned back and rebuilt the high places for pagan worship that his father Hezekiah had destroyed. He also erected altars for the Baals and made Asherah poles. He worshipped all the host of heaven—celestial bodies considered deities—and served them.

verses.latin: Aedificavit quoque aras in domo Domini, de qua dixerat Dominus: In Jerusalem erit nomen meum in aeternum.
verses.english: He even built altars for these pagan gods inside the house of the Lord, concerning which the Lord had said, 'My Name shall be in Jerusalem forever.'

verses.latin: Aedificavit autem altaria universae militiae caeli in duobus atriis domus Domini:
verses.english: He built altars for all the host of heaven—the celestial deities—in both courtyards of the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Siquidem et filios suos cremavit in valle Benennom: observabat somnia, sectabatur auguria, maleficis artibus inserviebat, et epulantium spirituum inquisitionem fecit: et multiplicavit quod malum est coram Domino, ut eum ad iracundiam provocaret.
verses.english: Indeed, he even burned his own sons as sacrifices in the Valley of Ben-Hinnom. He practiced divination, followed omens, engaged in sorcery, and consulted with mediums and spirits of the dead. He multiplied evil in the sight of the Lord, so as to provoke Him to anger.

verses.latin: Sculpsit quoque simulacrum, et posuit in templo Domini, de quo locutus est Dominus ad David, et ad Salomonem filium ejus, dicens: In domo hac, et in Jerusalem quam elegi de cunctis tribubus Israël, ponam nomen meum in sempiternum.
verses.english: He carved an idol, an engraved image, and set it up in the temple of the Lord, concerning which the Lord had spoken to David and to Solomon his son, saying, 'In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, I will put My Name forever.'

verses.latin: Et ultra non commovebo pedem Israël de terra quam tradidi patribus eorum: ita dumtaxat si custodierint facere quae praecepi eis, cunctamque legem, et caeremonias, et judicia per manum Moysi.
verses.english: And I will no longer move the foot of Israel from the land which I delivered to their fathers; that is, only if they carefully keep all that I have commanded them—the whole Law, the ceremonies, and the judgments given through Moses.

verses.latin: Igitur Manasses seduxit Judam et habitatores Jerusalem, ut facerent malum super gentes quas subverterat Dominus a facie filiorum Israël.
verses.english: So Manasseh led Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem astray, causing them to do more evil than the pagan nations whom the Lord had destroyed before the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad eum, et ad populum ejus, et attendere noluerunt.
verses.english: The Lord spoke to Manasseh and to his people, but they refused to listen to Him.

verses.latin: Ideo induxit super eos principes exercitus regis Assyriorum: qui cum cepissent Manassen, catenis et compedibus vinctum adduxerunt in Babylonem.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord brought upon them the commanders of the army of the king of the Assyrians. When they captured Manasseh, they bound him with chains and fetters and brought him to Babylon as a prisoner.

verses.latin: Qui cum tribularetur, oravit faciem Domini Dei sui: et egit poenitentiam valde coram Deo patrum suorum.
verses.english: While he was in distress, he earnestly prayed to the Lord his God. He repented deeply before the God of his fathers.

verses.latin: Et deprecatus est eum, et obsecravit ultra modum: et exaudivit eum, et reduxit in Jerusalem in regnum suum. Et cognovit Manasses quod Dominus ipse esset Deus.
verses.english: He pleaded with Him, imploring Him beyond measure, and God heard him. God brought him back to Jerusalem, to his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that the Lord Himself was God.

verses.latin: Post haec aedificavit murum extra civitatem David, ad occidentem Gihon in valle, et ab introitu portae Piscium per circuitum in Ophel: et exaltavit illum vehementer: constituitque principes exercitus in cunctis civitatibus Juda munitionem habentibus.
verses.english: After this, he built an outer wall for the City of David, to the west of Gihon in the valley, and from the entrance of the Fish Gate all around to Ophel. He raised it to a great height. He also appointed commanders of the army in all the fortified cities of Judah.

verses.latin: Et abstulit de domo Domini deos alienos, et simulacrum: universas quoque aras quas fecerat in monte domus Domini, et in Jerusalem, praecepit auferri foras jectasque procul.
verses.english: He removed the foreign gods and the idol from the house of the Lord. He also commanded that all the altars he had built on the mountain of the house of the Lord and in Jerusalem be taken away and cast far outside the city.

verses.latin: Instauravit quoque altare Domini, et immolavit super illud victimas pacificas, et laudem: praecepitque Juda ut servirent Domino Deo Israël.
verses.english: He also restored the altar of the Lord, and sacrificed peace offerings and thank offerings upon it. He commanded Judah to serve the Lord, the God of Israel.

verses.latin: Attamen adhuc populus immolabat in excelsis Domino Deo suo.
verses.english: Nevertheless, the people still offered sacrifices on the high places, though they were now dedicated to the Lord their God.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Manasse, et orationis ejus ad Deum suum, et verborum visorum quae locutus est ad eum, habentur in sermonibus regum Israël.
verses.english: Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, his prayer to his God, and the words of the seers who spoke to him—these are written in the annals of the kings of Israel.

verses.latin: Orationis quoque ejus, et exauditionis, et universorum peccatorum suorum, et contemptus, et loca in quibus aedificavit excelsa, et posuit lucos, et statuas, antequam ageret poenitentiam, scripta sunt in libris Hozai.
verses.english: His prayer also, and how God heard it, and all his sins and his contempt for God, and the places where he built high places and set up Asherah poles and idols—before he repented—these are written in the book of the seers (Hozai).

verses.latin: Dormivit itaque Manasses cum patribus suis, et sepelierunt eum in domo sua: regnavitque Amon filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: So Manasseh slept with his fathers, and they buried him in his own house. And Amon his son reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Viginti duorum annorum erat Amon cum regnare coepisset, et duobus annis regnavit in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Amon was twenty-two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for two years in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecitque malum in conspectu Domini, sicut fecerat Manasses pater ejus: et cunctis idolis quae Manasses fecerat, immolavit, et coluit ea.
verses.english: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, just as Manasseh his father had done. He sacrificed to all the idols that Manasseh had made, and he served them.

verses.latin: Et non humiliavit faciem suam ante Dominum, sicut humiliavit Manasses pater ejus: et multo amplius peccavit Amon.
verses.english: He did not humble himself before the Lord, as Manasseh his father had humbled himself. Indeed, Amon sinned much more grievously than his father.

verses.latin: Cumque conjurassent adversus eum servi sui, interfecerunt eum in domo sua.
verses.english: When his servants conspired against him, they killed him in his own house.

verses.latin: Porro ceteri populi caesis conjuratoribus, constituerunt Josiam filium ejus regem pro eo.
verses.english: But the rest of the people killed all those who had conspired against Amon, and they made Josiah his son king in his place.

verses.latin: Iosias autem octo annorum erat cum regnare cœpisset, et triginta uno anno regnavit in Ierusalem.
verses.english: Josiah was eight years old when he began to rule as king, and he reigned for thirty-one years in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecitque quod rectum est in conspectu Domini, et ambulavit in viis David patris sui: non declinavit nec ad dexteram, nec ad sinistram.
verses.english:
And he did what was right in the sight of the Lord,
walking in the righteous ways of his ancestor David,
without deviating either to the right or to the left.

verses.latin: Octavo autem anno regni sui, cum adhuc esset puer, cœpit quærere Deum patris sui David: et duodecimo anno cœpit mundare Iudam et Ierusalem ab excelsis, et lucis, et sculptilibus, et conflatilibus.
verses.english:
In the eighth year of his reign, while he was still a young man,
he began to seek the true God of his ancestor David.
Then, in the twelfth year, he began to cleanse Judah and Jerusalem
from all the false worship at the high places,
destroying the sacred groves, and breaking down all the carved idols
and molten images used in pagan rituals.

verses.latin: Destruxeruntque coram eo aras Baalim: et simulacra, quæ superposita fuerant, demolitus est: lucosque et sculptilia succidit, ac comminuit in frusta: et super sepulchra eorum, qui eis immolabant, sparsit.
verses.english:
Before King Josiah, his men tore down the altars dedicated to Baal worship.
He utterly demolished the idols that had been placed on top of these altars.
Then he cut down all the sacred groves and shattered the carved images into fragments.
Finally, he scattered these fragments over the graves of those who had offered sacrifices to these false gods.

verses.latin: Ossa quoque sacerdotum combussit super aras idolorum, et mundavit Iudam et Ierusalem.
verses.english:
He also burned the bones of the pagan priests upon their idolatrous altars.
Through these acts, he cleansed Judah and Jerusalem from defilement.

verses.latin: Sed et in urbibus Manasse, et Ephraim, et Simeon, et usque Nephthali cuncta suffodit, et evertit aras,
verses.english:
And in the cities of Manasseh, Ephraim, and Simeon, and extending even to Naphtali,
he thoroughly destroyed all the places of worship,
overthrowing the altars.

verses.latin: et lucos, et sculptilia contrivit in frusta, et universas aras idolorum demolitus est in universa terra Israël: reversusque est in Ierusalem.
verses.english:
He crushed the sacred groves and carved images into tiny pieces.
He demolished every single idolatrous altar throughout the entire land of Israel.
After this extensive work, he returned to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Igitur decimo octavo anno regni sui, cum mundasset terram et templum, misit Sadoc filium Ezechiel, et Raïam filium Maasæ, et Ioa filium Ioachaz cancellarii, ut instaurarent domum Domini Dei sui.
verses.english:
Then, in the eighteenth year of his reign, after he had cleansed the land and the Temple from pagan worship,
King Josiah sent Zadok the son of Ezekiel, and Raiah the son of Maaseiah, and Joah the son of Joahaz, the chancellor,
with a mission to restore and repair the House of the Lord, their God.

verses.latin: Qui venerunt ad Helciam sacerdotem magnum, et acceperunt ab eo pecuniam quæ allata fuerat in domum Domini: quam contulerant Levitæ, et ianitores de Manasse, et Ephraim, et universi reliqui Israël, et omnes Iuda, et Benjamin, et habitatores Ierusalem.
verses.english:
These men came to Hilkiah the high priest and received from him the money
that had been brought into the House of the Lord.
This money had been contributed by the Levites and the gatekeepers
from the tribes of Manasseh and Ephraim, and from all the rest of Israel,
as well as from all of Judah and Benjamin, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Dederuntque in manu eorum qui præerant artificibus in domo Domini, ut ipsi distribuerent his qui operabantur in ædibus Domini, ad instauranda templi fastigia.
verses.english:
They then gave the money into the hand of those who were overseeing the workers in the House of the Lord.
These overseers were to distribute it to the laborers who were working on the Temple,
specifically for the restoration of the Temple's upper parts and structures.

verses.latin: Artificibus quoque et cæmentariis dederunt, ut emerent lapides de cœsis, et ligna ad commissuras ædium, et ad contignationem.
verses.english:
They also gave funds to the craftsmen and masons,
so they could purchase quarried stones and timber
for the structural joints of the building and for the roofing and beams.

verses.latin: Qui omnia fideliter faciebant. Erant autem præpositi operum Levitæ, Ieheth, et Abdias filii Merari, Zacharias et Mosollam de filiis Caath, qui urgebant: alii quoque Levitæ omnes intelligentes organa musica.
verses.english:
All of these workers carried out their tasks faithfully.
The Levites appointed as supervisors for the work were Jahath and Obadiah, sons of Merari,
and Zechariah and Meshullam, from the sons of Kohath; these men diligently urged on the work.
Other Levites, all skilled in musical instruments, were also involved.

verses.latin: Hi autem qui erant præ cæmentariis, et per singula opera, ad diversa officia, suos disponebant, de Levitis eruditis ad scribendum, et magistris, et ianitoribus.
verses.english:
Moreover, those who were overseeing the masons and each individual task,
assigned their own men to various duties.
These included Levites who were educated as scribes, as well as overseers and gatekeepers.

verses.latin: Cumque efferrent pecuniam quæ illata fuerat in templum Domini, invenit Helcias sacerdos librum legis Domini, per manum Moysi.
verses.english:
As they were taking out the money that had been brought into the Temple of the Lord,
Hilkiah the priest discovered the book of the Law of the Lord, written by the hand of Moses.

verses.latin: Dixitque Helcias ad Saphon scribam: Librum legis inveni in domo Domini: et dedit illi.
verses.english:
Hilkiah then said to Shaphan the scribe,
"I have found the book of the Law in the House of the Lord!"
And he gave the book to Shaphan.

verses.latin: At ille intulit librum ad regem, et nuntiavit ei dicens: Omnis pecunia quæ tradita est in manu servorum tuorum, impleta est.
verses.english:
Shaphan then brought the book to the king and reported to him, saying,
"All the money that was given into the hand of your servants has been accounted for and disbursed."

verses.latin: Nam et hactenus conflarunt argentum quod repertum est in domo Domini: dederuntque præfectis artificum, et fabris.
verses.english:
He continued, "They have even melted down the silver that was found in the House of the Lord,
and they have given it to the overseers of the craftsmen and to the artisans."

verses.latin: Præterea, inquit, librum inveni in domo Domini, et dedit Saphon regi.
verses.english:
Shaphan then added, "Furthermore, I have found a book in the House of the Lord."
And Shaphan presented the book to the king.

verses.latin: Quem cum legisset coram illo, et audisset rex verba legis, scidit vestimenta sua.
verses.english:
When the king read the words of the Law and heard its pronouncements,
he was so distressed that he tore his garments in a sign of repentance and mourning.

verses.latin: Et præcepit Helciæ, et Ahicam filio Saphon, et Abdon filio Micha, et Saphon scribæ, et Asaïæ servo regis, dicens:
verses.english:
Then King Josiah commanded Hilkiah, and Ahikam the son of Shaphan,
and Abdon the son of Micah, and Shaphan the scribe, and Asaiah, the king's servant, saying:

verses.latin: Ite, et consulite Dominum pro me, et pro reliquiis Israël, et Iuda, super universis sermonibus libri qui repertus est: magnus enim furor Domini effusus est super nos, eo quod non custodierint patres nostri verba Domini, ut facerent omnia quæ scripta sunt in libro isto.
verses.english:
"Go and inquire of the Lord for me, and for the remnant of Israel and Judah,
concerning all the words of the book that has been found.
For great indeed is the wrath of the Lord that has been poured out upon us,
because our fathers did not keep the words of the Lord,
and did not do all that is written in this very book."

verses.latin: Abiit ergo Helcias, et hi qui simul a rege missi fuerant, ad Oldam prophetissam, uxorem Sellum filii Thecuath, filii Hasra custodis vestium, quæ habitabat in Ierusalem in secunda: et locuti sunt ei verba quæ supra narravimus.
verses.english:
So Hilkiah and those who had been sent with him by the king went to Huldah the prophetess.
She was the wife of Shallum, the son of Tokhath, the son of Hasrah, the keeper of the wardrobe.
She resided in Jerusalem in the Second Quarter of the city.
They spoke to her the words which we have related above.

verses.latin: At illa respondit eis: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Dicite viro qui misit vos ad me:
verses.english:
She answered them, "Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel:
'Say to the man who sent you to me:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Ecce ego inducam mala super locum istum, et super habitatores eius, cuncta maledicta quæ scripta sunt in libro hoc, quem legerunt coram rege Iuda:
verses.english:
Thus says the Lord: 'Behold, I am bringing disaster upon this place and upon its inhabitants,
all the curses that are written in this book which they have read before the king of Judah:

verses.latin: quia dereliquerunt me, et sacrificaverunt diis alienis, ut me ad iracundiam provocarent in cunctis operibus manuum suarum: idcirco effundetur furor meus super locum istum, et non extinguetur.
verses.english:
Because they have forsaken Me and have offered sacrifices to foreign gods,
provoking Me to righteous anger with all the works of their hands,
therefore My burning wrath will be poured out upon this place and it will not be extinguished.'"

verses.latin: Ad regem autem Iuda, qui misit vos interrogare Dominum, sic dicetis: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël:
verses.english:
But to the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of the Lord, you shall say this:
"Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel:

verses.latin: Pro eo quod audisti verba libri, et expavit cor tuum, et humiliatus es in conspectu Dei super his quæ dicta sunt contra locum hunc, et contra habitatores Ierusalem, et humiliasti te coram me, et scidisti vestimenta tua, et plorasti coram me: ego audivi te, dicit Dominus.
verses.english:
Because your heart was softened when you heard the words of the book,
and you humbled yourself before God concerning what was spoken against this place and against the inhabitants of Jerusalem;
and because you humbled yourself before Me, and tore your garments, and wept before Me,
I have indeed heard you, declares the Lord.

verses.latin: Ecce ego colligam te ad patres tuos, et infereris ad sepulchrum tuum in pace: nec videbunt oculi tui omne malum quod ego inducturus sum super locum istum, et super habitatores eius. Retulerunt ergo regi quæ dixerant.
verses.english:
Behold, I will gather you to your fathers, and you shall be brought to your tomb in peace.
Your eyes will not see all the evil that I am bringing upon this place and upon its inhabitants."
So they reported to the king all that Huldah had said.

verses.latin: Convocatis itaque rex cunctis senioribus Iudæ et Ierusalem,
verses.english: Therefore, the king convened all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.latin: ascendit in domum Domini, et omnes viri Iuda, et habitatores Ierusalem, sacerdotes, Levitæ, et cunctus populus a minimo usque ad maximum. Quibus audientibus, legit rex omnia verba libri fœderis, qui inventus fuerat in domo Domini.
verses.english:
Then the king went up to the House of the Lord,
and with him went all the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem,
the priests, the Levites, and all the people, from the least to the greatest.
In their hearing, the king read all the words of the book of the covenant that had been found in the House of the Lord.

verses.latin: Stetitque in gradu suo, et percussit fœdus coram Domino, ut ambularet post Dominum, et custodiret mandata eius, et testimonia, et iustificationes in universo corde suo, et in tota anima sua, faceretque quæ scripta sunt in libro illo, qui inventus fuerat.
verses.english:
The king stood in his place of authority and made a solemn covenant before the Lord:
that he would walk after the Lord and keep His commandments, and His testimonies, and His statutes
with all his heart and with all his soul,
and that he would fulfill all that was written in that book which had been found.

verses.latin: Adjunxit quoque ut omnes qui reperti fuerant in Ierusalem et Benjamin, stare deberent super pactum: et fecerunt habitatores Ierusalem juxta pactum Domini Dei patrum suorum.
verses.english:
He also compelled all who were found in Jerusalem and Benjamin to stand by this covenant.
And the inhabitants of Jerusalem acted according to the covenant of the Lord, the God of their fathers.

verses.latin: Abstulit ergo Iosias omnes abominationes de universis regionibus filiorum Israël: et fecit omnes, qui residui erant in Israël, servire Domino Deo suo. Cunctis diebus illius non recesserunt a Domino Deo patrum suorum.
verses.english:
So Josiah removed all the abominations from all the regions of the sons of Israel.
He made all who remained in Israel serve the Lord their God.
Throughout all his days, they did not turn away from the Lord, the God of their fathers.

verses.latin: Fecit autem Iosias in Ierusalem Phase Domini, et immolaverunt Pascha quartadecima die mensis primi.
verses.english: Josiah celebrated the Lord's Passover in Jerusalem, and they sacrificed the Passover lamb on the fourteenth day of the first month.

verses.latin: Et constituit sacerdotes in officiis suis, et confortatus est ad ministerium Domini.
verses.english: He appointed the priests to their duties and strengthened them for the service of the Lord.

verses.latin: Dixitque Levitis, quorum inter omnem Israel sacrum nomen erat, et qui sanctificati erant Domino: Ponite arcam in templo, quod ædificavit Salomon filius David rex Israel: ne sit vobis onus neque humeris. Nunc ministrate Domino Deo vestro, et populo eius Israel.
verses.english: Then he spoke to the Levites, whose name was sacred among all Israel and who were consecrated to the Lord, saying: "Place the Ark in the temple that Solomon, the son of David, King of Israel, built. Let it no longer be a burden on your shoulders. Now, serve the Lord your God and His people, Israel."

verses.latin: Et præparate vos per familias et cognationes vestras in divisionibus singulorum, sicut præcepit David rex Israel, et sicut scripsit Salomon filius eius.
verses.english: And prepare yourselves according to your families and clans in their respective divisions, just as David, the king of Israel, commanded and as Solomon, his son, wrote.

verses.latin: Et ministrate in sanctuario per familias et turmas Leviticas, præsidentibus fratribus vestris filiis populi, et per choros cognationum Leviticarum.
verses.english: Serve in the sanctuary by your Levitical families and groups, with your brethren, the sons of the people, presiding, and by the courses of the Levitical clans.

verses.latin: Et immolate Phase: sanctificamini, et præparate fratres vestros, ut faciant iuxta sermonem Domini, quem locutus est per manum Moysi.
verses.english: And sacrifice the Passover lambs. Consecrate yourselves and prepare your brethren to act according to the word of the Lord, which He spoke through Moses.

verses.latin: Dedit autem Iosias populo, quod in solemnitate Paschæ opus erat, agnorum et hœdorum, de gregibus universis triginta millia: boum quoque tria millia: et hæc de substantia regis.
verses.english: Josiah also gave to the people, from his own royal possessions, for the celebration of the Passover, thirty thousand lambs and young goats from all the flocks, and three thousand oxen.

verses.latin: Principes quoque eius sponte polliciti sunt, tam populo, quam sacerdotibus et Levitis. Porro Helcias, et Zacharias, et Iehiel principes domus Domini, dederunt sacerdotibus ad faciendum Pascha, pecora duo millia sexcenta, et boves trecentos.
verses.english: His officials also freely offered gifts, both to the people and to the priests and Levites. Furthermore, Hilkiah, Zechariah, and Jehiel, the chiefs of the house of the Lord, gave to the priests for the Passover sacrifice two thousand six hundred sheep and three hundred oxen.

verses.latin: Chonenias autem, et Semeias, et Nathanaël, fratres eius, necnon Hasabias, et Iehiel, et Iozabad, principes Levitarum, dederunt Levitis ad Pascha celebrandum, quinque millia pecorum, et boves quingentos.
verses.english: Also Conaniah, Shemaiah, and Nethanel, his brethren, as well as Hashabiah, Jeiel, and Jozabad, the chiefs of the Levites, gave to the Levites for the celebration of the Passover five thousand sheep and five hundred oxen.

verses.latin: Præparataque sunt omnia, et steterunt sacerdotes in officio suo, et Levitæ in divisionibus suis iuxta mandatum regis.
verses.english: So everything was prepared, and the priests stood in their offices, and the Levites in their divisions, according to the king's command.

verses.latin: Et immolaverunt Pascha: obtuleruntque sacerdotes sanguinem de manibus eorum, et Levitæ pelles.
verses.english: And they sacrificed the Passover lambs. The priests then offered the blood, receiving it from the hands of the Levites, and the Levites took care of the skins.

verses.latin: Et posuerunt holocausta iuxta quod scriptum est in libro Moysi: similiter et de bubalis, sicut mos est.
verses.english: They then set aside the burnt offerings according to what is written in the book of Moses; likewise for the oxen, as is the custom.

verses.latin: Et coctum est Phase igni, sicut lex postulat: holocausta autem elixirunt in lebetibus, et cacabis, et ollis, et festinarunt, et distribuerunt universæ plebi.
verses.english: And they cooked the Passover lambs with fire, as the Law requires. The burnt offerings, however, they boiled in pots, cauldrons, and pans, and they quickly distributed them to all the people.

verses.latin: Et post hæc ipsi et Levitæ paraverunt sibi, et sacerdotibus, quia sacerdotes filii Aaron, in oblatione holocaustorum et adipum morabantur usque ad noctem. Quam ob rem Levitæ sibi et sacerdotibus filiis Aaron paraverunt.
verses.english: After this, the Levites prepared for themselves and for the priests, because the priests, the sons of Aaron, were occupied with offering the burnt offerings and the fat until nightfall. For this reason, the Levites prepared for themselves and for the priests, the sons of Aaron.

verses.latin: Porro cantores filii Asaph, stabant in ordine suo iuxta præceptum David, et Asaph, et Heman, et Idithun prophetarum regis: ianitores vero per singula ostia.
verses.english: Furthermore, the singers, the sons of Asaph, stood in their appointed places according to the command of David, and Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun, the king's prophets. The gatekeepers were also at each gate.

verses.latin: Omni ergo cultu Domini rite celebrato in die illa, ut facerent Pascha, et offerrent holocausta super altare Domini iuxta præceptum regis Iosiæ.
verses.english: So all the service of the Lord was duly celebrated on that day, as they made the Passover and offered burnt offerings upon the altar of the Lord according to the command of King Josiah.

verses.latin: Et fecerunt filii Israel, qui inventi fuerant, Pascha in illo tempore, et solemnitatem azymorum septem diebus.
verses.english: And the children of Israel who were present celebrated the Passover at that time, along with the Feast of Unleavened Bread for seven days.

verses.latin: Non fuit igitur Phase simile huic in Israel, ex diebus Samuelis prophetæ: sed neque quisquam de cunctis regibus Israel tale Pascha fecerat, sicut Iosias exercuit sacerdotibus, et Levitis, et omni Iuda, et Israel, qui repertus fuerat, et habitantibus in Ierusalem.
verses.english: Therefore, there had been no Passover like this in Israel since the days of Samuel the prophet. Nor had any of the kings of Israel celebrated such a Passover as Josiah performed with the priests, the Levites, all Judah, and the Israelites who were present, and those living in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Decimooctavo anno regni Iosiæ, hoc Pascha celebratum est.
verses.english: This Passover was celebrated in the eighteenth year of Josiah's reign.

verses.latin: Postquam igitur hæc omnia Iosias rite conplevit in templo, ascendit Nechao rex Ægypti, ut pugnaret in Charcamis iuxta Euphraten: et egressus est in obviam ei Iosias.
verses.english: After Josiah had duly completed all these things in the temple, Neco, king of Egypt, went up to fight at Carchemish by the Euphrates. And Josiah went out to meet him in battle.

verses.latin: At ille misit ad eum nuntios, dicens: Quid mihi et tibi est, rex Iuda? Non adversum te hodie venio, sed contra aliam domum, ad quam festino: abstine a me, ne interficias te. Deus enim iussit ut festinarem. Desine adversari Deo, qui mecum est, ne forte interficiat te.
verses.english: But Neco sent messengers to him, saying: "What business do I have with you, King of Judah? I am not coming against you today, but against another house, to which I am hastening. Refrain from opposing me, lest you destroy yourself. For God has commanded me to hurry. Stop opposing God, who is with me, lest He destroy you."

verses.latin: Noluit Iosias reverti, sed præparavit contra eum bellum, nec acquievit sermonibus Nechao ex ore Dei: sed ivit ut dimicaret in campo Mageddo.
verses.english: Josiah, however, refused to turn back, but prepared for battle against Neco. He would not listen to the words of Neco, which came from the mouth of God, but went to fight in the plain of Megiddo.

verses.latin: Ibique vulneratus a sagittariis dixit pueris suis: Educite me de prælio, quia graviter vulneratus sum.
verses.english: There, being wounded by archers, he said to his servants: "Take me out of the battle, for I am severely wounded."

verses.latin: Et transtulerunt eum pueri sui de curru in alterum currum, et asportaverunt in Ierusalem, mortuusque est, et sepultus in sepulchris patrum suorum: et omnis Iuda et Ierusalem luxerunt eum.
verses.english: And his servants carried him from his chariot into another chariot and brought him to Jerusalem. He died and was buried in the tombs of his fathers, and all Judah and Jerusalem mourned for him.

verses.latin: Ieremias quoque lamentationem fecit super Iosiam, et omnes cantores atque omnes cantatrices usque in præsentem diem, lamentationes suas super Iosiam recitaverunt, et quasi lex in Israel obtinuit: ecce scriptum est in lamentationibus.
verses.english: Jeremiah also composed a lamentation for Josiah. And all the male and female singers recite their lamentations over Josiah even to this present day, and it became like a custom in Israel. Indeed, it is written in the Lamentations.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Iosiæ, et misericordiæ eius, et opera illius iuxta quod scriptum est in lege Domini.
verses.english: Now the rest of the deeds of Josiah, his acts of devotion, and his works, are written according to what is written in the Law of the Lord.

verses.latin: Opera quoque eius prima et novissima scripta sunt in libro regum Iuda et Israel.
verses.english: Both his former and latter deeds are written in the book of the Kings of Judah and Israel.

verses.latin: Tulit ergo populus terræ Joachaz filium Josiae, et constituit eum regem pro patre suo in Jerusalem.
verses.english: So the people living in the land of Judah took Josiah’s son, Jehoahaz. They then made him king in Jerusalem, to reign in place of his father, Josiah.

verses.latin: Viginti trium annorum erat Joachaz cum regnare cœpisset, et tribus mensibus regnavit in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he began his reign. He only reigned for three months in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Detraxit autem eum rex Ægypti, ne regnaret in Jerusalem: et multavit terram centum talentis argenti, et talento auri.
verses.english: But the king of Egypt removed him from his throne, preventing him from ruling any longer in Jerusalem. And that king imposed a heavy tax on the land: one hundred talents of silver and one talent of gold.

verses.latin: Constituitque regem pro eo Eliacim fratrem ejus, mutato nomine ejus Joakim: ipsum vero Joachaz, tulerat, et adduxerat in Ægyptum.
verses.english: The king of Egypt then made Jehoahaz’s brother, Eliakim, the new king in his place. He changed Eliakim’s name to Jehoiakim. As for Jehoahaz himself, the Egyptian king had taken him away and brought him to Egypt.

verses.latin: Viginti quinque annorum erat Joakim cum regnare cœpisset, et undecim annis regnavit in Jerusalem: fecitque malum coram Domino Deo suo.
verses.english: Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he began his reign. He reigned for eleven years in Jerusalem. He did evil things in the sight of the Lord his God.

verses.latin: Contra hunc ascendit Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, et vinctum catenis duxit in Babylonem.
verses.english: Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, came up against Jehoiakim. He bound him with chains and took him away as a prisoner to Babylon.

verses.latin: Attulit quoque Nabuchodonosor de vasis domus Domini, et posuit ea in templo suo in Babylone.
verses.english: Nebuchadnezzar also took some of the sacred vessels from the Lord’s Temple. He placed these holy items in his own pagan temple in Babylon.

verses.latin: Reliqua autem sermonum Joakim, et abominationum ejus quas operatus est, et quæ inventa sunt in eo, continentur in libro regum Juda et Israël: et regnavit Joachin filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: The rest of the account of Jehoiakim’s reign, including the detestable things he did, and what was found concerning him, are recorded in the Book of the Kings of Judah and Israel. Then his son, Jehoiachin, became king in his place.

verses.latin: Octo annorum erat Joachin cum regnare cœpisset, et tribus mensibus et decem diebus regnavit in Jerusalem: fecitque malum coram Domino.
verses.english: Jehoiachin was eight years old when he began his reign. He reigned for three months and ten days in Jerusalem. He also did evil in the sight of the Lord.

verses.latin: Igente anni tempore, misit rex Nabuchodonosor, et adduxit eum in Babylonem, asportatis simul pretiosissimis vasis domus Domini: regemque constituit Sedeciam patruum ejus super Judam et Jerusalem.
verses.english: At the beginning of the new year, King Nebuchadnezzar sent men and had Jehoiachin brought to Babylon. At the same time, Nebuchadnezzar took away the most precious vessels from the Lord’s Temple. He then appointed Zedekiah, Jehoiachin’s uncle, as the new king over Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Viginti et unius anni erat Sedecias cum regnare cœpisset, et undecim annis regnavit in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he began his reign. He reigned for eleven years in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Fecitque malum in oculis Domini Dei sui, nec rubuit ante faciem Jeremiæ prophetæ, loquentis ad se ex ore Domini.
verses.english: He did evil in the sight of the Lord his God. He did not humble himself before the prophet Jeremiah, even though Jeremiah spoke to him directly from the mouth of the Lord.

verses.latin: Insuper et a rege Nabuchodonosor recessit, qui adjuraverat eum per Deum: et induravit cervicem suam et cor suum, ne reverteretur ad Dominum Deum Israël.
verses.english: Furthermore, Zedekiah also rebelled against King Nebuchadnezzar, who had made him swear an oath of loyalty by invoking God’s name. Zedekiah stubbornly stiffened his neck and hardened his heart, refusing to turn back to the Lord, the God of Israel.

verses.latin: Sed et universi principes sacerdotum, et populus sceleratus, multiplicatis abominationibus, juxta universas consuetudines gentium, polluerunt domum Domini, quam sanctificaverat in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Moreover, all the chief priests and the people in general were utterly wicked. They multiplied their detestable practices, adopting all the abominations of the pagan nations around them. In doing so, they defiled the Lord’s Temple, the very house that God Himself had consecrated in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Mittebat autem Dominus Deus patrum eorum ad illos per manum nuntiorum suorum, de nocte consurgens, et quotidie commonens, eo quod parceret populo suo et habitationi suæ.
verses.english: The Lord, the God of their ancestors, continually sent messengers to His people. He rose early and sent them again and again, warning them daily. He did this because He felt compassion for His people and for His dwelling place, the Temple.

verses.latin: Illi vero subsannabant nuntios Dei, et parvipendebant sermones ejus, illudebantque prophetis: donec irasceretur Dominus contra populum suum, et non esset ultra medicina.
verses.english: But the people mocked God’s messengers. They scorned His words and scoffed at His prophets. They continued this until the Lord’s wrath was so kindled against His people that there was no remedy or cure left for them.

verses.latin: Ideo adduxit super eos regem Chaldæorum, et interfecit juvenes eorum gladio in domo sanctuarii sui, non est misertus adolescentis, et virginis, et senis, nec decrepiti quidem, sed omnes tradidit in manibus ejus.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord brought against them the king of the Chaldeans, Nebuchadnezzar. He slaughtered their young men with the sword right within their own sanctuary, the Temple. He showed no pity for young men, nor for virgins, nor for the elderly, nor even for the very weak. He gave all of them into the hands of the Chaldean king.

verses.latin: Omnia quoque vasa domus Domini, majora et minora, et thesauros templi, et regis, et principum, tradidit cuncta in manibus ejus.
verses.english: All the vessels of the Lord’s Temple—both the large and small ones—and the treasures of the Temple, along with the treasures of the king and his officials, Nebuchadnezzar delivered all of these into the Chaldean king’s hands.

verses.latin: Incenderunt hostes domum Dei, destruxeruntque muros Jerusalem: turres quoque universas combusserunt, et quidquid pretiosum fuerat, demoliti sunt.
verses.english: The enemies, the Chaldeans, set fire to God’s house, the Temple. They tore down the walls of Jerusalem. They burned all the fortified towers and demolished everything that had been valuable and precious.

verses.latin: Quique evaserant gladium, captivi ducti sunt in Babylonem: et fuerunt servi ipsius, et filiorum ejus, donec imperaret rex Persarum.
verses.english: Those who escaped the sword were led away as captives to Babylon. There, they became servants to Nebuchadnezzar and his descendants, until the kingdom of Persia began to reign.

verses.latin: Ut compleretur sermo Domini ex ore Jeremiæ: quoadusque terra frueretur sabbatis suis: cunctis diebus desolationis suæ sabbatum egit, donec implerentur septuaginta anni.
verses.english: This all happened so that the word of the Lord, spoken through the prophet Jeremiah, might be fulfilled. The land of Judah finally enjoyed its Sabbaths. Throughout all the days of its desolation, the land kept Sabbath rest until seventy years were completed, as prophesied.

verses.latin: Anno primo Cyri regis Persarum, ad explendum sermonem Domini, quem locutus fuerat per os Jeremiæ, suscitavit Dominus spiritum Cyri regis Persarum: qui præcepit præconem per omne regnum suum, etiam per scripturam, dicens:
verses.english: In the first year of Cyrus, the king of Persia, in order to fulfill the word of the Lord that He had spoken through Jeremiah, the Lord stirred up the spirit of Cyrus. So Cyrus issued a proclamation throughout his entire kingdom, even in writing, saying:

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Cyrus rex Persarum: Omnia regna terræ dedit mihi Dominus Deus cæli: et ipse præcepit mihi ut ædificarem ei domum in Jerusalem, quæ est in Judæa.
verses.english: “Thus says Cyrus, the king of Persia: ‘The Lord, the God of the universe, has given me all the kingdoms of the earth. He Himself has commanded me to build Him a house of worship in Jerusalem, which is located in Judea.’
